A candidate gets different merit positions for each discipline in which he has applied and will be considered for admission in all applied disciplines. Question: I have qualified GAT, but I haven’t applied in NUST MS program, can I still be considered for MS admission? Scores of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025 are acceptable for NUST MS admissions for Fall 2025 session. Only those candidates are considered who apply through online admission application form at the time of admission. Question: My status is “not appeared in interview / GAT (Gen) Not qualified”. What does it mean? It means either you did not appear for interview in your respective discipline and institute or you were not able to achieve minimum required GAT (Gen) score conducted by NTS.​ Question: If I am not able to acquire NOC within due date to apply for admission, still can I submit Online Admission Application form.

Yes, you can submit your application form within due date, however you have to attach scan copy of your application for NOC forwarded to your concern department.​ | Question: Who should be contacted for the queries regarding admission to the NUST Masters Programs? ​One can contact “MS Section, Registrar Dte” for any information on the following telephone number:- +92 051 90856884 or by email regn_pg@nust.edu.pk, however before calling, please read the FAQ section completely.​ Question: What is the admission requirement for the Masters Programs at NUST? ​The candidate must have 16 years of schooling or 04 years education after FA / FSc / A Level in the relevant field from HEC / PEC recognized Institute. Qualifying GAT / HAT / GNET / GRE / GMAT with minimum score as given in Eligibility Criteria <Eligibility Criteria> is mandatory.​ Question: Do I require to take an entrance test for admission to the NUST Masters programs?

The candidate must qualify GAT (General) conducted by NTS with minimum 50 raw score or Graduate NUST Entrance Test (GNET) conducted by NUST with minimum 50 raw score or Higher Education Aptitude Test (HAT) with minimum 50 raw score conducted by HEC, ETC for admission in MS Programs or GRE (General) conducted by ETS, USA with acceptable score as follows: Description Previous Scale New Scale verbal 400/800 146/170 Analytical Writing 3.5/6.0 3.5/6.0 Quantitative 650/800 151/170 Question: What is the registration process for the Graduate NUST Entry Test (GNET)? Candidates can register for GNET, online on NUST website <Graduate NUST Entry Test (GNET)> Question: When does the admission process for Masters programs start? Initial advertisement of Masters admission is published in national newspapers in the month of March / April every year. Admission process starts/ends in June every year. Exact dates can be checked from NUST website after mid of March every year.

​​ Question: How can I apply for admission to NUST? ​You can apply online for the Masters Programs through NUST website <Admission Announcement> before the deadline intimated through National Newspapers and NUST website.​ Question: Do I have to attach copy of the paid fee challan with the online application? No, You only have to mention the name of the HBL branch and date of deposit in the online form. Question: Can a candidate having B Tech degree apply for admission in Masters Engineering Programs offered at NUST? ​Candidates having B Tech degree are not eligible for admission in Masters Engineering programs at NUST. Question: What are the disciplines in which NUST offers Masters Programs? ​For details on NUST Masters Programs, you may visit our website www.nust.edu.pk for <Programs of Study>. Question: What is the fee structure for Masters Programs? For fee and funding details, please visit our website <Masters Program Fee Structure>.

Question: Are hostel facilities available and what are their charges? Adequate hostel facilities are available, however not everyone can get the hostel at the time of joining. The details regarding hostel and messing charges may be accessed through the link <Hostel Accomodation> Question: Are there any evening Programs at NUST? Many Masters Programs at NUST are scheduled in the Evening. For details, please visit our website www.nust.edu.pk link <Programs of Study> Question: My current degree has not completed, then what should I attach with online application? If your result is awaited, then you should attach the transcript of second last semester attended. You will have to submit your complete result before the commencement of classes. Question: I have been withdrawn from MS program at NUST, can I apply again for MS admission?

Yes, you can apply for MS admission if you have not been withdrawn on disciplinary ground, however your credits which you have done earlier will not be counted. Question: What is the registration process for the NTS organized GAT (General)? One can register for the test, online, on the NTS website www.nts.org.pk. Question: How can I prepare for the GAT (General)? You can consult any of the GRE books available in the market or a reference book published by NTS which is available at all major book shops. Question: Can I transfer my credits earned from other University / Institute? Maximum of 09 CH for MS/MPhil and 12 CH for MBA, postgraduate credits may be considered for transfer from other approved accredited institutes or Foreign reputed Institute of similar quality if they are relevant and appropriate to a Master’s Program in a discipline approved by NUST.

The transfer of credits will only be considered after confirmation of admission and recommendation of Institutions at NUST, where the student would have been admitted.​ Question: Can I apply for admission if I have not yet qualified GAT? Yes, you can apply for Masters admission on the basis of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025, your admission will however be processed further only if you qualify the GAT. Question: ​I have completed and submitted the admission form through online system, however I have not deposited application fee in the stipulated time. Now i am considering to deposit the fee, can i still be considered for admission No, you will not be considered for admission. Application fee invoice can only be generated through online system in the stipulated time. After the closure of online system, invoice cannot be generated, hence fee cannot be paid and one cannot be considered for admission.

Moreover, fee challan if already generated / downloaded cannot be deposited after the due date. Question: I have applied for admission without having qualified GAT. Now my GAT is qualified but the date of depositing application fee is over, can I still deposit application fee and be considered for admission. ​No, you will not be considered for admission, if you havn’t deposited application fee in the stipulated time. Question: Can I apply for admission on the basis of previous GAT General? Yes, you can apply for admission on the basis of any GAT (General) held on or after 1st May 2023 till 31st June 2025. Question: Can I apply for Masters admission if my result is awaited? You can apply for Masters admission provided you are able to submit your complete final result before commencement of classes. Question: Can I apply in more than one programs? You can apply for more than one programs. But you will have to pay admission application fee for each applied discipline.

​ Question: Can I apply for MBA (2 years) if I have no experience? Yes, you can apply for MBA (2 years), however, candidates having experience will be given preference in admission. Question: Can I apply for MS in Electrical / Electronic / Telecomm Engineering program if my Bachelor’s degree is non engineering degree i.e BS/MS Electronics or Telecommunication? You are not eligible for MS Engineering degree in these disciplines with non Engineering Bachelors degree. Question: Can a candidate whose Bachelor degree is not accredited by Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC) apply for Masters admission? Bachelor of engineering degree must be accredited by PEC to be eligible for MS Engineering programs at NUST. However one can apply for non engineering degree programs. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – Can I change my discipline to a discipline which I have not mentioned in the admission application form?

You are not allowed to change the discipline in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – By which date do I have to submit my final result, in case the same is still awaited? The final result is to be submitted before the commencement of classes. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – From which hospital(s) can I get myself medically checked up? The list of hospitals is given on the reverse of the ‘Medical Certificate’ which include:- • All Provincial / District Government Hospitals • All Military Hospitals Question: Do I fall under the expatriate student category? If you are temporarily or permanently residing in a country other than Pakistan, and hold either a Pakistani passport, or dual nationality (one of them being Pakistani), you fall under the expatriate student category. Question: How can I apply at NUST if I am an expatriate student?

An expatriate holding either Pakistani passport or dual nationality can apply for online admission whenever admissions are advertised​. Question: I am a born Pakistani with a foreign passport, can I apply as an expatriate student? An expatriate having single foreign nationality cannot apply for admission as expatriate. However you can apply as international candidate. Question: Can I apply for admission after due date of submission of admission form? You are not allowed to apply for admission after due date. Question: How I can I check my name/status in MS admission at NUST? ​Once the MS admission selection lists are generated, they are uploaded on the NUST website, and a notification is made available under the NUST Admission Quick Links. Additionally, selected candidates will receive an email and SMS notification on the mobile number provided in their application form.

It is however the responsibility of every applicant to check his/her selection status on NUST website during the month of July. ​ Question: How many times admission in MS Programs at NUST offered? Admission in MS Programs is offered during March/April once in a year i.e for Fall Semester only. Question: Can I transfer my credits earned from other university? ​You may transfer credits earned from other university as per NUST policy after securing admission. Question: What is the process of cancellation of admission? The candidate may cancel his / her admission and receive a refund of the tuition fee. For cancellation of admission visit link <Cancellation of Admission> The form for cancellation of admission can be downloaded from link <Refund of Admission Dues>. Question: What is the procedure for migration in NUST from other university? There is no migration policy in MS Programs at NUST.

​ Question: ​Which type of GAT test conducted by NTS is valid for admission and what is the registration process of GAT (Gen) test? GAT (Gen) test conducted by NTS will only be acceptable for MS admission. Special GAT (Gen) test conducted by NTS for other University/Organizations or scholarship will not be considered for admission. To register for GAT (Gen) test visit the NTS website www.nts.org.pk Question: Which type of documents are to be sent to NUST (Registrar Dte) NUST after getting selected in MS Program? Selected candidate has to submit the documents according to the checklist provided online at the time of selection.​ Question: How the selected candidate can submit the required documents to NUST (Registrar Dte)? Selected candidate can submit the documents through email before the last submission date.​ Question: How candidate will be informed whether NUST has received his/her documents? Candidates will be informed through email regarding the submission of documents.

​ Question: Can I change the discipline after submitting the admission form? You are not allowed to make any type of change once the online admission form is submitted. Question: Which documents are required to be attached with the online admission form? Scanned copies of academic documents are to be attached with the online application. Details of the documents are as under: Undergraduate degree(s) along with transcript showing the exact duration. Computerized National Identity Card. Experience certificate (for MBA/EMBA candidates). Higher Education Aptitude Test (HAT) result card (as applicable)​ NOC from employer (for employed candidates). Postgraduate degree(s) along with transcripts showing the exact duration. Matric/equivalent certificate. Question: Can I apply for MS admission at NUST manually? You are not allowed to apply for admission manually. You have to apply online on NUST website. Question: When I have to submit my original documents with NUST?

You are required to submit your original academic documents to the Exam Branch of your respective NUST institution at the time of joining classes. Question: What is the procedure for admission as an international student? Question: Is there any provision of interview if I miss one? You are not allowed to reappear for interview. You are not allowed to change the program in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. Question: Can I apply in more than one programs? You can apply for more than one programs. But you will have to pay admission application fee for each applied discipline.

​ Question: Can I apply for MBA (2 years) if I have no experience? Yes, you can apply for MBA (2 years), however, candidates having experience will be given preference in admission. Question: Can I apply for MS in Electrical / Electronic / Telecomm Engineering program if my Bachelor’s degree is non engineering degree i.e BS/MS Electronics or Telecommunication? You are not eligible for MS Engineering degree in these disciplines with non Engineering Bachelors degree. Question: Can a candidate whose Bachelor degree is not accredited by Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC) apply for Masters admission? Bachelor of engineering degree must be accredited by PEC to be eligible for MS Engineering programs at NUST. However one can apply for non engineering degree programs. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – Can I change my discipline to a discipline which I have not mentioned in the admission application form?

You are not allowed to change the discipline in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – By which date do I have to submit my final result, in case the same is still awaited? The final result is to be submitted before the commencement of classes. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – From which hospital(s) can I get myself medically checked up? The list of hospitals is given on the reverse of the ‘Medical Certificate’ which include:- • All Provincial / District Government Hospitals • All Military Hospitals Question: Do I fall under the expatriate student category? If you are temporarily or permanently residing in a country other than Pakistan, and hold either a Pakistani passport, or dual nationality (one of them being Pakistani), you fall under the expatriate student category. Question: How can I apply at NUST if I am an expatriate student?

An expatriate holding either Pakistani passport or dual nationality can apply for online admission whenever admissions are advertised​. Question: I am a born Pakistani with a foreign passport, can I apply as an expatriate student? An expatriate having single foreign nationality cannot apply for admission as expatriate. However you can apply as international candidate. Question: Can I apply for admission after due date of submission of admission form? You are not allowed to apply for admission after due date. Question: How I can I check my name/status in MS admission at NUST? ​Once the MS admission selection lists are generated, they are uploaded on the NUST website, and a notification is made available under the NUST Admission Quick Links. Additionally, selected candidates will receive an email and SMS notification on the mobile number provided in their application form.

It is however the responsibility of every applicant to check his/her selection status on NUST website during the month of July. ​ Question: How many times admission in MS Programs at NUST offered? Admission in MS Programs is offered during March/April once in a year i.e for Fall Semester only. Question: Can I transfer my credits earned from other university? ​You may transfer credits earned from other university as per NUST policy after securing admission. Question: What is the process of cancellation of admission? The candidate may cancel his / her admission and receive a refund of the tuition fee. For cancellation of admission visit link <Cancellation of Admission> The form for cancellation of admission can be downloaded from link <Refund of Admission Dues>. Question: What is the procedure for migration in NUST from other university? There is no migration policy in MS Programs at NUST.

​ Question: ​Which type of GAT test conducted by NTS is valid for admission and what is the registration process of GAT (Gen) test? GAT (Gen) test conducted by NTS will only be acceptable for MS admission. Special GAT (Gen) test conducted by NTS for other University/Organizations or scholarship will not be considered for admission. To register for GAT (Gen) test visit the NTS website www.nts.org.pk Question: Which type of documents are to be sent to NUST (Registrar Dte) NUST after getting selected in MS Program? Selected candidate has to submit the documents according to the checklist provided online at the time of selection.​ Question: How the selected candidate can submit the required documents to NUST (Registrar Dte)? Selected candidate can submit the documents through email before the last submission date.​ Question: How candidate will be informed whether NUST has received his/her documents? Candidates will be informed through email regarding the submission of documents.

​ Question: Can I change the discipline after submitting the admission form? You are not allowed to make any type of change once the online admission form is submitted. Question: Which documents are required to be attached with the online admission form? Scanned copies of academic documents are to be attached with the online application. Details of the documents are as under: Undergraduate degree(s) along with transcript showing the exact duration. Computerized National Identity Card. Experience certificate (for MBA/EMBA candidates). Higher Education Aptitude Test (HAT) result card (as applicable)​ NOC from employer (for employed candidates). Postgraduate degree(s) along with transcripts showing the exact duration. Matric/equivalent certificate. Question: Can I apply for MS admission at NUST manually? You are not allowed to apply for admission manually. You have to apply online on NUST website. Question: When I have to submit my original documents with NUST?

You are required to submit your original academic documents to the Exam Branch of your respective NUST institution at the time of joining classes. Question: What is the procedure for admission as an international student? For admission of international students visit link <International Students> Question: What is the deadline for submission of GRE (Gen) international/GMAT test? Last date to submit GRE (Gen) International/GMAT test result is May 2025. Question: How I can be informed regarding interviews? You will be informed through email by the respective NUST institute in which you have applied. Question: Can I change my interview date? You are not allowed to change the interview date. Question: Is there any provision of interview if I miss one? You are not allowed to reappear for interview. Question: When 1st selection list will be displayed? 1st selection list will be displayed on NUST website in July 2025. Question: Are there any reserved seats?

​There is no quota system or reserved seats in any MS Program. Question: Does NUST accept HAT test conducted by HEC for scholarships? HEC conducts HAT for admissions and scholarships separately. Only HAT test conducted for admission in MS will be acceptable. Question: After getting admission in MS Program can I change the discipline in which I have not applied? You are not allowed to change the program in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. Question: What is the procedure for change of program if first selected in 1st selection list in one program and then selected in 2nd selection list in other program? Candidate has to submit an application to Registrar Dte (MS Section) requesting for change of program along with selection letter of program offered in 2nd selection and copy of fee voucher already submitted for the program offered in 1st selection list. Question: I am not selected in one applied discipline.

Can I be considered for another discipline in which I have applied? A candidate gets different merit positions for each discipline in which he has applied and will be considered for admission in all applied disciplines. Question: I have qualified GAT, but I haven’t applied in NUST MS program, can I still be considered for MS admission? Scores of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025 are acceptable for NUST MS admissions for Fall 2025 session. Only those candidates are considered who apply through online admission application form at the time of admission. Question: My status is “not appeared in interview / GAT (Gen) Not qualified”. What does it mean? It means either you did not appear for interview in your respective discipline and institute or you were not able to achieve minimum required GAT (Gen) score conducted by NTS.​ Question: If I am not able to acquire NOC within due date to apply for admission, still can I submit Online Admission Application form.

Yes, you can submit your application form within due date, however you have to attach scan copy of your application for NOC forwarded to your concern department.​ Question: Who should be contacted for the queries regarding admission to the NUST Masters Programs? ​One can contact “MS Section, Registrar Dte” for any information on the following telephone number:- +92 051 90856884 or by email regn_pg@nust.edu.pk, however before calling, please read the FAQ section completely.​ Question: What is the admission requirement for the Masters Programs at NUST? ​The candidate must have 16 years of schooling or 04 years education after FA / FSc / A Level in the relevant field from HEC / PEC recognized Institute. Qualifying GAT / HAT / GNET / GRE / GMAT with minimum score as given in Eligibility Criteria <Eligibility Criteria> is mandatory.​ Question: Do I require to take an entrance test for admission to the NUST Masters programs?

The candidate must qualify GAT (General) conducted by NTS with minimum 50 raw score or Graduate NUST Entrance Test (GNET) conducted by NUST with minimum 50 raw score or Higher Education Aptitude Test (HAT) with minimum 50 raw score conducted by HEC, ETC for admission in MS Programs or GRE (General) conducted by ETS, USA with acceptable score as follows: Description Previous Scale New Scale verbal 400/800 146/170 Analytical Writing 3.5/6.0 3.5/6.0 Quantitative 650/800 151/170 Question: What is the registration process for the Graduate NUST Entry Test (GNET)? Candidates can register for GNET, online on NUST website <Graduate NUST Entry Test (GNET)> Question: When does the admission process for Masters programs start? Initial advertisement of Masters admission is published in national newspapers in the month of March / April every year. Admission process starts/ends in June every year. Exact dates can be checked from NUST website after mid of March every year.

​​ Question: How can I apply for admission to NUST? ​You can apply online for the Masters Programs through NUST website <Admission Announcement> before the deadline intimated through National Newspapers and NUST website.​ Question: Do I have to attach copy of the paid fee challan with the online application? No, You only have to mention the name of the HBL branch and date of deposit in the online form. Question: Can a candidate having B Tech degree apply for admission in Masters Engineering Programs offered at NUST? ​Candidates having B Tech degree are not eligible for admission in Masters Engineering programs at NUST. Question: What are the disciplines in which NUST offers Masters Programs? ​For details on NUST Masters Programs, you may visit our website www.nust.edu.pk for <Programs of Study>. Question: What is the fee structure for Masters Programs? For fee and funding details, please visit our website <Masters Program Fee Structure>.

Question: Are hostel facilities available and what are their charges? Adequate hostel facilities are available, however not everyone can get the hostel at the time of joining. The details regarding hostel and messing charges may be accessed through the link <Hostel Accomodation> Question: Are there any evening Programs at NUST? Many Masters Programs at NUST are scheduled in the Evening. For details, please visit our website www.nust.edu.pk link <Programs of Study> Question: My current degree has not completed, then what should I attach with online application? If your result is awaited, then you should attach the transcript of second last semester attended. You will have to submit your complete result before the commencement of classes. Question: I have been withdrawn from MS program at NUST, can I apply again for MS admission?

Yes, you can apply for MS admission if you have not been withdrawn on disciplinary ground, however your credits which you have done earlier will not be counted. Question: What is the registration process for the NTS organized GAT (General)? One can register for the test, online, on the NTS website www.nts.org.pk. Question: How can I prepare for the GAT (General)? You can consult any of the GRE books available in the market or a reference book published by NTS which is available at all major book shops. Question: Can I transfer my credits earned from other University / Institute? Maximum of 09 CH for MS/MPhil and 12 CH for MBA, postgraduate credits may be considered for transfer from other approved accredited institutes or Foreign reputed Institute of similar quality if they are relevant and appropriate to a Master’s Program in a discipline approved by NUST.

The transfer of credits will only be considered after confirmation of admission and recommendation of Institutions at NUST, where the student would have been admitted.​ Question: Can I apply for admission if I have not yet qualified GAT? Yes, you can apply for Masters admission on the basis of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025, your admission will however be processed further only if you qualify the GAT. Question: What is the procedure for change of program if first selected in 1st selection list in one program and then selected in 2nd selection list in other program? Candidate has to submit an application to Registrar Dte (MS Section) requesting for change of program along with selection letter of program offered in 2nd selection and copy of fee voucher already submitted for the program offered in 1st selection list. Question: I am not selected in one applied discipline.

Can I be considered for another discipline in which I have applied? A candidate gets different merit positions for each discipline in which he has applied and will be considered for admission in all applied disciplines. Question: I have qualified GAT, but I haven’t applied in NUST MS program, can I still be considered for MS admission? Scores of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025 are acceptable for NUST MS admissions for Fall 2025 session. Only those candidates are considered who apply through online admission application form at the time of admission. Question: My status is “not appeared in interview / GAT (Gen) Not qualified”. What does it mean? It means either you did not appear for interview in your respective discipline and institute or you were not able to achieve minimum required GAT (Gen) score conducted by NTS.​ Question: If I am not able to acquire NOC within due date to apply for admission, still can I submit Online Admission Application form.

Yes, you can submit your application form within due date, however you have to attach scan copy of your application for NOC forwarded to your concern department.​ | Question: Who should be contacted for the queries regarding admission to the NUST Masters Programs? ​One can contact “MS Section, Registrar Dte” for any information on the following telephone number:- +92 051 90856884 or by email regn_pg@nust.edu.pk, however before calling, please read the FAQ section completely.​ Question: What is the admission requirement for the Masters Programs at NUST? ​The candidate must have 16 years of schooling or 04 years education after FA / FSc / A Level in the relevant field from HEC / PEC recognized Institute. Qualifying GAT / HAT / GNET / GRE / GMAT with minimum score as given in Eligibility Criteria <Eligibility Criteria> is mandatory.​ Question: Do I require to take an entrance test for admission to the NUST Masters programs?

The candidate must qualify GAT (General) conducted by NTS with minimum 50 raw score or Graduate NUST Entrance Test (GNET) conducted by NUST with minimum 50 raw score or Higher Education Aptitude Test (HAT) with minimum 50 raw score conducted by HEC, ETC for admission in MS Programs or GRE (General) conducted by ETS, USA with acceptable score as follows: Description Previous Scale New Scale verbal 400/800 146/170 Analytical Writing 3.5/6.0 3.5/6.0 Quantitative 650/800 151/170 Question: What is the registration process for the Graduate NUST Entry Test (GNET)? Candidates can register for GNET, online on NUST website <Graduate NUST Entry Test (GNET)> Question: When does the admission process for Masters programs start? Initial advertisement of Masters admission is published in national newspapers in the month of March / April every year. Admission process starts/ends in June every year. Exact dates can be checked from NUST website after mid of March every year.

​​ Question: How can I apply for admission to NUST? ​You can apply online for the Masters Programs through NUST website <Admission Announcement> before the deadline intimated through National Newspapers and NUST website.​ Question: Do I have to attach copy of the paid fee challan with the online application? No, You only have to mention the name of the HBL branch and date of deposit in the online form. Question: Can a candidate having B Tech degree apply for admission in Masters Engineering Programs offered at NUST? ​Candidates having B Tech degree are not eligible for admission in Masters Engineering programs at NUST. Question: What are the disciplines in which NUST offers Masters Programs? ​For details on NUST Masters Programs, you may visit our website www.nust.edu.pk for <Programs of Study>. Question: What is the fee structure for Masters Programs? For fee and funding details, please visit our website <Masters Program Fee Structure>.

Question: Are hostel facilities available and what are their charges? Adequate hostel facilities are available, however not everyone can get the hostel at the time of joining. The details regarding hostel and messing charges may be accessed through the link <Hostel Accomodation> Question: Are there any evening Programs at NUST? Many Masters Programs at NUST are scheduled in the Evening. For details, please visit our website www.nust.edu.pk link <Programs of Study> Question: My current degree has not completed, then what should I attach with online application? If your result is awaited, then you should attach the transcript of second last semester attended. You will have to submit your complete result before the commencement of classes. Question: I have been withdrawn from MS program at NUST, can I apply again for MS admission?

Yes, you can apply for MS admission if you have not been withdrawn on disciplinary ground, however your credits which you have done earlier will not be counted. Question: What is the registration process for the NTS organized GAT (General)? One can register for the test, online, on the NTS website www.nts.org.pk. Question: How can I prepare for the GAT (General)? You can consult any of the GRE books available in the market or a reference book published by NTS which is available at all major book shops. Question: Can I transfer my credits earned from other University / Institute? Maximum of 09 CH for MS/MPhil and 12 CH for MBA, postgraduate credits may be considered for transfer from other approved accredited institutes or Foreign reputed Institute of similar quality if they are relevant and appropriate to a Master’s Program in a discipline approved by NUST.

The transfer of credits will only be considered after confirmation of admission and recommendation of Institutions at NUST, where the student would have been admitted.​ Question: Can I apply for admission if I have not yet qualified GAT? Yes, you can apply for Masters admission on the basis of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025, your admission will however be processed further only if you qualify the GAT. Question: ​I have completed and submitted the admission form through online system, however I have not deposited application fee in the stipulated time. Now i am considering to deposit the fee, can i still be considered for admission No, you will not be considered for admission. Application fee invoice can only be generated through online system in the stipulated time. After the closure of online system, invoice cannot be generated, hence fee cannot be paid and one cannot be considered for admission.

Moreover, fee challan if already generated / downloaded cannot be deposited after the due date. Question: I have applied for admission without having qualified GAT. Now my GAT is qualified but the date of depositing application fee is over, can I still deposit application fee and be considered for admission. ​No, you will not be considered for admission, if you havn’t deposited application fee in the stipulated time. Question: Can I apply for admission on the basis of previous GAT General? Yes, you can apply for admission on the basis of any GAT (General) held on or after 1st May 2023 till 31st June 2025. Question: Can I apply for Masters admission if my result is awaited? You can apply for Masters admission provided you are able to submit your complete final result before commencement of classes. Question: Can I apply in more than one programs? You can apply for more than one programs. But you will have to pay admission application fee for each applied discipline.

​ Question: Can I apply for MBA (2 years) if I have no experience? Yes, you can apply for MBA (2 years), however, candidates having experience will be given preference in admission. Question: Can I apply for MS in Electrical / Electronic / Telecomm Engineering program if my Bachelor’s degree is non engineering degree i.e BS/MS Electronics or Telecommunication? You are not eligible for MS Engineering degree in these disciplines with non Engineering Bachelors degree. Question: Can a candidate whose Bachelor degree is not accredited by Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC) apply for Masters admission? Bachelor of engineering degree must be accredited by PEC to be eligible for MS Engineering programs at NUST. However one can apply for non engineering degree programs. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – Can I change my discipline to a discipline which I have not mentioned in the admission application form?

You are not allowed to change the discipline in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – By which date do I have to submit my final result, in case the same is still awaited? The final result is to be submitted before the commencement of classes. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – From which hospital(s) can I get myself medically checked up? The list of hospitals is given on the reverse of the ‘Medical Certificate’ which include:- • All Provincial / District Government Hospitals • All Military Hospitals Question: Do I fall under the expatriate student category? If you are temporarily or permanently residing in a country other than Pakistan, and hold either a Pakistani passport, or dual nationality (one of them being Pakistani), you fall under the expatriate student category. Question: How can I apply at NUST if I am an expatriate student?

An expatriate holding either Pakistani passport or dual nationality can apply for online admission whenever admissions are advertised​. Question: I am a born Pakistani with a foreign passport, can I apply as an expatriate student? An expatriate having single foreign nationality cannot apply for admission as expatriate. However you can apply as international candidate. Question: Can I apply for admission after due date of submission of admission form? You are not allowed to apply for admission after due date. Question: How I can I check my name/status in MS admission at NUST? ​Once the MS admission selection lists are generated, they are uploaded on the NUST website, and a notification is made available under the NUST Admission Quick Links. Additionally, selected candidates will receive an email and SMS notification on the mobile number provided in their application form.

It is however the responsibility of every applicant to check his/her selection status on NUST website during the month of July. ​ Question: How many times admission in MS Programs at NUST offered? Admission in MS Programs is offered during March/April once in a year i.e for Fall Semester only. Question: Can I transfer my credits earned from other university? ​You may transfer credits earned from other university as per NUST policy after securing admission. Question: What is the process of cancellation of admission? The candidate may cancel his / her admission and receive a refund of the tuition fee. For cancellation of admission visit link <Cancellation of Admission> The form for cancellation of admission can be downloaded from link <Refund of Admission Dues>. Question: What is the procedure for migration in NUST from other university? There is no migration policy in MS Programs at NUST.

GAT (Gen) test conducted by NTS will only be acceptable for MS admission. Selected candidate can submit the documents through email before the last submission date.​ Question: How candidate will be informed whether NUST has received his/her documents? Candidates will be informed through email regarding the submission of documents.

Question: Can I apply for admission on the basis of previous GAT General? Yes, you can apply for admission on the basis of any GAT (General) held on or after 1st May 2023 till 31st June 2025. Question: Can I apply for Masters admission if my result is awaited? You can apply for Masters admission provided you are able to submit your complete final result before commencement of classes. Question: Can I apply in more than one programs? You can apply for more than one programs. But you will have to pay admission application fee for each applied discipline.

​ Question: Can I apply for MBA (2 years) if I have no experience? Yes, you can apply for MBA (2 years), however, candidates having experience will be given preference in admission. Question: Can I apply for MS in Electrical / Electronic / Telecomm Engineering program if my Bachelor’s degree is non engineering degree i.e BS/MS Electronics or Telecommunication? You are not eligible for MS Engineering degree in these disciplines with non Engineering Bachelors degree. Question: Can a candidate whose Bachelor degree is not accredited by Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC) apply for Masters admission? Bachelor of engineering degree must be accredited by PEC to be eligible for MS Engineering programs at NUST. However one can apply for non engineering degree programs. You are not allowed to change the discipline in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. The final result is to be submitted before the commencement of classes. Question: Pertaining to Provisionally Selected Students – From which hospital(s) can I get myself medically checked up? If you are temporarily or permanently residing in a country other than Pakistan, and hold either a Pakistani passport, or dual nationality (one of them being Pakistani), you fall under the expatriate student category. Question: How can I apply at NUST if I am an expatriate student?

An expatriate holding either Pakistani passport or dual nationality can apply for online admission whenever admissions are advertised​. The transfer of credits will only be considered after confirmation of admission and recommendation of Institutions at NUST, where the student would have been admitted.​ • Yes, you can apply for Masters admission on the basis of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025, your admission will however be processed further only if you qualify the GAT. • No, you will not be considered for admission. Application fee invoice can only be generated through online system in the stipulated time.

After the closure of online system, invoice cannot be generated, hence fee cannot be paid and one cannot be considered for admission. Moreover, fee challan if already generated / downloaded cannot be deposited after the due date. • ​No, you will not be considered for admission, if you havn’t deposited application fee in the stipulated time. • Yes, you can apply for admission on the basis of any GAT (General) held on or after 1st May 2023 till 31st June 2025. • You can apply for Masters admission provided you are able to submit your complete final result before commencement of classes. • You can apply for more than one programs. But you will have to pay admission application fee for each applied discipline.​ • Yes, you can apply for MBA (2 years), however, candidates having experience will be given preference in admission. • You are not eligible for MS Engineering degree in these disciplines with non Engineering Bachelors degree.

• Bachelor of engineering degree must be accredited by PEC to be eligible for MS Engineering programs at NUST. However one can apply for non engineering degree programs. • You are not allowed to change the discipline in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. • The final result is to be submitted before the commencement of classes. • The list of hospitals is given on the reverse of the ‘Medical Certificate’ which include:- • • All Provincial / District Government Hospitals • All Military Hospitals • If you are temporarily or permanently residing in a country other than Pakistan, and hold either a Pakistani passport, or dual nationality (one of them being Pakistani), you fall under the expatriate student category. • An expatriate holding either Pakistani passport or dual nationality can apply for online admission whenever admissions are advertised​. • An expatriate having single foreign nationality cannot apply for admission as expatriate.

However you can apply as international candidate. • You are not allowed to apply for admission after due date. • ​Once the MS admission selection lists are generated, they are uploaded on the NUST website, and a notification is made available under the NUST Admission Quick Links. Additionally, selected candidates will receive an email and SMS notification on the mobile number provided in their application form. • It is however the responsibility of every applicant to check his/her selection status on NUST website during the month of July. ​ • Admission in MS Programs is offered during March/April once in a year i.e for Fall Semester only. • ​You may transfer credits earned from other university as per NUST policy after securing admission. • The candidate may cancel his / her admission and receive a refund of the tuition fee.

For cancellation of admission visit link <Cancellation of Admission> The form for cancellation of admission can be downloaded from link <Refund of Admission Dues>. • There is no migration policy in MS Programs at NUST.​ • GAT (Gen) test conducted by NTS will only be acceptable for MS admission. Special GAT (Gen) test conducted by NTS for other University/Organizations or scholarship will not be considered for admission. To register for GAT (Gen) test visit the NTS website www.nts.org.pk • Selected candidate has to submit the documents according to the checklist provided online at the time of selection.​ • Selected candidate can submit the documents through email before the last submission date.​ • Candidates will be informed through email regarding the submission of documents.​ • You are not allowed to make any type of change once the online admission form is submitted. • Scanned copies of academic documents are to be attached with the online application.

Details of the documents are as under: Undergraduate degree(s) along with transcript showing the exact duration. • Computerized National Identity Card. • Experience certificate (for MBA/EMBA candidates). • Higher Education Aptitude Test (HAT) result card (as applicable)​ • NOC from employer (for employed candidates). • Postgraduate degree(s) along with transcripts showing the exact duration. • Matric/equivalent certificate. • You are not allowed to apply for admission manually. You have to apply online on NUST website. • You are required to submit your original academic documents to the Exam Branch of your respective NUST institution at the time of joining classes. • For admission of international students visit link <International Students> • Last date to submit GRE (Gen) International/GMAT test result is May 2025. • You will be informed through email by the respective NUST institute in which you have applied. • You are not allowed to change the interview date.

• You are not allowed to reappear for interview. • 1st selection list will be displayed on NUST website in July 2025. • ​There is no quota system or reserved seats in any MS Program. • HEC conducts HAT for admissions and scholarships separately. Only HAT test conducted for admission in MS will be acceptable. • You are not allowed to change the program in which you have not applied or selected at the time of admission. • Candidate has to submit an application to Registrar Dte (MS Section) requesting for change of program along with selection letter of program offered in 2nd selection and copy of fee voucher already submitted for the program offered in 1st selection list. • A candidate gets different merit positions for each discipline in which he has applied and will be considered for admission in all applied disciplines. • Scores of GAT (Gen) to be held in June 2025 are acceptable for NUST MS admissions for Fall 2025 session.

Only those candidates are considered who apply through online admission application form at the time of admission. • It means either you did not appear for interview in your respective discipline and institute or you were not able to achieve minimum required GAT (Gen) score conducted by NTS.​ • Yes, you can submit your application form within due date, however you have to attach scan copy of your application for NOC forwarded to your concern department.

=== EXPATRIATE PhD CANDIDATES === [TABLE START] Admissions in PhD Programme are offered biannually for Spring and Fall Semester. Expatriates who are temporarily or permanently living in a country other than Pakistani and holding either Pakistani or dual nationality can apply for admission to PhD on the basis of GRE (General) International or GAT (General) conducted by NTS Pakistan or Graduated-NUST Entrance Test (G-NET) (if NTS (General) is not offered in the particular discipline). Online admission starts in the month of April and October each year.

Programs EXPATRIATE PhD CANDIDATES Admissions PhD Programs EXPATRIATE PhD CANDIDATES Admissions in PhD Programme are offered biannually for Spring and Fall Semester.

Expatriates who are temporarily or permanently living in a country other than Pakistani and holding either Pakistani or dual nationality can apply for admission to PhD on the basis of GRE (General) International or GAT (General) conducted by NTS Pakistan or Graduated-NUST Entrance Test (G-NET) (if NTS (General) is not offered in the particular discipline). Online admission starts in the month of April and October each year.

=== GRADUATE NUST ENTRY TEST (GNET) === [TABLE START] NET-2025 | Online Registration | Test Schedule Islamabad | Karachi | Quetta Series-1 | 6 Oct – 29 Nov 2024 | 08 Dec 2024 | – Series-2 | 23 Feb – 6 Apr 2025 | 13 Apr 2025 | – Series-3 | 21 Apr – 18 Jun 2025 | 21 & 22 Jun 2025 | 22 Jun 2025 [TABLE END] • GNET Schedule • Distribution of Questions for GNET Quantitative – 35 Questions Verbal – 35 Questions Analytical – 30 Questions • Quantitative – 35 Questions • Verbal – 35 Questions • Analytical – 30 Questions • Time Duration of Test – 02 Hours (120 mins) • GNET Registration Fee – Rs 2000/- (non-refundable/non-transferable) • Computer based Test will be conducted in Islamabad • Paper based Test will be conducted in Karachi and Quetta • Validity of GNET will be 2 years • Candidates are advised to select only those PhD Programs for which they meet the eligibility criteria. • For GNET registration follow the link https://gnet.nust.edu.

• To gain admission, candidates are required to meet the general eligibility criteria as stated above and either submit scores from or choose one of the available admission test options, including: Admission Test Title Administered by Minimum Requirement Graduate -NUST Entrance Test (G-NET) NUST, Pakistan Overall score => 60% GRE (General) Test ETS, USA Quantitative 130/170 Verbal 130/170 Analytical Writing 3.0/6.0 NTS GAT (General) Test NTS, Pakistan Overall Score => 60% HAT Test HEC, Pakistan Overall Score ­=> 60% • ​​​The scores of admission test i.e. GRE/GAT/G-NET and HAT should be attached/mentioned in the application. It may be noted that NUST will only accept the scores of GRE (General) examinations conducted on or after October 01, 2021. The candidates are responsible for providing the copy of scores to NUST. • Candidate who want to appear in one of the aforementioned tests after Joining the classes must clear the test before final exam of first semester. • Research Proposal.

• 10th Grade/ O-Level/ SSC Certificate / DMC or equivalence. • 12th Grade/ A-Level/ HSSC Certificate/DMC or equivalence. • Bachelor’s transcripts and Degree. • MA/MSc (16-year education) transcripts and degree. (if applicable) • MS/MPhil (18-year education) transcript and degree (with CH details including CH of coursework + CH of thesis works). • Copy of Passport • HEC Equivalence for MS/MPhil (for Foreign degree) • Valid Score of GRE (General) conducted by ETS, USA OR GAT-General test conducted by NTS OR HAT test conducted by HEC OR Graduate -NUST Entrance Test (G-NET) conducted by NUST (as applicable). • Tuition fee will be charged on annual basis. • Miscellaneous charges will be charged @USD 34/year. • Subsequent, tuition fee will be paid through challan form generated by Finance Directorate, NUST. The structure and schedule of payment will be intimated to the selected candidates. • The security deposit is payable along with the admission processing fee at the time of admission.

• Aligned with the Government the Government of Pakistan’s commitment to fostering diplomatic ties, and establishing professional connections with friendly nations, as well as supporting the development of countries grappling with underdevelopment or post-conflict situations, diverse scholarship opportunities for PhD degree programs—covering only tuition fees. • NUST offers various scholarships ranging between 25% and 80% on tuition fees for PhD students. • NUST also offers international students Fee Remission scholarship that will adjust their fee to be equivalent to the tuition fee for national students. • All eligible international students can apply, evaluated based on academic profile, financial need, leadership, and community service. • Applicants must submit a 300-400-word personal statement with their admission application, selecting the scholarship option.

• The statement should highlight motivation, career objectives, impact of the scholarship, leadership, and community service. • The Scholarship Application Review Committee considers academic performance, diversity, financial need, leadership, and community service. • The cases of the international students, finally selected for admission at the NUST constituent Schools/Colleges/Centers will be processed for clearance for HEC/Foreign Ministry. • International Students have to obtain NOC from their respective Embassy in Pakistan. • Hostel accommodation for the international students is guaranteed in H-12 campus of NUST. However students have to apply for hostel. These on-campus hostels offer convenient housing for international students. Hostels offer fully furnished bedrooms with an Internet connection and are located within walking distance of schools and cafeterias. If you receive an offer from NUST, we’ll also send you information on how to apply for accommodation.
You should apply for accommodation as soon as possible.

CANDIDATE The following categories can only apply for international seats: Each year, international students interested in joining NUST can submit their applications online through dedicated international student application portal: https://intl-admission.

nust.edu.pk/. The application window for the September intake opens annually in January and for Spring intake the application portal opens in May of the preceding year. For instance, if you aspire to commence your studies in September 2024, we encourage you to initiate your application process from 1st January 2024 and for Spring 2025, you can apply in start application in May 2024. Note: All fees and other charges are subject to revision from time to time. Scholarship Application Process: More information can be accessed at: https://nio.nust.edu.pk/mobility/scholarship-for-international-students/ Telephone: +92-51-90851098 – 75 Email: regn_phd@nust.edu.pk NUST International Office National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), 2nd Floor, Central Library, Sector H-12, Islamabad, Pakistan. Telephone: +92-51-90851443 Email: ddnio.issm@nust.edu.

=== INSTRUCTIONS FOR FILLING ADMISSION FORM === • On visiting www.phdadmission.nust.edu.pk for filling the application form, the candidates will be allotted a password to access the application form after providing their valid e-mail addresses. • A recent photograph of the candidate is required to be uploaded. • If both percentage and CGPA are mentioned on Bachelors/Masters Degree/MPhil Transcript, then only CGPA will be entered. • Eligibility criteria of the programme, for which applying, must be consulted before selecting the preferences. • Candidates will not be considered for the programmes for which they are not eligible. • Candidates can deposit the fee through online deposit, after taking the print of Challan in any branch of HBL. • The candidate will have to upload scanned copies of his/her Research Proposal and all the related documents with the application form. • Please remember your Roll No for all future references.

Admissions PhD Programs FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQs) Admissions PhD Programs FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQs) Admissions PhD Programs FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQs) Admissions PhD Programs FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQs) Question: When Admissions in PhD at NUST are advertised?

Admissions in PhD are advertised semi-annually for spring semester and Fall semester. (nust.edu.pk>Admissions>PhD Programmes>PhD Admissions) Question: Which Documents are required for PhD admission? (1) NOC from the Service HQ if serving in the Armed Forces of Pakistan / NOC from the organization (If employed). (2) Research Proposal. (3) SSC Certificate / DMC or equivalence. (4) HSSC Certificate/DMC or equivalence. (5) Bachelor’s transcripts and Degree. (6) MA/MSc (16-year education) transcripts and degree. (7) MS/MPhil (18-year education) transcript and degree (with CH details including CH of coursework + CH of thesis works) duly verified from HEC. (8) Domicile Certificate. (10) HEC Equivalence for MS/MPhil (for Foreign degree) (11) Copy of passport (for foreigner candidate).

(12) For International/National Students: valid Score of GRE (General) conducted by ETS, USA OR GAT-General test conducted by NTS OR HAT test conducted by HEC OR Graduate -NUST Entrance Test (G-NET) conducted by NUST (as applicable).​​​ Question: If my application is selected at initial scrutiny what will be the next step? ​You will be called for interview and test (if applicable) by the respective institution/department.​ Question: If I cleared my interview/test what will be the next step? ​Your case will be presented in BASR (Board of Advanced Studies and Research) at Main Office, NUST. The committee will make the final decision in light of institution recommendation, eligibility Criteria, relevancy etc.​ Question: What are the stages for selection of PhD candidate Admission are at NUST? ​There are three major steps. ​​It is also mentioned that the student can be rejected at any of the above-mentioned steps.​ Question: How I will be informed if my admission is confirmed?

​You will receive an email by DASR Main Office, NUST. Furthermore, you can call at 051-90851098 during office hours for the update on PhD admission. ​ Question: If I have a very urgent issue and not getting a reply to email what should I do? ​The PhD section. DASR will reply you in due course of time after processing of your request/query. Although you can call at 051-90851098 and 051-90851075 during office hours or visit room 318, PhD Section, DASR, Main Office NUST further details. ​ Question: Is it necessary to clear GAT (General) prior to admission in NUST? Yes, Passing of relevant GAT General test with the valid score is prerequisite for admission in PhD at NUST. However, online application for PhD Admission can be submitted without GAT score. Question: Can I apply for admission if I have not cleared GAT General Test but I have registered for GAT General Test?

Yes, you can process your online application but you have to provide valid result card at PhD Section, DASR Main Office NUST for further processing. Question: What are passing marks in GRE / GAT (General) / HAT / G – NET tests for admission in PhD? For National/International Students​ The following are the tests with minimum score/passing marks required for admission in PhD:- Question: I have got first division in my MPhil degree. Am I eligible to apply for PhD admission? Yes, Candidate having MS/MPhil degree with CGPA > 3.0 out of 4.0 are eligible to apply for admission in PhD Programmes. Question: How can I apply for admission to NUST? On the announcement of admission schedule in National press and website, you can apply online for the desired PhD Programme through NUST website www.nust.edu.pk link ‘http://phdadmission.nust.edu.pk” before the given deadline. Question: Do I have to attach a copy of the paid fee challan with the online application?

You only have to mention the name of the HBL (Habib Bank Limited) branch and date of deposit in the online form. Question: What are the disciplines in which NUST offers PhD Programmes? For details of NUST PhD Programmes you may visit our website www.nust.edu.pk link ‘Admission’->’PhD Programmes‘->’Programmes of Study’. Question: What are the fees for the PhD Programmes? For fee and funding details, please visit our website ‘www.nust.edu.pk” link ‘Admissions’ ‘PhD Programmes’ ‘Fee and Funding‘. Question: What is the registration process for the NTS organized GAT (General)? One can register for the test online on the NTS website www.nts.org.pk Question: I have done DAE (in lieu of FSc), Bachelors of Engineering and MS (Engg). Am I eligible for admission in PhD Programme in relevant engineering discipline? Yes, you are eligible for admission in the PhD programme of relevant engineering discipline.​ Question: Is there any scholarship or financial support to PhD students at NUST?

For more details, kindly check https://nust.edu.pk/admissions/scholarships/ Question: Do I fall under the expatriate student category? ​If you are temporarily or permanently residing in a country other than Pakistan, and hold either a Pakistani passport or dual nationality (one of them being Pakistani), you fall under the expatriate student category. Question: How can I apply at NUST if I am an expatriate student? ​An expatriate holding either Pakistani passport or dual nationality can apply for online admission whenever admissions are advertised Question: I am a born Pakistani with a foreign passport, can I apply as an expatriate student? ​An expatriate having single foreign nationality cannot apply for admission as an expatriate. However, you can apply as an international candidate. Question: Is it mandatory to upload the Research Proposal? ​Yes, it is mandatory to upload research proposal in PDF form.

However, the candidate can change/refine their proposal after admission in NUST PhD Programme. Question: Can I choose any one of two tests, GAT General NTS and GAT General by NUST? NO, you have to qualify either GAT (General) conducted by NTS OR GRE (General) Test conducted by ETS USA OR HAT Test conducted by HEC OR Graduate -NUST Entrance Test (G-NET) conducted by NUST. Question: Is it a candidate’s choice to select/attend either NTS General test or GRE (General) test or HAT Test or Graduate NUST Entrance Test (G-NET)? Yes, the candidate can attend any of the aforementioned tests. However, the tests should be valid at the time of commencement of first semester. Question: What will be the process after submitting online forms? ​Following steps will be informed via email Question: Is it mandatory to upload research proposal for an online application? ​Yes, it is necessary to upload research proposal for online application.
Although, you can refine/change the research proposal after the admission in PhD Programme.

=== FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQS) === • There are three types of financial aid offered by NUST: Need based scholarships. Merit based scholarships / financial assistance. Interest free loans. • Need based scholarships. • Merit based scholarships / financial assistance. • Interest free loans. • Need based scholarships. • Merit based scholarships / financial assistance. • Interest free loans. • Under Graduate (UG) & Masters (MS) candidates apply for financial aid immediately after submitting online admission application. • To apply candidates are required to submit online NUST need Based Financial Aid Application Form (NFAAF). • Due date for submitting NFAAF is the same as that of the online admission application. Due date for MS & UG is tentatively May & June 2022 respectively. Please visit NUST admission portal for exact dates. • Financial Aid Applications will not be accepted separately after due date.

• All UG & Masters candidate(s) are eligible to apply for financial aid​ at the time of admission. • No, financial aid application has no effect on admission decision. • NUST team may visit your house, business premises or carry out inquiry from the surrounding neighbors to ​physically verify facts stated by you while applying for financial aid. Physical Verification may be carried out at any point of time during academic life cycle at NUST. • You do not need to send supporting documents to FAO immediately after submitting NFAAF. • After due processing, FAO will inform you via email to mail the documents in hard form, within a due date. Failure to provide documents within due date will lead to cancellation of NFAAF. • Upon submitting NFAAF, you will be considered for all types of need based scholarships. FAO will inform you incase any additional form / document is required.

• You may attach scan copy of a hand written letter of explanation​ (duly signed by you and your parent / guardian). • Briefly explain reason of not attaching the supporting document and expected date till you will provide the same to Financial Aid Office. • File size of each of the supporting document should be less than 250 kb. Resize the scan copy of supporting document and try uploading the same. • If problem persists, you may forward a screen shot of the error to fao-1@nust.edu.pk. • Scholarship offered is valid for ALL disciplines offered admission in a particular selection list e.g if you secure admission in BS Physics, Chemistry & Maths in the 1st selection list, provisional admission letters wi​ll have the same scholarship offer. • If you have NOT been offered scholarship in any of the disciplines, please write to us at fao-1@nust.edu.pk. • Scholarship is awarded on merit cum need basis i.

e on the basis of a candidates’ position on the financial need scale in a particular selection list. • Scholarship once offered to you may be transferred to ALL other offered disciplines, only if you have already deposited dues to secure admission / scholarship i.e for BS Civil Engineering in 1st selection list in the example above. To transfer scholarship offer to other disciplines, you will be required to give willingness to admission office (ugadmissions@nust.edu.pk , admissions@nust.edu.pk). • Scholarship offered to you- for BS Civil Engg in the example above- will be cancelled incase you do not deposit dues, and vacant slot will be offered in the subsequent selection list on merit cum need basis. • You will be required to inform FAO via email (fao-1@nust.edu.pk) specifically mentioning the following: Section of NFAAF. Sub section of NFAAF. Title of the Field(s) to be amended. Amended​ Values. • Section of NFAAF. • Sub section of NFAAF. • Title of the Field(s) to be amended.

• Amended​ Values. • If necessary, someone from the FAO may contact you on contact numbers (provided in the NFAAF) to acquire additional information from you / family members. • Section of NFAAF. • Sub section of NFAAF. • Title of the Field(s) to be amended. • Amended​ Values. • ​​In fairness to all, NUST expects that parents will pay what they can, and we must assess each parent’s ability to contribute to college costs by reviewing complete financial documents from both parents. • You might explain to the parent, unwilling to submit financial information, that his or her information will remain confidential. Your parent should also know that providing such information no way obligates him or her to contribute to your NUST education. • If you believe your situation is special, please write us a detailed letter of explanation.​ • Deed of agreement is to be forwarded to Financial Aid Office separately​.

• The decision and its review follow the stages outlined below: • The staff at the financial aid office (FAO) checks and reconciles the information on the financial aid form against the documents provided including their tenor and validity; seeking clarifications from the applicant/ student on anomalies, if any. • Applicants are contacted for retrieval of discrepant documents (where necessary). • FAO prepares student evaluation sheets that contain a brief summary of the credentials provided covering all the aspects to be presented to the financial aid committee for final decision. • Shortlisted Candidates are informed to submit supporting documentation in hard form by the deadline specified by the financial aid office. • Interviews / Physical Verifications are conducted where recommended by the committee. • The NUST financial aid committee assesses each case through the evaluation sheet and reviews supporting documents before making their decision which is purely based on need.

• Decision is communicated to the students through an official provisional scholarship award letter. • The Financial Aid Office reserves the right to conduct periodic reviews to ensure the award is granted to the needy students only. • Father / Guardian / Earning Member(s) of the Family will give a Declaration of monthly income from all sources on affidavit to be printed on stamp paper having value > Rs.100, duly attested by Union Councilor & two witnesses. At least one of the witnesses is to be a Govt. officer of BPS 17 or above & the other a close family member well acquainted with your family financial profile. Contact numbers of the witnesses to be mentioned on the affidavit. • Father / Guardian / Earning Member(s) of the Family will give a Declaration of monthly income from all sources (business) on affidavit to be printed on stamp paper having value > Rs.100, duly attested by Union Councilor & two witnesses. At least one of the witnesses is to be a Govt.

officer of BPS 17 or above & the other a close family member well acquainted with your family financial profile. Contact numbers of the witnesses to be mentioned on the affidavit. • Father / Guardian / Earning Member(s) of the Family will give salary certificate and a Declaration of monthly income from all sources (job & Business) on affidavit to be printed on stamp paper having value > Rs.100, duly attested by Union Councilor & two witnesses. At least one of the witnesses is to be a Govt. officer of BPS 17 or above & the other a close family member well acquainted with your family financial profile. Contact numbers of the witnesses to be mentioned on the affidavit. • Father / guardian will a Declaration of monthly income​ from all sources on affidavit to be printed on stamp paper having value > Rs.100, duly attested by Assistant Commissioner Revenue / Union Councilor & two witnesses. At least one of the witnesses is to be a Govt.

officer of BPS 17 or above & the other a close family member well acquainted with your family financial profile. Contact numbers of the witnesses to be mentioned on the affidavit. • Yes, if you receive an outside grant or scholarship or a third-party payment you must report the type and amount to the FAO as and when received. • Only those students, whose financial situation changes drastically, due to unforeseen circumstances e.g. Retirement, death, layoffs from job etc. can apply for financial assistance during the semester/ year through their institutions.​ • The scholarship management committee assesses financial need of all candidates and determines whether or not candidates family has sufficient resources to afford fee at NUST. The need is determined on the basis of the financial credentials submitted by the candidate.

• There is an appeal process in place in which the NUST administration accepts requests from students who have additional information to declare, which may have been missed during the initial assessment.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQS) Q.

How many types of financial aid are offered?​​ Q. When and How to Apply for Financial Aid?​​ Q. Who can apply for financial aid?​​ Q. Does applying for financial aid have any effect on admission application? I have completed my admission application but I have not filled / partially filled the financial aid application and I am not interested to apply for financial aid. Will leaving the financial aid form unfilled / partially filled, effect my admission application?​​ Q. What is meant by physical verification?​​ Q. I have submitted NFAAF and attached soft copies of supporting documents too, do I need to send hard copies of supporting documents? If yes, When?​​ Q. I want to apply for​ other need based scholarships like PEEF, CMEEF KPK, FEF etc. Do I need to submit another application form?​​ Q. I do not have few of the supporting documents. What should i do? I need more time to arrange the supporting documents.

Please allow me to submit NFAAF and provide supporting documents in a few more working days.​​​ Q. I am trying to upload soft copy of the supporting documents but the system is not saving them. What should i do?​​ Q. I have been offered admission in two or more disciplines and have NOT been offered scholarship in ALL of these disciplines. Is this provisional scholarship offer valid for only specific disciplines?​​​ Q. I have secured admission (for example in BS Civil Engineering in 1st selection list) and have been offered need based scholarship. Will this scholarship be transferred to other discipline(s) I am offered admission in subsequent selection list(s). How will the scholarship be transferred to other disciplines? What happens to the scholarship offer if I don’t pay dues now and wait for securing admission in subsequent lists? ​​ Q. My Financial Profile Has Changed After Submission Of NFAAF. How Can I Make Changes In NFAAF After Submission?

OR ​I Have Made Mistakes In The NFAAF. I Cannot Access It After Submission. How Can I Get It Corrected?​​ ​Q. What Happens If My Parents Are Divorced, Separated And One Parent Is Unwilling To Submit Any Information To The Financial Aid Office Or To Contribute Towards My NUST Expenses?​​​ Q. May I Send The Deed Of Agreement In The Same Envelope In Which I Am Sending Admission Documents?​​​ Q. What Is The Need Assessment Process?​​ Q. My Father / Guardian / Earning Member Of The Family Does Not Have A Job. What Type Of Income Certificate Should I Give?​​ Q. My Father / Guardian Does Business. What Type Of Income Certificate Should I Give?​​ Q. My Father / Guardian Does Job And Has A Part Time Business (Agriculture, Taxi, Tuition, Shop Etc). What Type Of Income Certificate Should I Give?​​ Q. Our Monthly Income Is From Agricultural Lands. What Type Of Income Certificate Should I Give?​​​ Q. I Was Awarded A Scholarship From A Private Outside Organization.

Do I Need To Inform Financial Aid Office?​​ Q. Can I Apply F​Or The Financial Aid During The Semester/Year?​​ Q. What Is The Criteria Of Awarding Financial Aid?​​ Q. Can a student appeal for review of the financial assistance decision?

=== INTEREST FREE LOAN (IHSAN TRUST) === [TABLE START] NUST Trust Fund (NTF) in collaboration with Ihsan Trust (IT), has established an “Interest Free Loan facility” for the students of NUST who are not been able to afford their tuition fee. Ihsan Trust (IT) is a non-profit-organization (a charitable Trust), established by Meezan Bank with the aim of providing shariah compliant financial assistance to the needy students seeking higher education in Pakistan. NUST students can apply for interest free loan facility from Ihsan Trust via NUST Trust Fund office. The application can be downloaded from www.ihsantrust.org or the students can visit following office for the application form and any other query. Mr. Atta Ellahi (UDC) Room No. 212, 1st Floor, NUST Trust Fund, Main Office, NUST H-12, Campus, Islamabad Ext. No.

=== NFAAF- DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS === === NFAAF – Documentation Requirements === === Size of Each Attachment === === Scrutiny of Supporting Documents by FAO After Submission Of NFAAF === === For Candidates Requiring Additional Time to Submit or Unable to Submit Supporting Documents === [TABLE START] NFAAF – Documentation Requirements Candidates requiring financial aid will attach soft copy of ALL supporting documents to complete ​the last section of Need Based Financial Aid Application Form (NFAAF). This is a mandatory requirement for completing / submitting NFAAF only. Processing of NFAAF has no effect on the admission application. Checklist of supporting documents will be auto generated on the basis of information provided by the candidate in other sections of NFAAF. Candidates are advised to complete NFAAF well before due date to gain maximum time to arrange supporting documents.

Supporting​ documents of NFAAF may include the following: Income certificates of all earning members of the family which include: Salary slips of last three months for salaried persons. Pension book for retired persons. A certificate/proof/ legal affidavit in case of other type of income. Retirement Order/ Final Settlement Letter in case any one of parents or guardian is retired. Income Tax Returns of all earning members & of business in case of businessman. Bank Statements (for the last 12 months) of all bank accounts in the names of all the family members and in the name of business in case of businessmen. Utility Bills (last month) – Electricity, Gas, Phone and Water. Rental Lease Agreement (if the residence or any other property is being leased for residence or business purposes or if excess property is leased to any other person/ party for income purposes). Copies of Saving Certificates/ Bonds/ Shares/ CDC Statement.

Loan Document(s) of Loan outstanding as a liability (loan sanctioning document & payment plan) and loan receivable from any relative, financial institution, agency or organization. Medical bills/ expenditure related documents (if any of the family member is suffering from any fatal/ serious disease). Please also provide a brief history of the medical ailment. Property ownership documents (house, plots, agricultural land, flat, shops etc.). Allotment letter in case the property has been provided by the employer. Vehicle(s) Registration documents of the vehicles being used by the family. Allotment letter in case the vehicle has been provided by the employer. Mortgage/ Lease document(s) (in case Land, house, car or any other property has been taken/ given on lease). Fee receipts & Fee Concession (Scholarship/Loan) document(s) of sibling(s)/ dependent(s) – from any institution including NUST.

Fee receipt & Fee Concession (Scholarship/Loan) document from the last institution the applicant attended. Domicile Certificate of the applicant only. Copies of CNIC/ B – Form of Applicant and Parents/ Guardian. Picture(s) of the house you are residing in (Outside & Inside View). Any other document(s) demonstrating financial need. Documents will be attested by Govt. officer (BPS 17 or above). Documents forwarded separately (via email, courier, any other means) will not be accepted. Size of Each Attachment Should be less than 250 Kb​. Scrutiny of Supporting Documents by FAO After Submission Of NFAAF Scrutiny of supporting documents will begin after NFAAF has been submitted. Where necessary FAO will ask candidates (via email & web account) to: Remove deficiencies and submit afresh. Provide additional supporting documents. Candidates will log in to their web accounts to attach adequate / additional documents with NFAAF.

It is candidates’ responsibility to remove deficiencies within given time to remain in the scholarship selection process. Candidates are advised to check their emails (all folders including Junk / spam) and web accounts regularly for updates from FAO. Providing false information will lead to cancellation of admission, blacklisting and recovery of dues. For Candidates Requiring Additional Time to Submit or Unable to Submit Supporting Documents Candidates may attach undermentioned requests, in place of supporting document(s) to complete / submit NFAAF: Additional time to submit supporting document(s) due to valid reasons. Exemption from submission of supporting document(s) due to valid reasons. FAO will carry out scrutiny of each request after NFAAF has been submitted​ and inform candidates accordingly.
