=== NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education === Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education NUST thrilled to share that under the highly competitive British Council Disability Inclusion Partnerships (DIP) Grant, a consortium of universities including NUST, Coventry University (UK) and Manchester Metropolitan University (MMU, UK) along with six associated partners including all national centers of Pakistan (NCAI, NCRA, NCBC, NCCS, STEP, NFWWD) has been awarded £25,000!

metadata.title: NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education | NUST

content: This prestigious grant has been awarded to Dr Sara Baber Sial (Principal Investigator) and Dr Alison Halford (Principal Investigator) from the Centre for Computational Science and Mathematical Modelling (CSM), Coventry University; and Co-Principal Investigators Dr Nabeel Anwar from NUST SMME, Dr Farah Rashid from NSHS and Dr Fayyaz from Manchester Metropolitan University, UK. Out of a total 5 grants in 4 countries (Indonesia, Uzbekistan, Kenya and Pakistan) NUST has secured one! The project (Learning4All – A Framework for Disability Inclusion in Research and Education) focuses on disability inclusion in higher education, delivering key outputs such as a high-level study, co-created inclusion principles, disability-inclusive curriculum resources and capacity-building through TOT to promote gender-sensitive inclusivity. This achievement highlights NUST’s commitment to global collaborations and advancing inclusive education.

metadata.title: NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education | NUST

content: NUST thrilled to share that under the highly competitive British Council Disability Inclusion Partnerships (DIP) Grant, a consortium of universities including NUST, Coventry University (UK) and Manchester Metropolitan University (MMU, UK) along with six associated partners including all national centers of Pakistan (NCAI, NCRA, NCBC, NCCS, STEP, NFWWD) has been awarded £25,000! This prestigious grant has been awarded to Dr Sara Baber Sial (Principal Investigator) and Dr Alison Halford (Principal Investigator) from the Centre for Computational Science and Mathematical Modelling (CSM), Coventry University; and Co-Principal Investigators Dr Nabeel Anwar from NUST SMME, Dr Farah Rashid from NSHS and Dr Fayyaz from Manchester Metropolitan University, UK. Out of a total 5 grants in 4 countries (Indonesia, Uzbekistan, Kenya and Pakistan) NUST has secured one!

metadata.title: NUST Secures Prestigious British Council DIP Grant for Disability Inclusion in Higher Education | NUST

content: The project (Learning4All – A Framework for Disability Inclusion in Research and Education) focuses on disability inclusion in higher education, delivering key outputs such as a high-level study, co-created inclusion principles, disability-inclusive curriculum resources and capacity-building through TOT to promote gender-sensitive inclusivity. This achievement highlights NUST’s commitment to global collaborations and advancing inclusive education.

She has been selected under the category of Agricultural Infrastructure and Mechanization, an area vital to the modernization of Pakistan’s farming systems.

content: === NUST Secures Third Position in the National “Fly Your Own Plane” Competition === Top Stories NUST Secures Third Position in the National “Fly Your Own Plane” Competition Top Stories NUST Secures Third Position in the National “Fly Your Own Plane” Competition Top Stories NUST Secures Third Position in the National “Fly Your Own Plane” Competition Top Stories NUST Secures Third Position in the National “Fly Your Own Plane” Competition NUST secured an impressive third position in the national “Fly Your Own Plane” competition at TAAKRA 2025, hosted by UCP Lahore. Represented by a four-member student team from SMME (Aerospace), Ikhlas Jamshaid (team lead), Muzzamil Riaz, Abdullah Qureshi and Muhammad Saad, the team participated in the competition for the first time, competing against 48 teams from across the country. content: === Rector NUST Orientation Visit to Field Admin Dte === Top Stories Rector NUST Orientation Visit to Field Admin Dte Top Stories Rector NUST Orientation Visit to Field Admin Dte Top Stories Rector NUST Orientation Visit to Field Admin Dte Top Stories Rector NUST Orientation Visit to Field Admin Dte Rector NUST Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif has emphasised the pivotal role of quality campus amenities and administrative services in creating a vibrant academic culture. While highlighting the broad contours of an enabling campus environment, the Rector termed NUST one of the most sought-after universities not only for its coveted academic standing but also for its landscaping and all-encompassing facilities. He made these remarks during his maiden visit to the Field Administration Dte at the NUST Islamabad campus.

metadata.title: Rector NUST Orientation Visit to Field Admin Dte | NUST

content: Emphasising the crucial role of sports and requisite infrastructure in promoting physical fitness and holistic development of students, the Rector expressed his commitment to promoting athleticism alongside academic excellence. He also appreciated the transformative impact of campus horticulture and urged greater engagement in green initiatives involving staff, students, and faculty. Sharing his vision for NUST, he reaffirmed the vital role of the administrative services towards ensuring a world-class academic and learning experience. Later, the Rector also interacted with officers and staff in the administration departments, and specifically acknowledged the services of the members long associated with NUST. === PNEC-NUST Hosts Open House & Career Fair 2025 to Strengthen Industry-Academia Linkages === Top Stories PNEC-NUST Hosts Open House & Career Fair 2025 to Strengthen Industry-Academia Linkages Top Stories PNEC-NUST Hosts Open House & Career Fair 2025 to Strengthen Industry-Academia Linkages Top Stories PNEC-NUST Hosts Open House & Career Fair 2025 to Strengthen Industry-Academia Linkages Top Stories PNEC-NUST Hosts Open House & Career Fair 2025 to Strengthen Industry-Academia Linkages The NUST PNEC Open House and Career Fair 2025 was successfully held on 24th May 2025 at the Pakistan Navy Engineering College (PNEC), a constituent college of NUST. The event was graced by Mr. Ahmed Azeem Alvi, President of the SITE Association of Industry, as the Chief Guest. The event witnessed enthusiastic participation from over 150 industry representatives from 75 renowned companies, including 16 Chief Executive Officers (CEOs).

metadata.title: PNEC-NUST Hosts Open House & Career Fair 2025 to Strengthen Industry-Academia Linkages | NUST

content: Final-year students showcased more than 30 innovative projects, reflecting their engineering prowess, creativity, and commitment to solving real-world challenges. Visiting professionals showed keen interest in the student projects and commended the quality and relevance of the work presented. Several companies conducted preliminary job interviews on-site, providing students with valuable employment opportunities ahead of graduation. In addition to student-industry interaction, meaningful discussions were held between faculty members and industry leaders on potential avenues for collaborative research and development, marking a step forward in strengthening industry-academia linkages. content: === NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation === Top Stories NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation Top Stories NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation Top Stories NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation Top Stories NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), in collaboration with the BBC and Global Neighbourhood for Media Innovations, hosted a thought-provoking seminar titled “Tackling Disinformation in a Global Age: A Conversation with BBC Leadership” on May 22, 2025 held at NUST School of Social Sciences and Humanities (S3H). The keynote address was delivered by Jonathan Munro, Global Director and Deputy Chief Executive of BBC News, who emphasized the critical need for accuracy and accountability in modern journalism. “Verify before you publish. Get it right first.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation | NUST

content: If a mistake happens, correct it and own it. Social media moves fast, but facts matter. People need a range of trusted sources,” he urged. Munro was joined by senior editors overseeing BBC operations across Asia, South Asia, Afghanistan and Pakistan, offering attendees insights into how the global media giant counters disinformation at scale. The seminar was chaired by Dr Zafar Mahmood, Principal and Dean, S3H, and also attended by Dr Ashfaque Hassan Khan, Director General of the NUST Institute of Policy Studies (NIPS). Their presence underscored NUST’s continued commitment to cultivating critical thinking and fostering global academic discourse on pressing contemporary challenges. A diverse audience of students, faculty members and university officers actively engaged with the visiting BBC delegation, posing questions and exploring the future of media credibility in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation | NUST

content: The session is part of NUST’s broader initiative to provide its students with access to global thought leaders, encouraging dialogue on media ethics, digital literacy and responsible storytelling in a connected world. National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), in collaboration with the BBC and Global Neighbourhood for Media Innovations, hosted a thought-provoking seminar titled “Tackling Disinformation in a Global Age: A Conversation with BBC Leadership” on May 22, 2025 held at NUST School of Social Sciences and Humanities (S3H). The keynote address was delivered by Jonathan Munro, Global Director and Deputy Chief Executive of BBC News, who emphasized the critical need for accuracy and accountability in modern journalism. “Verify before you publish. Get it right first. If a mistake happens, correct it and own it. Social media moves fast, but facts matter. People need a range of trusted sources,” he urged.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation | NUST

content: Munro was joined by senior editors overseeing BBC operations across Asia, South Asia, Afghanistan and Pakistan, offering attendees insights into how the global media giant counters disinformation at scale. The seminar was chaired by Dr Zafar Mahmood, Principal and Dean, S3H, and also attended by Dr Ashfaque Hassan Khan, Director General of the NUST Institute of Policy Studies (NIPS). Their presence underscored NUST’s continued commitment to cultivating critical thinking and fostering global academic discourse on pressing contemporary challenges. A diverse audience of students, faculty members and university officers actively engaged with the visiting BBC delegation, posing questions and exploring the future of media credibility in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. The session is part of NUST’s broader initiative to provide its students with access to global thought leaders, encouraging dialogue on media ethics, digital literacy and responsible storytelling in a connected world.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Seminar with BBC Leadership on Tackling Global Disinformation | NUST

content: === NUST Hosts PMYP-GYM Outreach Session to Empower Youth for Climate Action === Top Stories NUST Hosts PMYP-GYM Outreach Session to Empower Youth for Climate Action Top Stories NUST Hosts PMYP-GYM Outreach Session to Empower Youth for Climate Action Top Stories NUST Hosts PMYP-GYM Outreach Session to Empower Youth for Climate Action Top Stories NUST Hosts PMYP-GYM Outreach Session to Empower Youth for Climate Action NUST successfully organized the Prime Minister’s Youth Programme (PMYP) and Green Youth Movement (GYM) Outreach Session on April 30, 2025, at the SCEE Seminar Hall, bringing together students, faculty and youth leaders to promote environmental protection and climate action. Dr Muhammad Arshad, Associate Dean SCEE, opened the session by highlighting the critical role of youth in shaping a sustainable future and acknowledged the impact of student-led clubs in promoting environmental awareness.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts PMYP-GYM Outreach Session to Empower Youth for Climate Action | NUST

content: Whereas, Dr Muhammad Irfan, Dean SCEE, highlighted NUST’s leading role in advancing the UN SDGs through environmental research, outreach and sustainability-focused education. Dr Iram Gul, Focal Person of the National Environment Club (NEC) and GYM at NUST, presented the achievements of the clubs, emphasizing their commitment to environmental literacy through numerous sustainability drives and green campus initiatives. Chief Guest, Ms Amnah Batool, MNA and Focal Person for PMYP, commended the clubs’ efforts and urged students to take ownership of climate action. The session concluded with a renewed call for collective action, collaboration and innovation among youth to address pressing global environmental challenges.

content: === 4th National Blind Women’s Cricket Championship 2025 === Top Stories 4th National Blind Women’s Cricket Championship 2025 Top Stories 4th National Blind Women’s Cricket Championship 2025 Top Stories 4th National Blind Women’s Cricket Championship 2025 Top Stories 4th National Blind Women’s Cricket Championship 2025 The 4th National Blind Women’s Cricket Championship 2025 successfully concluded at NUST Cricket Ground, H-12, Islamabad. Four teams—Islamabad, Punjab, AJ&K and Sindh—competed in the tournament, demonstrating exceptional skill and determination. In the final, Punjab chased down AJ&K’s total of 174/9 in just 16 overs, securing a decisive 9-wicket victory to claim the championship title.

metadata.title: 4th National Blind Women's Cricket Championship 2025 | NUST

content: The event was attended by over 100 spectators and was graced by distinguished guests, including Australian High Commission, Neil Hawkins, Executive General Manager, National Team Cricket, Australia, Ben Oliver, CEO Serena Hotels, Aziz Boolani, and Pro-Rector (Planning & Resources) NUST, Muhammad Arif Malik, who presented trophies and awards to the teams. The 4th National Blind Women’s Cricket Championship 2025 successfully concluded at NUST Cricket Ground, H-12, Islamabad. Four teams—Islamabad, Punjab, AJ&K and Sindh—competed in the tournament, demonstrating exceptional skill and determination. content: === The Art of Self-Care: Workshop at Central Library === Top Stories The Art of Self-Care: Workshop at Central Library Top Stories The Art of Self-Care: Workshop at Central Library Top Stories The Art of Self-Care: Workshop at Central Library Top Stories The Art of Self-Care: Workshop at Central Library The 2-day workshop, “The Art of Self-Care,” held at NUST Central Library, offered participants an engaging journey toward mental and physical wellness. Day 1 focused on gardening and mental health, where participants explored the therapeutic benefits of gardening and learned valuable tips to enhance their mental well-being through hands-on activities. Day 2 emphasized physical wellness and personal grooming, featuring an interactive session with a makeup artist who shared practical tips for self-care and confidence building. We thank all the participants for making this event a meaningful step toward fostering wellness and self-empowerment.

metadata.title: The Art of Self-Care: Workshop at Central Library | NUST

content: === NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals === Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals Islamabad – The Professional Development Centre (PDC) at the National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) successfully concluded the Certificate in Educational Leadership & Management program for Balochistan College Principals. The closing ceremony, held on January 6, 2025, was graced by Honourable Madam Minister for Education Raheela Hameed Khan Durrani as the chief guest. She was welcomed by esteemed dignitaries, including the Secretary of Higher Education, Balochistan, and Dr Saeed Ur Rehman, Director General Projects at NUST.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals | NUST

content: Moderated by Dr Saeed Ur Rehman, the ceremony was attended by principals from both male and female colleges, along with senior officials from Balochistan’s education sector. The participants expressed their commitment to applying the leadership and management skills gained through the program to enhance academic and institutional development in their colleges. Dr Saeed Ur Rehman highlighted the importance of collaboration and teamwork in achieving educational goals and emphasized NUST’s commitment to supporting BACT in improving educational, research, and HR facilities in Balochistan. He encouraged the participants to leverage NUST’s ecosystem for positive institutional outcomes. Secretary of Education Hafiz Muhammad Tahir lauded the initiative, calling the NUST-BACT partnership a reflection of mutual respect and cooperation. He also announced plans for a global retreat for Balochistan’s principals.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals | NUST

content: In her address, Honourable Madam Minister for Education Raheela Hameed Khan Durrani urged participants to focus on contributing to their colleges and stressed the importance of education in Balochistan’s prosperity. She reaffirmed her commitment to investing in human development and creating world-class colleges and universities in Balochistan through collaborative efforts. Madam Minister praised the support provided to principals and commended the NUST Professional Development Centre team for their outstanding work. She expressed a strong desire to continue exploring further opportunities for collaboration in similar learning experiences. The ceremony concluded with a shared resolve to build on the achievements of the program, reinforcing the importance of fostering academic excellence and leadership in Balochistan’s higher education institutions.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for Balochistan College Principals | NUST

content: === NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students === Top Stories NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students Top Stories NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students Top Stories NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students Top Stories NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students The Haami Club – an initiative of the University Advancement Office (UAO) at NUST recently launched the “Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024” that spanned across a month. The campaign aimed to support NUST students with verified financial needs, raising vital funds for scholarships that enable deserving students to pursue their academic goals without financial barriers.

metadata.title: NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students | NUST

content: The campaign featured a diverse range of activities, including futsal and basketball tournaments, a social media campaign, and a concert featuring artists Mustafa Zahid and Omer Mukhtar. NUST extends its gratitude to all sponsors, volunteers, and attendees for their generous support, which helped make the campaign a resounding success. Notably, the campaign was executed on zero operational cost, utilizing self-generated funds. The UAO would like to extend immense gratitude to the sponsors who provided both monetary and in-kind support and the overwhelming response by the participants, which helped raise substantial amount of funds for scholarships. Launched in April 2024, the Haami Club is NUST UAO’s pioneering initiative, comprising 180 volunteers dedicated to raising funds for need-based scholarships and promoting awareness among students. The club is currently steered by Ms Hafsa S.

metadata.title: NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students | NUST

content: Ahmad, Manager Corporate Relations, under the leadership of Dr Rizwan Riaz, Pro-Rector for Research, Innovation, and Commercialization (RIC), and Ms Arooba Gillani, Director Advancement and Head of Global Engagements. The Haami Club – an initiative of the University Advancement Office (UAO) at NUST recently launched the “Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024” that spanned across a month. The campaign aimed to support NUST students with verified financial needs, raising vital funds for scholarships that enable deserving students to pursue their academic goals without financial barriers. The campaign featured a diverse range of activities, including futsal and basketball tournaments, a social media campaign, and a concert featuring artists Mustafa Zahid and Omer Mukhtar. NUST extends its gratitude to all sponsors, volunteers, and attendees for their generous support, which helped make the campaign a resounding success.

metadata.title: NUST Haami Fundraising Campaign 2024 Raises Vital Scholarship Funds for Deserving Students | NUST

content: Notably, the campaign was executed on zero operational cost, utilizing self-generated funds. Launched in April 2024, the Haami Club is NUST UAO’s pioneering initiative, comprising 180 volunteers dedicated to raising funds for need-based scholarships and promoting awareness among students. The club is currently steered by Ms Hafsa S. Ahmad, Manager Corporate Relations, under the leadership of Dr Rizwan Riaz, Pro-Rector for Research, Innovation, and Commercialization (RIC), and Ms Arooba Gillani, Director Advancement and Head of Global Engagements.

=== Russian Ambassador Visits NUST === Top Stories Russian Ambassador Visits NUST Top Stories Russian Ambassador Visits NUST Top Stories Russian Ambassador Visits NUST Top Stories Russian Ambassador Visits NUST NUST School of Social Sciences and Humanities (S3H) had the honour of hosting His Excellency, Albert Khorev, Ambassador of the Russian Federation to Pakistan, for an academic session held on April 29, 2025. The Ambassador delivered a thought-provoking address focusing on the historical and evolving dimensions of Pakistan-Russia relations and prospects for future cooperation. Emphasizing the shared values and mutual interests of both nations, he highlighted the growing avenues of partnership in diplomacy, education, trade and regional connectivity. During his visit, the ambassador also met NUST’s Pro-Rector, Dr Osman Hassan.

Dr Zafar Mahmood, Principal & Dean at School of Social Sciences & Humanities, expressed his gratitude to the Ambassador for visiting NUST and delivering an insightful address. NUST School of Social Sciences and Humanities (S3H) had the honour of hosting His Excellency, Albert Khorev, Ambassador of the Russian Federation to Pakistan, for an academic session held on April 29, 2025. The Ambassador delivered a thought-provoking address focusing on the historical and evolving dimensions of Pakistan-Russia relations and prospects for future cooperation. Emphasizing the shared values and mutual interests of both nations, he highlighted the growing avenues of partnership in diplomacy, education, trade and regional connectivity. During his visit, the ambassador also met NUST’s Pro-Rector, Dr Osman Hassan. Dr Zafar Mahmood, Principal & Dean at School of Social Sciences & Humanities, expressed his gratitude to the Ambassador for visiting NUST and delivering an insightful address.

=== Kazakhstani Higher Education Delegation Visits NUST to Explore Strategic Academic Partnerships === Top Stories Kazakhstani Higher Education Delegation Visits NUST to Explore Strategic Academic Partnerships Top Stories Kazakhstani Higher Education Delegation Visits NUST to Explore Strategic Academic Partnerships Top Stories Kazakhstani Higher Education Delegation Visits NUST to Explore Strategic Academic Partnerships Top Stories Kazakhstani Higher Education Delegation Visits NUST to Explore Strategic Academic Partnerships NUST had the honour of hosting a high-level 27-member delegation from Kazakhstan, led by Mr. Tekkali Erkegali from the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of Kazakhstan. The delegation comprised Rectors, Vice Chancellors, Pro Vice Chancellors, and senior officials from eleven leading Kazakhstani universities.

metadata.title: Kazakhstani Higher Education Delegation Visits NUST to Explore Strategic Academic Partnerships | NUST

content: The visit was organized in collaboration with the Higher Education Commission (HEC) of Pakistan as part of efforts to strengthen academic linkages and foster regional collaboration in higher education. The purpose of the visit was to explore comprehensive academic cooperation in areas such as joint degree programs, student and faculty exchanges, collaborative research, innovation, and entrepreneurship. A detailed tour of the NUST campus was provided, including a visit to the National Science and Technology Park (NSTP), where delegates were briefed on ongoing research projects and NUST’s innovation ecosystem. A key highlight of the visit was the signing of a Document of Understanding (DoU) and student exchange agreements between Satbayev University and NUST. Mr. Shalabayev Sapar, Pro-Rector for Administrative, Social and Educational Work, signed on behalf of Satbayev University, while Dr. Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics, signed on behalf of NUST. Speaking on the occasion, Dr.

content: === NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) Visits Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM) === Top Stories NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) Visits Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM) Top Stories NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) Visits Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM) Top Stories NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) Visits Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM) Top Stories NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) Visits Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM) On April 22, 2025, NUST Community Service Club (NCSC), along with students from the Department of Biomedical Sciences, SMME, and faculty sponsor NCSC Ms. Maheen Mumtaz, visited the Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM).

metadata.title: NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) Visits Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM) | NUST

content: The visit aimed to expose students to real-world applications of rehabilitative healthcare and to highlight the critical services provided to individuals and our soldiers with physical disabilities, especially those affected by the war on terror. The group was warmly welcomed by the AFIRM team and given a comprehensive orientation about the institute’s role and impact. Students were introduced to a variety of departments including Occupational Therapy, Pain Management, and the Artificial Limbs and Appliances Center (ALAC). The students also had the opportunity to visit AFIRM’s holistic rehabilitation facilities such as the Hydrotherapy Pool a Halotherapy room featuring a Pink Salt Cave, and an indoor sports facility designed to support physical and psychological recovery. One of the most impactful aspects of the visit was learning about the vocational training programs for amputees, particularly those who lost limbs due to war on terror.

metadata.title: NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) Visits Armed Forces Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine (AFIRM) | NUST

content: These initiatives empower individuals to regain independence and reintegrate into society with dignity. The visit was a deeply enriching experience, providing students with meaningful exposure to the intersection of biomedical sciences and community-centered rehabilitation. content: === Paving the Way for 6G & Supercomputing: China Mobile Delegation Visits NUST === Top Stories Paving the Way for 6G & Supercomputing: China Mobile Delegation Visits NUST Top Stories Paving the Way for 6G & Supercomputing: China Mobile Delegation Visits NUST Top Stories Paving the Way for 6G & Supercomputing: China Mobile Delegation Visits NUST Top Stories Paving the Way for 6G & Supercomputing: China Mobile Delegation Visits NUST Mr Yang Jie, Executive Director and Chairman of China Mobile Communications Corporation (CMCC), along with a high-level delegation, visited the National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) to explore opportunities for collaboration in research, innovation, and emerging technologies. Upon arrival, Pro-Rector Research, Innovation & Commercialisation (RIC), Dr Rizwan Riaz warmly received the guests.

metadata.title: Paving the Way for 6G & Supercomputing: China Mobile Delegation Visits NUST | NUST

content: During a comprehensive briefing on NUST, he emphasised NUST’s strong focus on international collaboration and its robust ecosystem fostering academia-industry linkages. Following the briefing, the delegation toured the National Science & Technology Park (NSTP), engaging with R&D firms and startups developing cutting-edge solutions in AI, Cyber Security, and Ed-Tech. They also visited SINES, Pakistan’s first interdisciplinary research cluster at NUST, and the Center of Emerging Technologies, including the National Center of AI. During the course of visit, both sides engaged in detailed discussions on possible collaborations in emerging technologies, and innovation-driven initiatives. The visiting dignitaries were shown successful examples of industrial collaboration and were proposed similar ideas like labs, projects, trainings, etc to create a meaningful collaboration framework.

metadata.title: Paving the Way for 6G & Supercomputing: China Mobile Delegation Visits NUST | NUST

content: === Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST === Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST Amidst the worsening global challenges of climate change, scarcity of resources, and environmental degradation, the urgency to adopt sustainable practices has never been more critical. The broader implications of environmental crises extend far beyond intra-federation conflicts, affecting geopolitical relations and global peace. In this scenario, the role of premier institutions of higher education to promote climate awareness and find actionable solutions holds paramount significance.

metadata.title: Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST | NUST

content: Rector NUST Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif made these remarks during his maiden visit to NUST Sustainability Office. He called for developing a robust and well-integrated framework towards developing NUST as a role model in sustainable practices, catering to every facet of its environmental footprint. Against the backdrop of ever-increasing stress on water resources, he emphasised the need to take proactive measures to ensure water quality and conservation to address the current and future requirements. By working out a comprehensive strategy, he maintained that the aim should be to not only meet the university’s own water needs but also offer viable solutions to looming water scarcity challenges at large. The Rector also shared his vision for achieving net zero on campus by means of large-scale solarisation and other green initiatives, such as plantation drives, introduction of eco-friendly mobility on campus including use of QR-coded bicycles, etc.

metadata.title: Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST | NUST

content: Terming NUST one of the best reservoirs of knowledge in the country, he encouraged participation of the faculty and researchers in conducting rigorous scrutiny of initiatives in line with the global sustainability standards. He also called for fostering a culture of environmental consciousness both within and outside of the university through awareness campaigns (such as walks) on climate challenges and stewardship. Earlier, the Rector visited NUST Placement Office. Expressing his appreciation for NUST’s coveted standing among the world’s top 100 universities in Employer Reputation, he ascribed the accomplishment to the university’s vibrant knowledge ecosystem. Highlighting the importance of students’ holistic grooming, he laid emphasis on creating opportunities that invoke their latent talents and develop positive attributes making them responsible citizens and sound professionals.

metadata.title: Rector’s Orientation Visits to Offices of Sustainability and Placement at NUST | NUST

content: The Rector also called for building partnerships with leading global employers, enabling them to hire quality human resources from NUST, particularly social scientists well versed in the global and regional geopolitical dynamics. The National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) has once again been ranked as the #1 university in Pakistan in the prestigious QS Sustainability Rankings 2025. This year, NUST demonstrated remarkable progress with a 20-point increase in both Governance and Social metrics, reflecting the institution’s steadfast commitment to fostering a NUSTainable future. These advancements underscore the university’s efforts to drive positive change, not only within its community but also on a broader global scale. Maintaining its position among the world’s leading institutions, NUST continues to exemplify excellence in sustainability. The university remains dedicated to building on this momentum to pave the way for a brighter and more sustainable future. As the year 2024 draws to a close, NUST bids farewell to its esteemed Rector, Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari. A glorious era under his visionary leadership comes to an end as he steps down on December 15th.

The NUST community extends its deepest gratitude for his remarkable contributions to taking NUST to where it stands today. Here is his farewell note of gratitude: Dear NUST Community, Assalam-o Alaikum! I have completed my tenure as Rector NUST on 15th of Dec. It has been an exciting journey over the past four years. I would like to take a moment to reflect and express my gratitude to each member of NUST fraternity for their valuable support and partnership. Serving NUST has indeed been a unique experience and greatest honor of my life. It was a privilege to work with so many creative and talented minds. We have endured numerous challenges, alongside many achievements. Our collective efforts have advanced NUST as a leader in education, research, and innovation. I take immense pride in what our Pro Rectors, faculty, staff, students and alumni have accomplished.

I have no doubt that NUST will continue to grow and excel as an institution of learning that will connect the past with the present and lead the future. As I say farewell to you all, I am pleased to pass the baton to Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif. I have full confidence in his leadership and vision, which I believe will take NUST to even greater success. I will always be a part of your journey, cheering for its successes and offering my support whenever and wherever needed. I feel honoured of serving as your Rector. Wishing you all continued success and progress in the years ahead. With profound regards, Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST The National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) took center stage at the Pakistan Pavilion during COP29 in Baku, Azerbaijan, hosting a dynamic panel discussion that highlighted the country’s advancements in renewable energy, smart agriculture, eco-friendly construction and waste-to-energy solutions.

Held on November 20, 2024, the session highlighted NUST’s pivotal role in driving sustainable innovation and climate action. Moderated by Mr Zia ur Rehman, Head of Sustainability at NUST, the panel featured prominent experts, including Dr Rabia Liaquat, Dr Salman Atif, Dr Majid Ali, and Dr Rafia Mumtaz. The speakers shared transformative ideas and showcased pioneering research being conducted at NUST, reinforcing its position as a leader in green technology and environmental stewardship. Mr Zulfiqar Younas, Additional Secretary at the Ministry of Climate Change & Environmental Coordination, extended special acknowledgment to NUST, commending its progressive initiatives in sustainability and innovation. The discussions emphasized the importance of collaboration among academia, industry and government to tackle environmental challenges and operationalize the Green Technology Hub at NUST.

The session also spotlighted the urgent need for investments and partnerships to advance research, foster startups, and scale sustainable solutions. The session reflected Pakistan’s potential in green technology and reaffirmed NUST’s commitment to driving sustainability and fostering global collaborations for a resilient future. The Clothes Donation Drive (CDD) 2024 successfully concluded with the distribution of over 4,800 donated clothing items to families in need. Organized from 21st November to 5th December, the initiative showcased the university community’s commitment to social welfare and generosity. Clothing collection points were strategically placed at C1, C2 and C3, as well as in designated hostel rooms, ensuring easy access for donors. The drive witnessed overwhelming participation, with students and staff contributing generously. The distribution event was held on Saturday, 7th December, at the F-7 Presbyterian Church of Pakistan.

A team of 30 volunteers from the NUST Community Service Club (NCSC) and 10 volunteers from Wall of Hope ensured smooth operations during the event. Clothing items were carefully sorted by gender and age groups, allowing families to select items according to their specific requirements. This thoughtful approach highlighted the organizers’ commitment to supporting families in a respectful and efficient manner. The success of the drive reflected the university community’s dedication to fostering compassion and addressing societal needs. The Clothes Donation Drive 2024 not only provided much-needed warmth to families during the winter but also reinforced the importance of collective action in creating meaningful impact. The 4th Workshop on Astronomy, Telescopes, and Astrophotography (WATA), organized by the School of Natural Sciences (SNS) at the National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), was held on November 16, 2024, at the Central Library, NUST.

The event successfully brought together a diverse group of students, educators, and astronomy enthusiasts, all united by a shared interest in space exploration. The event featured a variety of interactive modules designed to enhance participants’ understanding of astronomy and space sciences, including Solar Observations, a Space Sciences Exhibition, Virtual Reality experiences, and 3D Printing sessions, all aimed at engaging participants and fostering curiosity about the universe. During the event, the Chief Guest, Prof Dr Osman Hassan, Pro-Rector ACAD, addressed the audience, providing valuable insights on the significance of space sciences. The workshop fostered a deeper understanding of the cosmos, encouraging participants to explore and engage with the field of astronomy. Looking ahead, future WATA events will offer continued opportunities for learning and discovery, further promoting the appreciation of space sciences and their relevance to scientific inquiry.

=== NUST Embraces Eid-ul-Fitr with Joy, Community Spirit & Vibrant Celebrations === Top Stories NUST Embraces Eid-ul-Fitr with Joy, Community Spirit & Vibrant Celebrations Top Stories NUST Embraces Eid-ul-Fitr with Joy, Community Spirit & Vibrant Celebrations Top Stories NUST Embraces Eid-ul-Fitr with Joy, Community Spirit & Vibrant Celebrations Top Stories NUST Embraces Eid-ul-Fitr with Joy, Community Spirit & Vibrant Celebrations In keeping with the spirit of Eid-ul-Fitr, NUST celebrated the holy occasion with a blend of gratitude, togetherness and festivity. Starting with Eid prayers, the day unfolded with Rector NUST Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif warmly greeting the staff on duty and sharing moments of warmth and appreciation. Later, the Pro-Rectors joined students from different countries and remote areas, as well as members of the staff in a series of celebrations, fostering a sense of community and belonging.

metadata.title: NUST Embraces Eid-ul-Fitr with Joy, Community Spirit & Vibrant Celebrations | NUST

content: Earlier at the Chand Raat, the NUST Administration organised bustling Eid bazaars and mehndi stalls at the Southedge Cafe and the residential complex, adding to the festive cheer and creating unforgettable memories. content: === NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup – Lahore === Top Stories NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup – Lahore Top Stories NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup – Lahore Top Stories NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup – Lahore Top Stories NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup – Lahore Zinda Dilaan-e-Lahore spirit was in full swing at the NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup on Saturday, 22nd March 2025, at PAF Skyview & Country Golf Club, Lahore. An incredible 198 NUSTians from all NUST schools/colleges, and diverse professional backgrounds came together for an evening of connection, conversation, and community. The gathering was filled with enriching discussions—alumni shared their experiences, engaged in insightful conversations, and reflected on ways to give back through Dast-e-Karam. NUST Advancement Office team traveled to Lahore to engage with the alumni community, explore new avenues for alumni engagement, and discuss the way forward for impactful initiatives. Special appreciation to Mr. Ali Baig (MCE 2001) and Ms.

metadata.title: NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup – Lahore | NUST

content: Aneeba Aslam (SNS 2019) for their incredible support in making this event a huge success! Zinda Dilaan-e-Lahore spirit was in full swing at the NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup on Saturday, 22nd March 2025, at PAF Skyview & Country Golf Club, Lahore. An incredible 198 NUSTians from all NUST schools/colleges, and diverse professional backgrounds came together for an evening of connection, conversation, and community. The gathering was filled with enriching discussions—alumni shared their experiences, engaged in insightful conversations, and reflected on ways to give back through Dast-e-Karam. NUST Advancement Office team traveled to Lahore to engage with the alumni community, explore new avenues for alumni engagement, and discuss the way forward for impactful initiatives. Special appreciation to Mr. Ali Baig (MCE 2001) and Ms. Aneeba Aslam (SNS 2019) for their incredible support in making this event a huge success!

metadata.title: NUST Alumni Iftar Meetup – Lahore | NUST

=== NUST Participates in WAPDA’s Conference on “Application of AI for Water Resources Planning & Management” === Top Stories NUST Participates in WAPDA’s Conference on “Application of AI for Water Resources Planning & Management” Top Stories NUST Participates in WAPDA’s Conference on “Application of AI for Water Resources Planning & Management” Top Stories NUST Participates in WAPDA’s Conference on “Application of AI for Water Resources Planning & Management” Top Stories NUST Participates in WAPDA’s Conference on “Application of AI for Water Resources Planning & Management” A delegation from the National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) actively participated in a day-long conference on the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) for water resources planning and management.

metadata.title: NUST Participates in WAPDA's Conference on "Application of AI for Water Resources Planning & Management" | NUST

content: The conference, organized by the Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA) at WAPDA House, Lahore, aimed at fostering innovation and exploring AI’s potential in improving the water resources sector. The event gathered eminent scholars, researchers, and students from leading institutions across Pakistan. Representing NUST, Prof. Dr. Muhammad Irfan, Principal & Dean, School of Civil & Environmental Engineering (NUST), delivered a keynote address on ‘Leveraging AI in Water Resources Planning, Engineering & Management.’ In his deliberation, Prof. Dr. Muhammad Irfan emphasized academia’s role in advancing AI application for sustainable water management. He highlighted how NUST has adapted its curriculum to incorporate technological and industrial needs, ensuring that students are equipped with the latest advancements in AI applications. Dr.

metadata.title: NUST Participates in WAPDA's Conference on "Application of AI for Water Resources Planning & Management" | NUST

content: Zafar Iqbal, a faculty member of the NUST Institute of Civil Engineering, presented his paper at the conference titled “AI in Water Resource Management: A Review of Innovations and Challenges.” Additionally, Prof. Dr. Hamza Farooq Gabriel chaired the first session of the conference, contributing to discussions on AI’s impact in the field. A group of 10 students from SCEE-NICE also attended the conference, engaging in insightful discussions on how AI technologies can revolutionize water resource management in Pakistan. Their participation underscored the university’s commitment to knowledge-sharing, innovation, and collaboration with key stakeholders in this crucial domain. content: === NUST Cultural Fest 3.0 celebrated diversity, art, and inclusivity with vibrant showcases and performances === Top Stories NUST Cultural Fest 3.0 celebrated diversity, art, and inclusivity with vibrant showcases and performances Top Stories NUST Cultural Fest 3.0 celebrated diversity, art, and inclusivity with vibrant showcases and performances Top Stories NUST Cultural Fest 3.0 celebrated diversity, art, and inclusivity with vibrant showcases and performances Top Stories NUST Cultural Fest 3.0 celebrated diversity, art, and inclusivity with vibrant showcases and performances NUST Bazm-e-Pakistan brought colours and culture to life with NUST Cultural Fest 3.0 on February 21, 2025, at SCME Ground. The lively Global Village and cultural stalls showcased diverse traditions, while thrilling cultural competitions, won by Gilgit-Baltistan and stunning traditional dress displays made it a day to remember.

metadata.title: NUST Cultural Fest 3.0 celebrated diversity, art, and inclusivity with vibrant showcases and performances | NUST

content: The “Agahi” stall, presented by the Government Special Education Centre Pindi Gheb, stood out as a hub of insightful discussions, raising awareness about inclusivity and showcasing the talents of children with disabilities through their handmade crafts. Meanwhile, in collaboration with NUST Fine Arts Club, a painting competition was held under the theme “Yadon Ka Cinema Ghar,” celebrating unity through art. The day ended on a magical note with a soul-stirring Qawwali performance by the legendary Bakhshi Brothers. content: === Rector NUST Inaugurates Career Connect ’25, Linking 2500 Students with 120+ Employers === Top Stories Rector NUST Inaugurates Career Connect ’25, Linking 2500 Students with 120+ Employers Top Stories Rector NUST Inaugurates Career Connect ’25, Linking 2500 Students with 120+ Employers Top Stories Rector NUST Inaugurates Career Connect ’25, Linking 2500 Students with 120+ Employers Top Stories Rector NUST Inaugurates Career Connect ’25, Linking 2500 Students with 120+ Employers With a view to connecting its final-year students with leading employers from diverse sectors, and helping businesses meet their workforce requirements, NUST Placement Office (NPO) held the highly anticipated “NUST Career Connect ’25 at the university’s main campus on Tuesday. The chief guest, Rector NUST Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif, inaugurated the event. He commended the industry for their overwhelming participation in the career fair to meet their human resource needs from a dynamic pool of NUST graduates.

metadata.title: Rector NUST Inaugurates Career Connect ’25, Linking 2500 Students with 120+ Employers | NUST

content: The Rector also emphasised the need to strengthen academia-industry linkages to nurture enduring and mutually beneficial partnerships. Over 2500 students from various NUST institutions availed the opportunity to interact with representatives from over 120 companies from various sectors. The event sponsors included PTCL/UFONE, Nestle, Jazz, Bestway Cement, Careem, Telenor Microfinance Bank, NADRA, Gaditek, Foodpanda, Reon Energy, Carbonteq, Wateen Telecom, and KIA Lucky Motors. content: === NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for NIMUN’25, Celebrating the Theme “Forging the Future” === Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for NIMUN’25, Celebrating the Theme “Forging the Future” Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for NIMUN’25, Celebrating the Theme “Forging the Future” Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for NIMUN’25, Celebrating the Theme “Forging the Future” Top Stories NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for NIMUN’25, Celebrating the Theme “Forging the Future” Islamabad, January 2025 – The 11th edition of the NUST International Model United Nations (NIMUN’25), a flagship event organized by NUST Business School, concluded with immense enthusiasm and success. The four-day conference saw participation from over 450 delegates hailing from both Pakistan and abroad, engaging them in intellectually stimulating debate sessions, cultural exchanges, and diplomatic engagements, thereby reinforcing the ethos of global collaboration and leadership.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for NIMUN’25, Celebrating the Theme "Forging the Future" | NUST

content: The event kicked off with a grand opening ceremony on January 16, honored by the presence of Mohamed Yahya, UN Resident Coordinator in Pakistan, who underscored the significance of youth involvement in achieving global peace and sustainable development. Dr Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics, and Dr Naukhez Sarwar, Principal & Dean of NUST Business School, commended the organizing team for their efforts in promoting meaningful dialogue and offering an enriching experience for all participants. Throughout the conference, delegates engaged passionately in committee sessions, addressing critical global issues such as climate change, human rights, and international security. These intense debates and discussions provided a platform for young minds to hone their diplomatic skills, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities. One of the key highlights of NIMUN’25 was the Diplomatic Meet, held a day prior to the closing ceremony.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Closing Ceremony for NIMUN’25, Celebrating the Theme "Forging the Future" | NUST

content: This event welcomed dignitaries from various embassies, UN offices, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Pakistan, who observed the debates, shared their insights with delegates, and participated in networking sessions with faculty and students. This meet offered delegates invaluable opportunities to connect with seasoned professionals and deepen their understanding of diplomacy and international affairs. Adding a vibrant cultural dimension to the conference, the much-anticipated Qawwali Night and Cultural Evening infused an air of festivity. Delegates were treated to the mesmerizing sounds of traditional Sufi music and captivating cultural performances, celebrating unity in diversity and fostering bonds beyond the debate chambers. The conference culminated in a grand closing ceremony, graced by Troels Vester, Country Representative of the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC).

content: Islamabad, January 2025 – The 11th edition of the NUST International Model United Nations (NIMUN’25), a flagship event organized by NUST Business School, concluded with immense enthusiasm and success. The four-day conference saw participation from over 450 delegates hailing from both Pakistan and abroad, engaging them in intellectually stimulating debate sessions, cultural exchanges, and diplomatic engagements, thereby reinforcing the ethos of global collaboration and leadership. The event kicked off with a grand opening ceremony on January 16, honored by the presence of Mohamed Yahya, UN Resident Coordinator in Pakistan, who underscored the significance of youth involvement in achieving global peace and sustainable development. Karachi, November 19–22, 2024 – The National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) made its mark at the 12th edition of the International Defence Exhibition and Seminar (IDEAS 2024), held at the Karachi Expo Centre. As a leading institution in technological research and development, NUST’s participation was a highlight, with its pavilion featuring three specialized booths: Defence Technologies, NUST Technologies and Emerging Technologies. The Defence Technologies booth showcased NUST’s advanced research in defense solutions, while the NUST Technologies booth highlighted the university’s contributions to advancements in various technological fields.

metadata.title: NUST Showcases Innovative Technologies at IDEAS 2024! | NUST

content: The Emerging Technologies booth featured innovative projects that reflect the university’s commitment to pushing the boundaries of innovation, from AI-driven solutions to sustainable tech applications. IDEAS 2024 saw a diverse array of local and international delegates from over 70 countries, alongside representatives from national and global organizations. This year’s event set the stage for meaningful collaborations in research and innovation. NUST’s active participation underlined its role in fostering global partnerships, contributing to the growth of defense and technology sectors worldwide. With the event drawing high-level representatives and industry leaders, NUST’s involvement promises to strengthen its position as a key player in the global technological landscape, emphasizing the importance of research-driven innovation for defence and beyond.

=== Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform === Top Stories Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform Top Stories Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform Top Stories Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform Top Stories Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform The rollout event for ConnectEd, the online platform of the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) offering cohort-based and self-paced short courses, was held today, November 19, 2024, at the USPCAS-E seminar hall. The event was chaired by Dr. Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics, and attended by school principals, faculty members, and industry partners.

metadata.title: Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform | NUST

content: Notably, the event was also graced by a delegation from the University of Utah, who played a pivotal role in providing initial training for online course development through Higher Education System Strengthening Activity (HESSA), which is a USAID funded project that aims to reinforce Pakistan’s higher education system by capacity building of HEIs. In his opening remarks, Dr. Awais Kamboh, Dean of NUST ConnectEd, welcomed the distinguished guests and outlined the significance of the new platform. He emphasized that only 13% of students in Pakistan progress to tertiary education, a stark contrast to the global average of 40%. He noted that online learning presents a promising solution to bridge this gap, making higher education more accessible to a wider demographic. Dr.

metadata.title: Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform | NUST

content: Kamboh also highlighted the recent policy shift by the Higher Education Commission (HEC) that supports online bachelor’s programs, reinforcing the role of digital learning in expanding higher education opportunities across the country. Dr. Osman Hasan addressed the audience by underscoring the strategic partnership between NUST and the University of Utah, which has resulted in the training of 21 NUST faculty members and the development of four online courses. Dr. Osman highlighted how the integration of online education will significantly enhance access to NUST programs for students who face geographic, physical, or other barriers to traditional on-campus education. He emphasized that the evolving landscape of education necessitates adaptation, and that NUST is committed to staying at the forefront of this transformation. Dr. Zunaira Saqib, General Manager of Operations at NUST ConnectEd, provided an overview of the platform’s accomplishments to date.

metadata.title: Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform | NUST

content: She outlined the detailed course development process and shared future plans to develop additional courses tailored to meet emerging market demands. Dr. Deborah Keyek-Franssen, Associate Vice President and Dean of University Connected Learning (UCL) at the University of Utah, and Ms. Chante Wilson, Senior Instructional Designer at UCL, offered valuable insights into global trends in online education. They talked about the importance of serving the non-traditional student. They discussed the evolving landscape of digital learning, the best practices for teaching online, and the importance of centralized support systems to ensure the success of online education initiatives at universities. The appreciated how NUST administration provided support for the online initiatives at the highest levels. The event concluded with a reaffirmation of the critical role online education plays in making learning more inclusive, accessible, and adaptable to the diverse needs of students.

metadata.title: Roll out of NUST ConnectEd, online learning platform | NUST

The event was chaired by Dr. Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics, and attended by school principals, faculty members, and industry partners. Notably, the event was also graced by a delegation from the University of Utah, who played a pivotal role in providing initial training for online course development through Higher Education System Strengthening Activity (HESSA), which is a USAID funded project that aims to reinforce Pakistan’s higher education system by capacity building of HEIs.

content: === 43 NUST researchers ranked among world’s top 2% scientists === Top Stories 43 NUST researchers ranked among world’s top 2% scientists Top Stories 43 NUST researchers ranked among world’s top 2% scientists Top Stories 43 NUST researchers ranked among world’s top 2% scientists Top Stories 43 NUST researchers ranked among world’s top 2% scientists As many as 43 research luminaries from the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) have made the nation proud by standing amongst the world’s top 2% scientists from among 100,000 top-of-the-line researchers in 2024, as per Elsevier and Stanford. NUST has consistently made headway in its R&D pursuits, bolstering its way to the top in Pakistan, and building the nation through transformative higher education. NUST is currently ranked #353 in the world, #64 in Asia and among the leading universities of Pakistan, as per QS University Rankings.

metadata.title: 43 NUST researchers ranked among world’s top 2% scientists | NUST

content: The number of NUST researchers featuring among the top 2% scientists globally has increased steadily over the past three years, with nine, 23, and 31 faculty members making to the list published in 2021, 2022, and 2023 respectively. This speaks volumes of the conducive research environment NUST affords for knowledge seekers and creators to make a difference in these epoch-making times. In 2024 43 researchers have made their mark on this prestigious list. The data for ranking is compiled by Stanford University and published by Elsevier. The researchers are ranked based on a composite index factoring in several bibliometrics, including citations, hirsch-index, citations to papers in different authorship positions, etc.

metadata.title: 43 NUST researchers ranked among world’s top 2% scientists | NUST

content: The 43 researchers, with 23 consistently making to the top, are from 10 different institutions of NUST and 15 different disciplines, including Artificial Intelligence, Signal Processing, Materials, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical, Civil Engineering, Nanotechnology, Bio-Medical, Physics, Cyber Security, Computer Science, Design and Manufacturing, Humanities, Mathematics and Fluid Mechanics.

content: === NUST-SEECS, King’s College London, and Warwick University Secure £60K Grant to Develop Pakistan’s First Teaching Excellence Framework === Top Stories NUST-SEECS, King’s College London, and Warwick University Secure £60K Grant to Develop Pakistan’s First Teaching Excellence Framework Top Stories NUST-SEECS, King’s College London, and Warwick University Secure £60K Grant to Develop Pakistan’s First Teaching Excellence Framework Top Stories NUST-SEECS, King’s College London, and Warwick University Secure £60K Grant to Develop Pakistan’s First Teaching Excellence Framework Top Stories NUST-SEECS, King’s College London, and Warwick University Secure £60K Grant to Develop Pakistan’s First Teaching Excellence Framework NUST School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (NUST-SEECS), in collaboration with King’s College London, UK, and Warwick University, UK has successfully secured a grant of GBP 60,000 under the British Council’s Going Global Partnerships for the development of a Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) for Pakistan.

metadata.title: NUST-SEECS, King's College London, and Warwick University Secure £60K Grant to Develop Pakistan's First Teaching Excellence Framework | NUST

content: This initiative will be led by Dr Wilberforce Tabbi from King’s College London, Dr Freeha Azmat from Warwick University in the UK and Professor Dr. Rafia Mumtaz from NUST-SEECS in Pakistan. The grant aims to create innovative teaching frameworks that will enhance the quality of education in both Pakistan and the UK. This collaboration underscores the importance of international partnerships in addressing global educational challenges. It also highlights the shared commitment of King’s College London, Warwick University, UK, and NUST to enhance teaching standards and promote academic excellence across borders. NUST School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (NUST-SEECS), in collaboration with King’s College London, UK, and Warwick University, UK has successfully secured a grant of GBP 60,000 under the British Council’s Going Global Partnerships for the development of a Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) for Pakistan.

content: === NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister === Top Stories NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister Top Stories NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister Top Stories NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister Top Stories NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister Islamabad – The National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST-Islamabad) conferred honorary degree of Doctor of Philosophy upon the Honourable Dato’ Seri Anwar Ibrahim, Malaysia’s Prime Minister during a Special Convocation held at the NUST main campus on Thursday, October 3, 2024. At the occasion, the honourable dignitary also delivered a keynote address on Allama Iqbal, demonstrating a deep understanding of Iqbal’s thought, and its continuing relevance to balanced development, inclusive growth, and individual well-being.

metadata.title: NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister | NUST

content: The Prime Minister said, “I am sincerely thankful for the warmth and hospitality extended to me by the government and people of Pakistan, and I hope that our two nations will continue to grow even closer, forging stronger ties for the future.” Expressing his heartfelt gratitude upon conferment of the doctorate degree honoris causa by NUST, he said, “With great humility, and in the spirit of Iqbal, I accept this honour on behalf of the people of Malaysia as a symbol of the deep intellectual and cultural connection between our nations.” He maintained that it was a profound honour to be at NUST, terming the university a beacon of excellence in education, research and innovation. Addressing the students, he remarked that their presence at NUST is a testament to their intellect, dedication and immense potential. He further said, “Just as Iqbal’s philosophy calls for continual self-improvement, your journey here will shape not only your own future but also the destiny of this nation.

metadata.title: NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister | NUST

content: ” Earlier in his opening remarks, Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, HI (M), Rector NUST, warmly welcomed the Malaysian Prime Minister and other foreign and Pakistani dignitaries to NUST. The Rector acknowledged the exemplary leadership and meritorious accomplishments of the Prime Minister. He also highlighted the strong potential for academic and research collaborations between leading Malaysian and Pakistani universities like NUST. Notable attendees of the event were Federal Minister for Commerce Mr Jam Kamal Khan; Secretary MoST Mr Sajid Baloch; Foreign Secretary Ms Amna Baloch; and a few cabinet members of Malaysia. An overwhelming number of students, senior academics, thought leaders, think tank experts, and media persons attended the Special Convocation. It was also highlighted during the event that Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s book “SCRIPT for a Better Malaysia,” first published in Malaysia in 2022, is being translated into Urdu by a Pakistani university.

metadata.title: NUST confers honorary PhD degree upon Malaysia’s Prime Minister | NUST

=== Zheng He Development Centre NUST 2024 Hosts Signing Ceremony and Training Launch === Top Stories Zheng He Development Centre NUST 2024 Hosts Signing Ceremony and Training Launch Top Stories Zheng He Development Centre NUST 2024 Hosts Signing Ceremony and Training Launch Top Stories Zheng He Development Centre NUST 2024 Hosts Signing Ceremony and Training Launch Top Stories Zheng He Development Centre NUST 2024 Hosts Signing Ceremony and Training Launch The Zheng He Development Centre hosted a landmark event in collaboration with Huawei, marking the signing ceremony of the Zheng He-Huawei ICT Center Project and the official launch of the first training batch of 2024. The event took place at Conference Hall, S3H, NUST Islamabad, bringing together prominent leaders from academia and industry. The ceremony featured distinguished speakers, including Ms.

metadata.title: Zheng He Development Centre NUST 2024 Hosts Signing Ceremony and Training Launch | NUST

content: Xiang Yang, Director of Zheng He Development Centre NUST; Mr Liu Zongyi, Delivery & Service Vice President of Huawei Pakistan; Mr Zhang Biao, CFO of Huawei Pakistan; Mr Zhao Yao, Director of Huawei Pakistan Procurement Dept.; Mr Ghulam Mujtaba, Chief Executive Officer of Netkom; Syed Ahmed Saad, Chief Operating Officer of Netkom; Ms Maryam Abdul Razzaq, HR Head of Turnotech, Mr. Khurram Islam, BSS Director of Turnotech and Mr Muhammad Dawood, Vice President of Zheng He Pakistan. Their presence underscored the importance of this initiative in bridging academic excellence with technological advancements. During her address, Ms Xiang provided an overview of the Zheng He Project, a flagship overseas education initiative endorsed by the China Central Government and overseen by the Jiangsu Province Education Department in collaboration with Suzhou Vocational University and CPEC CCC.

metadata.title: Zheng He Development Centre NUST 2024 Hosts Signing Ceremony and Training Launch | NUST

content: At its core, the Zheng He Development Centre at NUST embodies an Industry-Study-Research Combination Mode, ensuring that students gain practical skills aligned with the evolving demands of local and international industries. The event reached a high point with the announcement of the official launch of Zheng He-Huawei ICT Centers in Peshawar and Lahore. These centers are poised to deliver cutting-edge ICT training, opening transformative opportunities for students across Pakistan. Mr Liu Zongyi, Delivery & Service Vice President of Huawei Pakistan, said that Huawei Pakistan has set up a team of experienced technical experts and designed different courses for the training of students, this collaboration signifies a shared commitment to nurturing education, fostering cultural exchange, and creating pathways for employment. Mr Zhang Biao, CFO of Huawei Pakistan, said that Huawei has always attached great importance to local ICT talent development and cultivation.

content: These talents have become the fresh blood of local enterprises, helping Pakistan’s ICT digital industry flourish. content: === NUST Centre for Counselling and Career Advisory (C3A) Celebrates World Mental Health Day 2024 === Top Stories NUST Centre for Counselling and Career Advisory (C3A) Celebrates World Mental Health Day 2024 Top Stories NUST Centre for Counselling and Career Advisory (C3A) Celebrates World Mental Health Day 2024 Top Stories NUST Centre for Counselling and Career Advisory (C3A) Celebrates World Mental Health Day 2024 Top Stories NUST Centre for Counselling and Career Advisory (C3A) Celebrates World Mental Health Day 2024 World Mental Health Day each year serves as a vital platform for fostering dialogue around mental health issues. This year’s theme, “It is Time to Prioritize Mental Health in the Workplace,” resonated deeply with our commitment to creating an inclusive and supportive environment for all individuals. To mark this day on October 10, 2024, the Centre for Counselling & Career Advisory (C3A) organized a counselling camp for students and faculty.

metadata.title: NUST Centre for Counselling and Career Advisory (C3A) Celebrates World Mental Health Day 2024 | NUST

content: This camp provided personalized support for emotional well-being and career guidance, helping participants navigate personal and professional choices effectively. Engaging stalls featured fun mental health activities, attracting nearly 200 participants. Additionally, awareness booths allowed collaborating organizations to share valuable resources and expertise that enhanced mental health awareness within the NUST community. We were pleased to partner with Rozan, Saving 9, and the Down Syndrome Club, as their participation greatly enriched the event. Together, we made significant advancement in promoting mental health awareness within our community, fostering a more supportive and inclusive environment. World Mental Health Day each year serves as a vital platform for fostering dialogue around mental health issues.

content: === Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar === Top Stories Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar Top Stories Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar Top Stories Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar Top Stories Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar Commending the role of National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) in world-class human capital formation and nation-building, Federal Minister for Energy (Power Division) Sardar Awais Ahmad Khan Leghari underscored the need for sustained government-university collaboration for tackling power sector challenges.

metadata.title: Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar | NUST

content: He made these remarks at a seminar on “Powering a Sustainable Future: Identifying and Solving Challenges in Electricity Generation, Transmission, and Distribution,” organised by NUST US-Pakistan Center for Advanced Studies in Energy (USPCAS-E) and NUST Institute of Policy Studies (NIPS) on October 8, 2024. The seminar was held in collaboration with the Ministry of Energy (Power Division) as part of the latter’s efforts for result-oriented knowledge-based engagement with academia. The minister stressed that power tariff reduction is one of the key priorities of the government which, he remarked, requires comprehensive power sector reforms based on the rationalisation of the overall political economy of power generation and distribution, including the mutually acceptable review of agreements with IPPs. The minister assured the attendees that the government was committed to providing cost-effective electricity to consumers and was in the process of taking practical steps toward that end.

metadata.title: Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar | NUST

content: Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, welcomed the honourable guest upon arrival at the university. He apprised him of the NUST’s key strengths in interdisciplinary collaboration, research, and innovation promotion, highlighting how these attributes have positioned NUST as a leader in advancing knowledge and addressing societal challenges. Other speakers of the seminar included: Mr Syed Moonis Abdullah Alvi, CEO K-Electric; Mr Tauseef Farooqi, former Chairman NEPRA; and Mr Syed Akhtar Ali, former Member, Energy, Planning Commission. The seminar was attended in large numbers by students, researchers, academics, and power sector experts. Commending the role of National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) in world-class human capital formation and nation-building, Federal Minister for Energy (Power Division) Sardar Awais Ahmad Khan Leghari underscored the need for sustained government-university collaboration for tackling power sector challenges.

metadata.title: Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar | NUST

content: He made these remarks at a seminar on “Powering a Sustainable Future: Identifying and Solving Challenges in Electricity Generation, Transmission, and Distribution,” organised by NUST US-Pakistan Center for Advanced Studies in Energy (USPCAS-E) and NUST Institute of Policy Studies (NIPS) on October 8, 2024. The seminar was held in collaboration with the Ministry of Energy (Power Division) as part of the latter’s efforts for result-oriented knowledge-based engagement with academia. The minister stressed that power tariff reduction is one of the key priorities of the government which, he remarked, requires comprehensive power sector reforms based on the rationalisation of the overall political economy of power generation and distribution, including the mutually acceptable review of agreements with IPPs. The minister assured the attendees that the government was committed to providing cost-effective electricity to consumers and was in the process of taking practical steps toward that end.

metadata.title: Federal Minister for Energy Urges Government-University Collaboration to Overcome Power Sector Challenges at NUST Seminar | NUST

content: Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, welcomed the honourable guest upon arrival at the university. He apprised him of the NUST’s key strengths in interdisciplinary collaboration, research, and innovation promotion, highlighting how these attributes have positioned NUST as a leader in advancing knowledge and addressing societal challenges. Other speakers of the seminar included: Mr Syed Moonis Abdullah Alvi, CEO K-Electric; Mr Tauseef Farooqi, former Chairman NEPRA; and Mr Syed Akhtar Ali, former Member, Energy, Planning Commission. The seminar was attended in large numbers by students, researchers, academics, and power sector experts.

=== NUST Placement Office Organizes Career Launchpad Orientation Session === Top Stories NUST Placement Office Organizes Career Launchpad Orientation Session Top Stories NUST Placement Office Organizes Career Launchpad Orientation Session Top Stories NUST Placement Office Organizes Career Launchpad Orientation Session Top Stories NUST Placement Office Organizes Career Launchpad Orientation Session Nust Placement Office collaborated with Career Launchpad to organize a session at NUST. Career Launchpad is an innovative initiative aimed at empowering young professionals with skills essential for the modern workforce, The session, held on October 2, 2024, brought together students, industry leaders and educationists to discuss career development opportunities in Pakistan. Mr. Asif Aziz, President Enterprise Solutions at Jazz, Pakistan, and a leading figure in the telecom industry, was the chief guest of the event.

metadata.title: NUST Placement Office Organizes Career Launchpad Orientation Session | NUST

content: In his keynote speech, he highlighted the importance of skill development programs in bridging the gap between academic knowledge and industry requirements. He stressed the role of platforms like Career Launchpad in preparing students for the challenges of the evolving job market. Career Launchpad, through its comprehensive programs, offers a range of services including career counselling, mentorship, professional networking and training opportunities. These programs are designed to empower students to navigate their careers with confidence and prepare them for leadership roles across various industries. The orientation session also included interactive talks by industry experts, a presentation on Career Launchpad and an open Q&A session where students had the opportunity to engage with professionals from different sectors.
