content: === NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change === Top Stories NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change Top Stories NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change Top Stories NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change Top Stories NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change NUST School of Health Sciences (NSHS) in collaboration with Jhpiego, Pakistan hosted an art competition on climate change and its impact on health and communities. Themed “HER Climate” with HER standing for Healthy Communities & Environment Resilient, the competition sought to engage students in a creative exploration of climate issues through their artwork. The event witnessed exuberant participation from over 100 students, who showcased their creativity while reflecting the crucial intersection of climate and community health. An overwhelming number of faculty and students from NSHS, Bahria University, SZAMBU and Fazia Medical College attended the event.

metadata.title: NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change | NUST

content: Prominent amongst the attendees were Dr Zaeem Zia, District Health Officer Islamabad; Dr Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics, NUST; and Prof Dr Rizwan Ashraf, Principal NSHS. Dr Zaeem highlighted the importance of youth involvement in addressing climate change. He said, “It is essential that we engage young people in the conversations about climate change. Their innovative ideas and perspectives are critical to developing solutions for a sustainable future. The artworks displayed today reflect their commitment to making a difference.” Prof Dr Osman Hasan emphasised the role of universities in promoting environmental awareness. He said that NUST is committed to integrating environmental consciousness into its educational framework. This art competition, he maintained, is a testament to our focus on fostering creativity and responsibility amongst our students, encouraging them to think critically about environmental issues.

metadata.title: NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change | NUST

content: Prof Dr Rizwan Ashraf, Principal NSHS, said, “We are thrilled to host this event aimed at not only showcasing the creative talent of our students but also raising awareness about the impact of climate change. It is through such initiatives that we can inspire the next generation to take it upon themselves to contribute to a healthier planet.” Dr Aminah Khan, Jhpiego’s Country Director, expressed the organisation’s commitment to the cause: Jhpiego recognises the significant role that environmental factors play in community health. By collaborating on this event, we aim to highlight the urgent need for climate action and inspire young people to be proactive in addressing these challenges. Our hope is that these young artists will lead the way in creating a sustainable future. As a token of appreciation, the top three winners of the competition were presented with trophies, certificates, and Jhpiego goody bags.

metadata.title: NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change | NUST

content: NUST School of Health Sciences (NSHS) in collaboration with Jhpiego, Pakistan hosted an art competition on climate change and its impact on health and communities. Themed “HER Climate” with HER standing for Healthy Communities & Environment Resilient, the competition sought to engage students in a creative exploration of climate issues through their artwork. The event witnessed exuberant participation from over 100 students, who showcased their creativity while reflecting the crucial intersection of climate and community health. An overwhelming number of faculty and students from NSHS, Bahria University, SZAMBU and Fazia Medical College attended the event. Prominent amongst the attendees were Dr Zaeem Zia, District Health Officer Islamabad; Dr Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics, NUST; and Prof Dr Rizwan Ashraf, Principal NSHS. Dr Zaeem highlighted the importance of youth involvement in addressing climate change.

metadata.title: NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change | NUST

content: He said, “It is essential that we engage young people in the conversations about climate change. Their innovative ideas and perspectives are critical to developing solutions for a sustainable future. The artworks displayed today reflect their commitment to making a difference.” Prof Dr Osman Hasan emphasised the role of universities in promoting environmental awareness. He said that NUST is committed to integrating environmental consciousness into its educational framework. This art competition, he maintained, is a testament to our focus on fostering creativity and responsibility amongst our students, encouraging them to think critically about environmental issues. Prof Dr Rizwan Ashraf, Principal NSHS, said, “We are thrilled to host this event aimed at not only showcasing the creative talent of our students but also raising awareness about the impact of climate change.

metadata.title: NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change | NUST

content: It is through such initiatives that we can inspire the next generation to take it upon themselves to contribute to a healthier planet.” Dr Aminah Khan, Jhpiego’s Country Director, expressed the organisation’s commitment to the cause: Jhpiego recognises the significant role that environmental factors play in community health. By collaborating on this event, we aim to highlight the urgent need for climate action and inspire young people to be proactive in addressing these challenges. Our hope is that these young artists will lead the way in creating a sustainable future. As a token of appreciation, the top three winners of the competition were presented with trophies, certificates, and Jhpiego goody bags.

metadata.title: NUST and Jhpiego host Art Competition on Climate Change | NUST

content: === NUST successfully concludes COP in My City 2024: Empowering Youth for Climate Action === Top Stories NUST successfully concludes COP in My City 2024: Empowering Youth for Climate Action Top Stories NUST successfully concludes COP in My City 2024: Empowering Youth for Climate Action Top Stories NUST successfully concludes COP in My City 2024: Empowering Youth for Climate Action Top Stories NUST successfully concludes COP in My City 2024: Empowering Youth for Climate Action The “COP in My City Pakistan 2024” event concluded on August 29, 2024, at the SINES Auditorium, NUST, Islamabad. The “COP in My City” initiative is a joint effort under the Climate Change for Youth Road Map of the Ministry of Climate Change, with its successful execution attributed to the strong collaboration between NUST Placement Office (NPO), UNICEF, Prime Minister’s Youth Program and UN Women continues to empower and engage Pakistani youth in climate action and policymaking.

metadata.title: NUST successfully concludes COP in My City 2024: Empowering Youth for Climate Action | NUST

content: The event was a pivotal moment in the COP in My City 2024 journey, marking the closure of the provincial-level competitions across seven regions of Pakistan—Federal, KPK, Punjab, AJK, Sindh, Balochistan and GB. This stage was crucial in selecting the most innovative and impactful climate action solutions from young minds across the country. The winners from these provincial competitions will now move forward to compete in the Grand Finale, scheduled for October 2024. Launched in 2021, the “COP in My City” initiative has seen remarkable growth, expanding from regional initiatives to a national platform. The 2024 chapter focused on increased representation of youth from remote areas and young females, ensuring their voices are amplified in the global climate discourse. The winners of the Grand Finale will have the prestigious opportunity to represent Pakistan at COP29 in Baku, Azerbaijan, later this year.

metadata.title: NUST successfully concludes COP in My City 2024: Empowering Youth for Climate Action | NUST

content: His Excellency, Mr Khazar Farhadov, Ambassador of Azerbaijan to Pakistan, graced the event as the Chief Guest. He commended the initiative for its critical role in empowering youth and fostering a collaborative approach to addressing climate change. The event not only provided a platform for young minds to showcase their innovative ideas for sustainable environmental solutions but also facilitated sustained communication channels between youth, government officials and climate change experts. This ongoing collaboration is crucial for ensuring the younger generation’s inclusion in the policymaking process. The “COP in My City Pakistan 2024” event concluded on August 29, 2024, at the SINES Auditorium, NUST, Islamabad.

The winners from these provincial competitions will now move forward to compete in the Grand Finale, scheduled for October 2024. Launched in 2021, the “COP in My City” initiative has seen remarkable growth, expanding from regional initiatives to a national platform.

content: === Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST === Top Stories Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST Top Stories Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST Top Stories Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST Top Stories Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST Grand Finale & Prize Distribution Ceremony of Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS 2024), a flagship initiative of NUST towards fostering social entrepreneurship, was held at the university’s main campus. The 11th edition of FICS expanded its international footprint to Turkiye and Azerbaijan in partnership with Azerbaijan Technical University and Altinbas University, Turkiye. The robust competition witnessed as many as 800 project submissions from over 30 NUST Schools & Colleges, and national and international institutions.

metadata.title: Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST | NUST

content: Mr Mohyuddin Ahmed Wani, Secretary Ministry of Federal Education & Professional Training, graced the event as chief guest. Prominent amongst others were Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, and Ambassadors and esteemed educationists from Azerbaijan, Turkiye and Brunei Darussalam. The overall national winner of FICS ’24 was Team Harassment Defender. It is an indigenous, female-led initiative that seamlessly integrates hardware and app capabilities to address women’s safety concerns. The winning team was awarded a cash prize of PKR 500,000. In addition, 1st and 2nd runner-ups were awarded cash prizes of PKR 300,000 and PKR 150,000, respectively. Meanwhile, the Global Champion Award of USD 5000 was conferred upon an international team ABC (Amyotrophic Brain Cube) from Azerbaijan State Oil & Industry University. The team stood out amongst international contestants.

metadata.title: Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST | NUST

content: A Special Award was also bestowed upon team Plastigate from NUST School of Civil & Environmental Engineering in the category of SDG 11 (Sustainable Cities & Communities). In addition, a Social Impact Award was won by team Visionary from Azerbaijan Technical University (AzTU), Azerbaijan. The chief guest, Mr Mohyuddin Ahmed Wani, Secretary Ministry of Federal Education & Professional Training, complimented the finalists of FICS ’24 and their mentors, particularly the winners for their ingenious ideas and solutions to address challenges facing the country and beyond. He stressed the need for figuring out the real issues, and subsequently conceiving and materialising innovative ideas for poverty alleviation, disaster risk reduction, and fighting illiteracy in the far-reaches of the country.

metadata.title: Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST | NUST

content: The Federal Secretary also emphasised promotion of cost-efficient technology-driven solutions for catering to the educational needs of the underprivileged segments of the society, highlighting that NUST provides the perfect entrepreneurial ecosystem and a launching pad for innovative startups to thrive, succeed and contribute to the national development. In his address, Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, highlighted that FICS is the university’s flagship project that leverages upon NUST’s comprehensive startup ecosystem towards developing sustainable businesses, while manifesting 4th generation entrepreneurial character of the university. The initiative, he maintained, is aimed at providing brilliant young minds with a chance to convert societal challenges into entrepreneurial opportunities.

metadata.title: Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST | NUST

content: He further said, “Our faculty, in collaboration with our industrial partners, mentor the participants in refining their ideas while creating prototypes, systems, products and devices.” He also highlighted that after a rigorous three-stage competition, the successful entrepreneurial ventures are offered free incubation services at the National Science & Technology Park (NSTP) based at NUST. He made special mention of FICS ’24 marking a historic moment in the relationship between Pakistan, Turkiye, and Azerbaijan, paving the way for enhanced tripartite cooperation in youth entrepreneurship and innovation. FICS is fortunate to have the patronage of diverse industrial partners providing seed fund and cash prizes for promising projects. The sponsors of FICS ’24 included National Radio Telecommunication Company (NRTC), Crescent Steel & Allied Products Ltd (CSAPL), Allied Bank Limited (ABL), Askari Bank Limited, and Central Asian Cellular Forum (CACF) and Alfoze Technologies Pvt. Ltd.

metadata.title: Finding Innovative & Creative Solutions (FICS ’24) concludes at NUST | NUST

content: Knowledge Partners for FICS 2024 included Intellectual Property Office (IPO) Pakistan, Pakistan Software Houses Association for IT and ITES (P@SHA), Change Mechanics Pvt. content: === NUST Internship Programme for International Students === Top Stories NUST Internship Programme for International Students Top Stories NUST Internship Programme for International Students Top Stories NUST Internship Programme for International Students Top Stories NUST Internship Programme for International Students Geared towards fostering global diversity, achieving mutual growth through cultural exchange and opening doors to opportunities for all, NUST Internship Programme for International Students (NIPIS-24) has finally drawn to a close. This year, as many as 15 interns came all the way from Egypt, Ireland, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Türkiye, and the United Kingdom to benefit from the month-long internship.

metadata.title: NUST Internship Programme for International Students | NUST

content: Entailing a 360˚ learning opportunity, NIPIS ’24 delivered a sublime internship experience to international participants, advancing their academic competence, reinforcing their professional skills, and simultaneously offering insights into the rich cultural heritage and exposure to the natural beauty of Pakistan. NUST Placement Office made special arrangements for technical trainings of the international interns, placing them in various NUST schools specialising in Engineering & IT, Applied Biosciences and Social Sciences. The participants engaged in various research projects and attended industry-specific trainings. The programme also facilitated industrial visits to S&P Global, PepsiCo and Pak Steel Re-rolling Mills. Pro-Rector Research, Innovation & Commercialisation (RIC-NUST), Dr Rizwan Riaz, graced the closing ceremony with his presence and distributed certificates among the interns.

metadata.title: NUST Internship Programme for International Students | NUST

content: Speaking to the interns, he said that they are now part of the NUST family, and put accent on warmly greeting them again. He hoped that they would act as ambassadors of Pakistan and NUST, and share the knowledge and experience gained during the internship with their friends and colleagues back home. He also encouraged them to pursue higher studies at NUST. The closing ceremony witnessed captivating testimonials by the interns, highlighting their experiences and accomplishments, and strong connections and cherished memories they made during the course of NIPIS ’24. Geared towards fostering global diversity, achieving mutual growth through cultural exchange and opening doors to opportunities for all, NUST Internship Programme for International Students (NIPIS-24) has finally drawn to a close. content: === Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST === Top Stories Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST Top Stories Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST Top Stories Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST Top Stories Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST The National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) welcomed a senior delegation of the Commonwealth, headed by its Secretary-General Rt Hon Patricia Scotland KC. Chairman Prime Minister’s Youth Programme, Mr Rana Mashood Ahmed Khan, also accompanied the delegation to NUST. The event underscored the joint commitment to fostering innovation, academic excellence, and youth empowerment. Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, warmly received the guests upon arrival.

metadata.title: Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST | NUST

content: In a meeting held in his office, the Rector touched upon various facets of NUST’s knowledge ecosystem that have contributed to bringing it among the league of world’s leading higher education institutions. He, inter alia, highlighted one of the flagship initiatives of NUST – the establishment and expansion of Pakistan’s first National Science & Technology Park (NSTP). Leveraging the university’s core intellectual and technological strengths as well as its unique position in the global academia, the Rector said that NSTP has been focusing on eight diverse thematic areas, encompassing sectors such as education, health, energy, smart technologies, etc. He also highlighted exceptional entrepreneurship and investment opportunities available at NSTP.

metadata.title: Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST | NUST

content: In her remarks, the Commonwealth Secretary General Patricia Scotland said that NUST stands as an epitome of excellence in higher education, research and innovation in Pakistan and beyond, emphasising the crucial importance of such institutions in human resource development, particularly the youth. She said that the Commonwealth gives immense importance to education and initiatives for its promotion. She maintained that technology has changed the world rapidly, and it is imperative that the future generations be equipped with sound technological knowledge and skills to navigate future challenges. Chairman PM’s Youth Programme emphasised the government’s resolve and initiatives to ensure educational equity in the length and breadth of the country. Following the meeting, the Secretary General and the Chairman engaged in an interactive session with NUST faculty members and students, and later visited the S&T Park.

metadata.title: Secretary-General Commonwealth, and Chairman PM’s Youth Programme visits NUST | NUST

content: === Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia Visits NUST === Top Stories Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia Visits NUST Top Stories Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia Visits NUST Top Stories Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia Visits NUST Top Stories Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia Visits NUST Islamabad– The National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) welcomed His Excellency Mr Murad Baseer, Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia, on January 2, 2025, for a high-level visit aimed at fostering international collaboration and strengthening educational ties with the African region. During the visit, H.E. Mr Murad Baseer engaged in a productive discussion chaired by Dr Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics at NUST, alongside senior university officials.

metadata.title: Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia Visits NUST | NUST

content: The Ambassador highlighted six critical sectors for growth in Africa: energy, mining, tourism, agriculture, health and industrial and manufacturing engineering. He emphasized the importance of capacity building in these areas and identified avenues for mutual collaboration and development. In a meeting with Dr Awais Mehmood Kamboh, Director of Quality Assurance and NUST International Office (NIO), the Ambassador expressed his commitment to promoting NUST among students in Zimbabwe. Recognizing NUST’s academic excellence and innovative research capabilities, he underscored the university as a premier choice for higher education. To facilitate educational exchange, discussions included the possibility of allocating scholarships for students from Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia. H.E. Mr Murad Baseer also showed his support to connect NUST with leading universities in Zimbabwe to streamline the admission process and promote collaboration.

metadata.title: Ambassador of Pakistan to Zimbabwe, Namibia and Zambia Visits NUST | NUST

content: === Rector’s Orientation Visit to S3H === Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to S3H Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to S3H Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to S3H Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to S3H As part of his ongoing visits to NUST institutions, Rector NUST Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif visited NUST School of Social Sciences & Humanities (S3H) on December 31, 2024. Upon his arrival, Dr Zahid was warmly received by Pro Rector Academics, Dr Osman Hasan, and Principal S3H, Dr Zafar Mahmood. The visit began with a meeting at the Principal office, followed by a comprehensive briefing on S3H. The Rector then visited classrooms, faculty workspaces, Labs and facilities including Non-linear editing lab, TV Studio, and radio studio. Later, Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif addressed the entire faculty of S3H. He emphasized the importance of social sciences and the critical role they play to promote change.

metadata.title: Rector's Orientation Visit to S3H | NUST

content: “Social Scientists can change the society as they can change the societal structures,” he said. As educators and social scientists, we must ensure our work leads to promoting harmony, which in turn will establish peace, as both are pre-requisites to prosperity, he added. Putting accent on the great responsibility attached to the noble profession of teaching, he reiterated that education without values is like a body without soul, hence the education imparted to students must be wholesome, inculcating both academic competence and essential sociocultural values. He also praised the efforts of S3H faculty towards upholding high standards teaching and learning. content: === Rector’s Orientation Visit to NBS === Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to NBS Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to NBS Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to NBS Top Stories Rector’s Orientation Visit to NBS Soon after assuming the responsibilities of Rector NUST, Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif has embarked on a series of visits to all constituent Institutions of NUST, beginning with his visit to NUST Business School (NBS) at the university’s Islamabad campus on December 30, 2024. Upon his arrival, Dr Zahid was warmly welcomed by Pro Rector Academics, Dr Osman Hasan, and Principal NBS, Dr Naukhez Sarwar. The visit commenced with a meeting at the principal’s office, followed by a detailed briefing on NBS. Dr Naukhez, along with the Heads of Departments, presented a comprehensive overview of the academic affairs, institutional matters, and ongoing initiatives.

metadata.title: Rector’s Orientation Visit to NBS | NUST

content: The Rector was then conducted to a detailed visit of the school, including classrooms, faculty workspaces and other facilities. Later, Rector addressed the faculty and discussed his vision for NUST. During his address Dr Zahid highlighted the critical role educators play in shaping the lives of students by inculcating values critical for achieving true prosperity. He said that social stability is a must to achieve peace and prosperity, emphasising that no nation can progress without giving due importance to education, hence educational institutions like NUST have a key role to play towards nation building in these epoch-making times. The Rector’s visit underscores his commitment to strengthening the academic ecosystem and enhancing the collective impact of NUST’s constituent institutions.

content: === National Defence University, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Visits NUST === Top Stories National Defence University, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Visits NUST Top Stories National Defence University, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Visits NUST Top Stories National Defence University, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Visits NUST Top Stories National Defence University, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Visits NUST A fifteen-member delegation of NDU KSA, led by Commandant War College, Major General Badar Bin Muneef Al-Otabi visited NUST on 5th November 2024. The delegation was warmly received by the Rector NUST, Lt General Javed Mahmood Bukhari. During the one day’s visit, the delegation was given detailed briefing on various dimensions of NUST, including an overview of NUST, the Academic Governance, Quality eco-systems of NUST, research regime, NUST’s Think Tank and knowledge diplomacy.

metadata.title: National Defence University, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Visits NUST | NUST

content: The delegation also visited the ongoing 28th Annual Conference of International Association of Peacekeeping Training Centre (IAPTC), being held for the first time in Pakistan. Thereafter the delegation was taken for brief visit of the expo arranged for 28th IAPTC members in which various few indigenously developed products were displayed. The delegation took deep interest in the various academic and training activities and highly appreciated the highest global standards achieved by NUST. content: === CEO Dante Labs visits NUST === Top Stories CEO Dante Labs visits NUST Top Stories CEO Dante Labs visits NUST Top Stories CEO Dante Labs visits NUST Top Stories CEO Dante Labs visits NUST The CEO of Dante Labs Genomics Italy, Mr Andrea Riposati, visited the Atta-ur-Rahman School of Applied Biosciences (ASAB) at NUST along with Senior Director Innovation, Mr Generoso Ianniciello, CEO of Dante Labs Genomics Pakistan, Mr Yasir Bajwa, and Manager of Dante Labs, Dr Maria Gulzaman. Genomic Centers are facilities that focus on studying genetic material, such as DNA sequencing and analysis. During their visit, the delegation met with Pro Rector RIC, Dr Rizwan Riaz, and Director ICON NUST to discuss the importance of genomic research facilities and their establishment at NUST.

metadata.title: CEO Dante Labs visits NUST | NUST

content: They also discussed the possibility of collaborating with ASAB NUST to offer discounted rates on Genome sequence analysis of various pathogens, genetic disorders, environmental microbes, plants, metagenomics, and phages. content: === UAE Ambassador visits NUST-housed National S&T Park === Top Stories UAE Ambassador visits NUST-housed National S&T Park Top Stories UAE Ambassador visits NUST-housed National S&T Park Top Stories UAE Ambassador visits NUST-housed National S&T Park Top Stories UAE Ambassador visits NUST-housed National S&T Park We are honoured to host UAE Ambassador to Pakistan, Hamad Obaid Ibrahim Salem Al-Zaabi at National Science & Technology Park (NSTP) at NUST Islamabad Campus on January 26, 2023. The Ambassador was received by the Pro-Rector RIC & VP NSTP, Dr Rizwan Riaz and Director NSTP, Dr Salman Raza Naqvi. During the visit, the Ambassador met with high-tech companies and start-ups incubated at the NSTP including Rapidev, Learnobots, miMar, Expert Flow, Zaheen Systems, and Xylexa. He was also briefed about the Hatch8 programme of NSTP which is a cohort-based programme aimed at helping early-stage startups.

metadata.title: UAE Ambassador visits NUST-housed National S&T Park | NUST

content: The Ambassador expressed his appreciation for the work being done by NSTP and said that he was impressed by the level of innovation and creativity of the companies and start-ups at NSTP. Dr. Rizwan Riaz, Pro-Rector RIC & VP NSTP, said that the visit by the Ambassador was a testament to the growing cooperation between the UAE and Pakistan. We are positive this visit will play its part in paving the way for future collaborations in innovation and technology between Pakistan and UAE. Ms Kubra Sattar, PhD scholar at the Department of Physics & Astronomy, NUST School of Natural Sciences (SNS) supervised by Prof Syed Rizwan Hussain (HoD), has been awarded the highly competitive, fully funded MAPEX-CF fellowship at Bremen University, Germany. Specializing in two-dimensional MXene materials for memristors and data storage applications, Ms Sattar is collaborating with global experts to study the structural and optical properties of MXene, contributing to the advancement of future memory devices. Her research excellence includes two first-author publications in the Q1 journal Carbon (Impact Factor: 10.4), along with multiple co-authored papers. NUST is proud of you! Dr Faisal Abbas, Professor of Economics and Director of the Centre of Excellence on Population and Wellbeing Studies at the School of Social Sciences and Humanities (S3H), NUST, has been appointed as an Advisory Member of the Guideline Development Group (GDG) by the World Health Organization (WHO), Geneva.

The GDG comprises global experts who advise WHO on the technical development, organization, and dissemination of health recommendations. Dr Abbas brings his expertise in health economics, public health, and population studies to this prestigious platform, further strengthening NUST’s contribution to global health policy and research. NUST Business School (NBS) has secured the prestigious British Council Disability Inclusion Partnerships (DIP) Grant, to advance accessibility in higher education. The grant was awarded to Dr Fatima Saman Qaiser (Principal Investigator), Dr Lubaba Sadaf, and Professor Dr Asfia Obaid (Co-Principal Investigators) of NBS, in collaboration with Dr Seemab Farooqi (Principal Investigator) and Dr Ying Wu (Deputy & Co-Principal Investigator) from the University of Dundee, UK. The project, Fostering Education Inclusion, aims to strengthen digital accessibility, inclusive teaching strategies and peer support networks for differently-abled students.

It aligns with multiple UN Sustainable Development Goals, reflecting NUST’s commitment to inclusive and globally impactful education. NUST has officially launched the NUST Disability Resource Center (NDRC), a first-of-its-kind institutional platform within Pakistan’s higher education landscape, dedicated to advancing disability inclusion across all NUST campuses. NUST has officially launched the NUST Disability Resource Center (NDRC), a first-of-its-kind institutional platform within Pakistan’s higher education landscape, dedicated to advancing disability inclusion across all NUST campuses. Located at the RIC Building, the NDRC reflects NUST’s unwavering commitment to inclusive excellence. The Center is envisioned as a cornerstone in embedding accessibility, inclusive policy frameworks, assistive technologies and data-driven research within the university ecosystem. Located at the RIC Building, the NDRC reflects NUST’s unwavering commitment to inclusive excellence.

The Center is envisioned as a cornerstone in embedding accessibility, inclusive policy frameworks, assistive technologies and data-driven research within the university ecosystem. Through this initiative, NUST is setting a national precedent by working towards an academic and social environment where persons with disabilities are fully empowered to thrive. The launch of NDRC marks a significant step in actualizing NUST’s vision of equity, access, and innovation ensuring that no NUSTian is left behind. Through this initiative, NUST is setting a national precedent by working towards an academic and social environment where persons with disabilities are fully empowered to thrive. NUST proudly celebrates yet another milestone in global scientific collaboration and innovation.

Prof Dr Syed Ali Hassan of SEECS has been awarded a prestigious research grant under the NATO Science for Peace and Security (SPS) Programme. His project, “Shielding HAPS against Intelligent Link Level Attacks,” has secured funding over three years. The initiative explores advanced solutions to secure high altitude platforms (HAPS), future 6G satellite communication base stations, against evolving security threats. Prof Ali will serve as NATO Partner Country Project Director, collaborating with Dr Sohaib J Solaija from Gebze Technical University, Türkiye, who serves as the NATO Country Project Director. Notably, Dr Solaija is a proud NUST alumnus and former student of Prof Ali, making this collaboration a moment of pride for the NUST community. NATO’s recognition of this research reinforces the growing global impact of NUST’s contributions to secure and future-forward technologies. At NUST, our vision of excellence knows no borders.

Dr Mohsin Kamal of SEECS has been awarded a prestigious research grant under the NATO Science for Peace and Security (SPS) Programme. The project, titled “Secure Integrated Sensing and Communications (Secure ISAC),” brings together leading researchers from Pakistan, Türkiye and beyond to develop secure, AI-driven communication systems for 6G networks, smart cities, and defense applications. Dr Kamal will serve as Co-Director, representing NUST and Pakistan alongside Prof Dr Hüseyin Arslan (Istanbul Medipol University, Türkiye) and Prof Dr Muhammad Tariq (NUCES-FAST). His leadership in IoT and cyber-physical security reflects NUST’s growing impact in global scientific collaboration and innovation. At NUST, we take immense pride in championing inclusive excellence! At NUST, we take immense pride in championing inclusive excellence!

Congratulations to the team on this incredible achievement!

Islamabad – In a significant milestone strengthening its position as a leader in sustainability efforts, the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) has been selected as the United Nations Academic Impact (UNAI) Hub Chair for Sustainable Development Goal (SDG-12 – Responsible Consumption & Production). This prestigious honour places the university among the elite group of 17 institutions worldwide, chosen from a competitive pool of 333 institutions. With this outstanding accomplishment, NUST now stands as the only university from Pakistan to receive this recognition for the 2025-2027 term. As part of the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals, SDG-12 focuses on ensuring sustainable consumption and production patterns, which is key to sustain the livelihoods of current and future generations.

By being appointed as the Hub Chair, NUST will lead global initiatives, foster collaborations, and drive research and policy development to advance sustainability practices in this critical area. Rector NUST Dr Muhammad Zahid Latif, a renowned academician, has termed this global recognition a testament to the university’s unparalleled commitment to sustainable practices towards shaping a more prosperous future for all. He has hoped that as a Hub Chair, NUST would engage with international stakeholders, make meaningful contributions to policy frameworks, and spearhead transformative projects aligned with the SDG-12. He trusts that the landmark achievement will also provide a significant platform for students, researchers and faculty to make discernible contributions to global sustainable initiatives, reinforcing the university’s mission to drive a positive change.

As the sole representative from Pakistan on this prestigious UN panel, NUST aims to inspire other institutions of higher learning and communities in the region to embrace sustainable development practices, paving the way for a greener and more equitable future.

content: === NUST Secures Prestigious Grant for Generative AI in Engineering Education === Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious Grant for Generative AI in Engineering Education Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious Grant for Generative AI in Engineering Education Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious Grant for Generative AI in Engineering Education Top Stories NUST Secures Prestigious Grant for Generative AI in Engineering Education National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST), in collaboration with King’s College London, UK, and the University of Warwick, UK, has been awarded a prestigious research grant under the TNE Exploratory Grants 2024 by the British Council. The project, “GAIN – Generative AI in Engineering Education through Project-Based Learning,” is led by Professor Dr Rafia Mumtaz at NUST, with Dr Tabbi Wilberforce from King’s College and Dr Freeha Azmat from Warwick contributing to this transformative initiative.

Their game-changing idea was transforming discarded banana trunks into sustainable, premium quality yarn, charting a path toward an eco-friendly textile industry. content: === NUST PNEC Shines at Battle of Minds 2023 Finals === Top Stories NUST PNEC Shines at Battle of Minds 2023 Finals Top Stories NUST PNEC Shines at Battle of Minds 2023 Finals Top Stories NUST PNEC Shines at Battle of Minds 2023 Finals Top Stories NUST PNEC Shines at Battle of Minds 2023 Finals The talented NUST PNEC team, including Mahnoor Mehmood, Syed Ali Hassan, Zaid Memon, and Humayun Saleem, secured the 2nd position at the Battle of Minds 2023 Finals in Islamabad on September 19, 2023. BoM is a global business case competition by British American Tobacco (BAT) held at national, regional, and international levels. Out of 180+ teams in Pakistan, they impressed with a groundbreaking proposal on sustainable mushroom-based packaging, earning recognition for their innovation and dedication to sustainability. Their success reinforces NUST PNEC’s reputation as a hub for forward-thinking solutions.

Out of 180+ teams in Pakistan, they impressed with a groundbreaking proposal on sustainable mushroom-based packaging, earning recognition for their innovation and dedication to sustainability. content: === NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals === Top Stories NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals Top Stories NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals Top Stories NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals Top Stories NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals It brings us immense pride to share that the NUST Law Moot Court team has won the 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan National Round. NUST Law department moot team comprising of students Ms Harram Chaudhry, Mr Sheikh Saim Shahzad and Ms Zainab Rafiq Khan under the mentorship of Mr Fazeel Hyder Chohan (Lecturer) has won Pakistan’s oldest and most prestigious moot court competition on international humanitarian law (law of war) organised by International Committee of the Red Cross (the ICRC).

metadata.title: NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals | NUST

content: With this victory, the NUST moot team became the youngest ever to win this championship. We are also very proud to announce that team NUST will now represent Pakistan at the next phase of the competition which is Hong Kong for the Asia Pacific round. This achievement is also attributed to Dr Mohammed Asif Khan’s emphasis on practical legal education and is a testimony to our student’s excellence NUST congratulates and wishes the Department of Law and the team the best for the Asia Pacific round. It brings us immense pride to share that the NUST Law Moot Court team has won the 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan National Round.

metadata.title: NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals | NUST

content: NUST Law department moot team comprising of students Ms Harram Chaudhry, Mr Sheikh Saim Shahzad and Ms Zainab Rafiq Khan under the mentorship of Mr Fazeel Hyder Chohan (Lecturer) has won Pakistan’s oldest and most prestigious moot court competition on international humanitarian law (law of war) organised by International Committee of the Red Cross (the ICRC). With this victory, the NUST moot team became the youngest ever to win this championship. We are also very proud to announce that team NUST will now represent Pakistan at the next phase of the competition which is Hong Kong for the Asia Pacific round. This achievement is also attributed to Dr Mohammed Asif Khan’s emphasis on practical legal education and is a testimony to our student’s excellence NUST congratulates and wishes the Department of Law and the team the best for the Asia Pacific round.

metadata.title: NUST Wins 15th Henry Dunant Moot Court Competition Pakistan Nationals | NUST

content: === NUST Students Shine on Global Stage as 7 Selected for Prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at Turkish Aerospace Academy === Top Stories NUST Students Shine on Global Stage as 7 Selected for Prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at Turkish Aerospace Academy Top Stories NUST Students Shine on Global Stage as 7 Selected for Prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at Turkish Aerospace Academy Top Stories NUST Students Shine on Global Stage as 7 Selected for Prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at Turkish Aerospace Academy Top Stories NUST Students Shine on Global Stage as 7 Selected for Prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at Turkish Aerospace Academy NUST proudly announces that 7 x students have successfully completed the prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at the Turkish Aerospace Academy, held from July 22, 2024, to August 16, 2024, in Ankara, Türkiye.

metadata.title: NUST Students Shine on Global Stage as 7 Selected for Prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at Turkish Aerospace Academy | NUST

content: Selected through a rigorous and highly competitive shortlisting process that saw approximately 250 applicants, these 7 students have represented both Pakistan and NUST on an international stage. The selection process involved two intensive phases, ensuring that only the most qualified and motivated students were chosen. The Summer Internship Program provided these students with an invaluable opportunity to gain hands-on experience in aerospace engineering. During their time at the Turkish Aerospace Academy, they engaged in vocational observations, familiarized themselves with engineering tasks and participated in meetings with industry experts. The program also included a comprehensive facility tour and various social activities, most of which took place on the Turkish Aerospace campus in Ankara. This accomplishment marks a significant milestone in the students’ academic and professional journeys, showcasing their potential to contribute to the global aerospace industry.

metadata.title: NUST Students Shine on Global Stage as 7 Selected for Prestigious Sky Global Internship Program at Turkish Aerospace Academy | NUST

content: NUST remains committed to providing its students with opportunities that foster growth, innovation, and international collaboration. Selected through a rigorous and highly competitive shortlisting process that saw approximately 250 applicants, these 7 students have represented both Pakistan and NUST on an international stage. The selection process involved two intensive phases, ensuring that only the most qualified and motivated students were chosen. The Summer Internship Program provided these students with an invaluable opportunity to gain hands-on experience in aerospace engineering. During their time at the Turkish Aerospace Academy, they engaged in vocational observations, familiarized themselves with engineering tasks and participated in meetings with industry experts.

content: === NUST reaches understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co to establish Zheng He Development Centre === Top Stories NUST reaches understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co to establish Zheng He Development Centre Top Stories NUST reaches understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co to establish Zheng He Development Centre Top Stories NUST reaches understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co to establish Zheng He Development Centre Top Stories NUST reaches understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co to establish Zheng He Development Centre As part of its continuous internationalisation efforts, the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) has reached an understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co, China, to establish Zheng He Development Centre at NUST.

metadata.title: NUST reaches understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co to establish Zheng He Development Centre | NUST

content: The centre will conduct technical trainings in the cutting-edge fields and facilitate placement of Pakistani students in leading Chinese companies across the globe. Representatives from industry giants like Huawei and ZTE attended the agreement signing ceremony, and pledged to play a pivotal role in developing skill-focused expertise of trainees. At the occasion, Dr Osman Hasan, NUST Pro-Rector Academics, remarked that these trainings would facilitate qualified individuals’ access to international career opportunities. The project, he maintained, is a manifestation of deep educational and cultural ties between Pakistan and China, and is aimed at further strengthening cooperation between NUST and Chinese companies working in the Middle East, North Africa, and Pakistan.

metadata.title: NUST reaches understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co to establish Zheng He Development Centre | NUST

content: As part of its continuous internationalisation efforts, the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) has reached an understanding with Jiangsu Shengxianglin Stock Holding Co, China, to establish Zheng He Development Centre at NUST. The centre will conduct technical trainings in the cutting-edge fields and facilitate placement of Pakistani students in leading Chinese companies across the globe. Representatives from industry giants like Huawei and ZTE attended the agreement signing ceremony, and pledged to play a pivotal role in developing skill-focused expertise of trainees. At the occasion, Dr Osman Hasan, NUST Pro-Rector Academics, remarked that these trainings would facilitate qualified individuals’ access to international career opportunities.

content: === NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! === Top Stories NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! Top Stories NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! Top Stories NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! Top Stories NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! In a landmark development, the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) has been awarded the Special Technology Zone (STZ) status, further reinforcing its role as one of the key drivers of Pakistan’s knowledge economy. The National Science & Technology Park (NSTP), a flagship project of NUST, will be the primary beneficiary of this status, marking a significant milestone in the university’s mission to advance innovation and technological advancement.

metadata.title: NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! | NUST

content: NSTP not only capitalises on the university’s core strengths and competencies but also avails robust support from the Government of Pakistan. Since its inception in 2019, NSTP has achieved remarkable milestones, including generating over PKR 20 billion in revenue, creating more than 6,000 high-tech jobs, and securing over PKR 10 billion in funds raised by its resident firms. This success highlights NSTP’s pivotal role in promoting a dynamic ecosystem for innovation and entrepreneurship in Pakistan. The STZ status has been conferred on two distinct land parcels within the NUST campus. The first parcel, covering approximately 8 acres, will house the NSTP Towers, which will accommodate startups, SMEs, and anchor tenants focused on AI, Chip Design, and other emerging verticals. This strategic development is set to create a thriving ecosystem for AI innovation, enabling Pakistan to make significant strides especially in the field of Artificial intelligence.

metadata.title: NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! | NUST

content: The second parcel of land, also within the STZ, will be home to N-ovative Health Technologies (NHTPL), which spans approximately 5 acres. NHTPL is already at the forefront of manufacturing cutting-edge medical devices and implants, including Bare Metal Stents (BMS), Drug-Eluting Stents (DES), and Percutaneous Transluminal Coronary Angioplasty (PTCA) balloon catheters. With the STZ status, this health cluster will expand to host enterprises focused on health tech, medical devices, biosciences, and pharmaceutics, positioning itself as the largest health technology cluster in the country. The conferment of STZ status over 13 acres (STZ, Zone-B) of NUST land, combined with the existing Special Economic Zone (SEZ, Zone-A) status (58.3 acres), represents the most focused infrastructure expansion in Science, Technology, and Innovation (STI) in Pakistan.

metadata.title: NUST Celebrates Landmark Achievement: Awarded Special Technology Zone (STZ) Status! | NUST

content: This development will not only transform NUST into a hub for cutting-edge research and industry collaboration but will also significantly boost the national knowledge economy, driving Pakistan towards a future of sustained technological growth and innovation. content: === NUST Law Team secures a semi-finals spot === Top Stories NUST Law Team secures a semi-finals spot Top Stories NUST Law Team secures a semi-finals spot Top Stories NUST Law Team secures a semi-finals spot Top Stories NUST Law Team secures a semi-finals spot Team NUST secured a semi-finals spot, ranking 3rd overall in the national rounds of the Foreign Direct Investment International Arbitration Moot, held at the Department of Law, S3H, from July 31 to August 1, 2024. Under the guidance of coach Ahmed Khalil and student coaches Ayaan Sheryar and Areej Anwar, the team, consisting of Iqra Hayat, Ayesha Akbar, Hafsa Siddique, Syed Ahmed Bilal, Emaan Fatima, Sadia Asif, and Ali Hassan Sultan, engaged in months of rigorous preparation. Iqra Hayat won the Best Speaker award, showcasing the team’s dedication and the NUST Law Department’s high academic standards.

metadata.title: NUST Law Team secures a semi-finals spot | NUST

content: We wish the team success in their future endeavors Team NUST secured a semi-finals spot, ranking 3rd overall in the national rounds of the Foreign Direct Investment International Arbitration Moot, held at the Department of Law, S3H, from July 31 to August 1, 2024. Under the guidance of coach Ahmed Khalil and student coaches Ayaan Sheryar and Areej Anwar, the team, consisting of Iqra Hayat, Ayesha Akbar, Hafsa Siddique, Syed Ahmed Bilal, Emaan Fatima, Sadia Asif, and Ali Hassan Sultan, engaged in months of rigorous preparation. Iqra Hayat won the Best Speaker award, showcasing the team’s dedication and the NUST Law Department’s high academic standards.

content: === Prestigious Global Achievement Unlocked === Top Stories Prestigious Global Achievement Unlocked Top Stories Prestigious Global Achievement Unlocked Top Stories Prestigious Global Achievement Unlocked Top Stories Prestigious Global Achievement Unlocked We are ecstatic to announce that the ASME NUST CEME Student Section has received not one, but two prestigious awards from the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) International: Student Section Achievement Award 2023-2024 Distinguished Student Section Award in Asia Pacific The ASME NUST CEME Student Section’s incredible events during the 2023-2024 academic year, including various technical competitions, seminars, and workshops for students, more collaborations with industries, and the greatest technical event, “ASME EFx NUST CEME,” held in April 2024, have provided students with exceptional exposure and learning experiences, truly shining through. content: === NUST Hosts Consultation Session on NUST Disability Resource Centre and Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit === Top Stories NUST Hosts Consultation Session on NUST Disability Resource Centre and Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit Top Stories NUST Hosts Consultation Session on NUST Disability Resource Centre and Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit Top Stories NUST Hosts Consultation Session on NUST Disability Resource Centre and Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit Top Stories NUST Hosts Consultation Session on NUST Disability Resource Centre and Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit On Friday, January 17, 2025, NUST’s Sustainability Office, in collaboration with STEP and PEDO, hosted a successful Consultation Session on establishing the NUST Disability Resource Centre (NDRC) and organization of Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit (ATIS).

metadata.title: NUST Hosts Consultation Session on NUST Disability Resource Centre and Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit | NUST

content: The session engaged experts, academics, NGO/INGO professionals, and government representatives in meaningful discussions on disability inclusion, assistive technology, and NDRC’s development. Participants also explored steps to advance inclusive policies and integrate assistive technologies into disaster preparedness strategies. Looking ahead, the Assistive Technology & Inclusion Summit is scheduled for April 2025, building on the momentum of these discussions. content: === NUST Hosts South Asian Delegation for HEC & World Bank Conference on Regional Cooperation === Top Stories NUST Hosts South Asian Delegation for HEC & World Bank Conference on Regional Cooperation Top Stories NUST Hosts South Asian Delegation for HEC & World Bank Conference on Regional Cooperation Top Stories NUST Hosts South Asian Delegation for HEC & World Bank Conference on Regional Cooperation Top Stories NUST Hosts South Asian Delegation for HEC & World Bank Conference on Regional Cooperation Islamabad – The National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) hosted the esteemed South Asian Delegation as part of the HEC & World Bank conference on “Promoting South Asia Regional Cooperation in Higher Education.” The delegation, led by Dr Noor Amna Malik (NAHE, HEC) and representatives from the World Bank, was accompanied by Dr Rizwan Riaz, Pro Rector (RIC), for a comprehensive presentation on NUST’s achievements in education, research, and innovation.

metadata.title: NUST Hosts South Asian Delegation for HEC & World Bank Conference on Regional Cooperation | NUST

content: Following the presentation, the delegates embarked on a guided tour of the NUST campus, exploring pioneering initiatives at the USPCAS-E, NSTP, and SINES. The visit, held on January 14, 2025, highlighted NUST’s role as a leader in regional collaboration, knowledge exchange, and the advancement of higher education in South Asia. This event exemplified NUST’s commitment to shaping the future of higher education while fostering international cooperation and innovation Islamabad – The National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST) hosted the esteemed South Asian Delegation as part of the HEC & World Bank conference on “Promoting South Asia Regional Cooperation in Higher Education.” The delegation, led by Dr Noor Amna Malik (NAHE, HEC) and representatives from the World Bank, was accompanied by Dr Rizwan Riaz, Pro Rector (RIC), for a comprehensive presentation on NUST’s achievements in education, research, and innovation.

content: === NUST Placement Office Collaborates with ISUG for Design Fest’ 24 === Top Stories NUST Placement Office Collaborates with ISUG for Design Fest’ 24 Top Stories NUST Placement Office Collaborates with ISUG for Design Fest’ 24 Top Stories NUST Placement Office Collaborates with ISUG for Design Fest’ 24 Top Stories NUST Placement Office Collaborates with ISUG for Design Fest’ 24 NUST Placement Office in collaboration with Islamabad SOLIDWORKS User Group (ISUG), successfully organized Design Fest 24’, an electrifying celebration of innovation and creativity. Held at Jinnah Auditorium, NUST, on December 10th, 2024 the event brought together over 600 students from 22 universities, fostering an atmosphere of collaboration and knowledge exchange. CEO SOLIDWORKS and Director SWUG Network graced the event with their virtual presence. The event featured three rounds of interactive quizzes, with participants showcasing their expertise and enthusiasm.

metadata.title: NUST Placement Office Collaborates with ISUG for Design Fest’ 24 | NUST

content: A pivotal moment of the event was the announcement of Pakistan’s First National Level SOLIDWORKS Design Competition. Slated to offer remarkable prizes and benefits, the competition aims to spotlight Pakistan’s talent in design and innovation. Adding to the excitement was the announcement of 18 free certifications worth $1,750 for all attendees, providing aspiring designers with unparalleled opportunities to enhance their skillsets. NUST looks forward to further collaborations with ISUG to nurture innovation and elevate Pakistan’s design landscape to new heights. content: === NUST launches the Green Tech Hub (GTH) at the SINES Building, H-12, Islamabad. === Top Stories NUST launches the Green Tech Hub (GTH) at the SINES Building, H-12, Islamabad. Top Stories NUST launches the Green Tech Hub (GTH) at the SINES Building, H-12, Islamabad. Top Stories NUST launches the Green Tech Hub (GTH) at the SINES Building, H-12, Islamabad. Top Stories NUST launches the Green Tech Hub (GTH) at the SINES Building, H-12, Islamabad. NUST, in collaboration with the Ministry of Climate Change and Environmental Coordination (MoCC & EC) and IGNITE, has launched the Green Tech Hub (GTH) at the SINES Building, H-12, Islamabad. This joint initiative is a groundbreaking effort to foster innovation in climate adaptation, mitigation, agriculture, and sustainability. Rector NUST, Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, welcomed the distinguished guests, including Madam Coordinator MoCC & EC Ms. Romina Khurshid Alam and Secretary MoCC & EC Ms. Aisha Humera, at the launch ceremony.

content: === NUST renews MoU with US Mission for Lincoln Corner === Top Stories NUST renews MoU with US Mission for Lincoln Corner Top Stories NUST renews MoU with US Mission for Lincoln Corner Top Stories NUST renews MoU with US Mission for Lincoln Corner Top Stories NUST renews MoU with US Mission for Lincoln Corner Lincoln Corner was established in NUST Central Library at H-12, Islamabad in the year 2022, and has been playing a pivotal role in advancing diverse initiatives for Pakistani youth, aimed at empowering communities through knowledge sharing and engagement. In order to continue with this facility, the US Mission in Islamabad and the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST) have extended the collaboration. An agreement has been signed to reaffirm their long-term commitment and collaboration towards educational programmes and cultural exchanges in Pakistan.

metadata.title: NUST renews MoU with US Mission for Lincoln Corner | NUST

content: Held at NUST Islamabad campus on October 8 2024, the MoU renewal ceremony was attended by Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST; Dr Osman Hasan, Pro-Rector Academics NUST, whereas the US Mission Islamabad was represented by Ms Lisa Ann Swenarski, Minister Counselor for Public Diplomacy and Dr Cynthia Nichols, Regional Public Engagement Specialist. At the occasion, Rector NUST remarked that through this renewed partnership, NUST looks forward to deepening its collaboration with the US Mission in Pakistan. Minister Counselor for Public Diplomacy highlighted that the partnership aims to expand the reach and impact of the Lincoln Corner, signifying a shared commitment for continued growth in the promotion of education and cultural collaboration.

metadata.title: NUST renews MoU with US Mission for Lincoln Corner | NUST

content: Besides the renewal of MoU, the event also featured the ROBOGEN-II Capstone Finale, a STEM competition (organised by five Lincoln Corners across Pakistan) designed to inspire and empower young girls through hands-on learning in Robotics and technology. === NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability === Top Stories NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability Top Stories NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability Top Stories NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability Top Stories NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability The US-Pakistan Centre for Advanced Studies in Energy (USPCAS-E) at NUST held a seminar on “Leveraging Indigenous Coal Resources for Sustainable Energy in Pakistan,” spotlighting the critical need to transition from imported coal to indigenous Thar coal for a more secure and economically viable energy future. The seminar delved into the findings of a recently published whitepaper by USPCAS-E, titled ‘Transition from Imported to Local Coal to Attain Energy Security in Pakistan: Opportunities & Challenges.

metadata.title: NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability | NUST

content: ’ The document calls for a strategic shift from imported coal to indigenous Thar coal to strengthen Pakistan’s energy security and alleviate the financial burden of coal imports. It highlighted that Pakistan has substantial coal resources, estimated at over 185 billion tonnes, with the majority located in Sindh’s Thar region. These reserves could generate 100,000 MW of electricity for over 200 years, significantly reducing the need for costly imports. The event hosted leading energy experts who discussed the strategic importance of Thar coal in reducing Pakistan’s reliance on imported fuel and securing the nation’s energy future. Key discussions focused on global trends in power production, Pakistan’s current energy mix, and the challenges and opportunities associated with utilising local coal resources. Dr Adeel Waqas, Principal USPCAS-E, NUST, delivered the welcome address followed by comprehensive discussions moderated by Dr Majid Ali from USPCAS-E.

metadata.title: NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability | NUST

content: Mr Said Ali Nawaz, DG Coal at PPIB, remarked, “We have imported coal worth $6 billion in the last 3 to 4 years. Thar truly is a game changer for our economy. In the next five years, we could fully reap the benefits as baseload shifts to Thar coal. This will reduce electricity prices and have an overall impact of PKR 2 to 3 on the basket price through the conversion of three imported coal plants.” Mr Shahab Qader Khan, CSO KE, said that Thar coal is at a takeoff stage and would eventually prove highly beneficial. This would also help generate employment and foster sustainable development. “Ultimately, if local coal can generate cheap electricity, it is in the national interest and should be prioritised,” said Salman Nazir, Head of Projects & Business Development, Renewable Resources (Pvt) Ltd.

metadata.title: NUST organises seminar on leveraging indigenous coal for energy sustainability | NUST

content: “If Thar coal can be supplied to the cement industry, its utilisation will increase, optimising high energy costs,” said Farrukh Ahmed, Head of Sustainability, Bestway The seminar drew to a close with a call to action, highlighting the necessity for a collaborative effort among the government, industry, and academia to effectively harness Pakistan’s indigenous coal resources. content: === NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects === Top Stories NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects Top Stories NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects Top Stories NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects Top Stories NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects The NUST Institute of Policy Studies (NIPS) organized the seminar on “Russia-Ukraine War-The Global Implications” and launched the book, Russia-Ukraine War: Dawn of a New World Order?, written by Dr.

metadata.title: NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects | NUST

content: Ashfaque Hasan Khan, Principal NUST School of Social Sciences and Humanities and Director General NIPS. Eminent thought leaders spoke on the occasion. Ambassador (Retd) Masood Khalid, Pakistan’s former ambassador to China, delivered the keynote address. His keynote emphasized that the conflict had created new geopolitical and security dynamics leading to the securitization of the NATO countries. In his opinion, the conflict had sharpened bloc politics and unleashed the new arms race between major powers with serious implications for world peace and stability. He remarked that the conflict had also created new demographic and financial challenges for Europe. He stressed that the impact of the conflict on developing countries would also be considerable. Dr. Ashfaque Hasan Khan introduced the book which is focused mainly on the financial and economic aspects of the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

metadata.title: NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects | NUST

content: He highlighted that it was an attempt to encapsulate the momentous changes taking place in the global financial and economic domains as a result of this major Eurasian conflict. He underscored that the excessive use of economic sanctions as an instrument of conflict had deeply affected the current international relations. He further stressed that the war had quickened the pace of de-dollarization with far-reaching implications for the rise of new major reserve currencies. General Daya Ratnayake (Retd), Former Sri Lankan Army Chief, in his remarks on the book, commended Dr. Khan’s meticulous multidimensional analysis. He remarked that the conflict would cause long-term changes in the Eurasian geopolitics. Dr. Lucio Remuzat Renno, Dean of Graduate Studies, the University of Brasilia, remarked that book offered a contextual understanding of the war to the readers.

metadata.title: NIPS Seminar Sheds Light on Global Implications of Russia-Ukraine War and Launches Impactful Book on Financial and Economic Aspects | NUST

content: He further added that the author had skillfully dealt with the financial and economic dimension of the conflict which was given short shrift by popular accounts of the war. He highlighted that BRICS, an important intergovernmental forum, had also been considering different types of payment alternatives. content: === Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations === Top Stories Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations Top Stories Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations Top Stories Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations Top Stories Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations NUST Centre for International Peace & Stability held an expert panel discussion on “Pak-Afghan Relations: The Future Prospects” on January 3, 2022. Ambassador (Retd) Syed Abrar Hussain, Chairman Institute of Policy Studies, Islamabad, Major General Inam (Retd) Imtiaz Gul, Executive Director of Center for Research and Security Studies, and Professor Dr Azmat Hayat, Vice Chancellor University of Peshawar were the key panelists.

metadata.title: Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations | NUST

content: The seminar began with welcome remarks by Professor Dr Tughral Yamin, Associate Dean CIPS, and was followed by Associate Professor Dr Aqab Malik’s comprehensive assessment of the current situation of Pakistan-Afghan relations, which set the tone for the discussion. Ambassador Syed Abrar Hussain (Retd) addressed the panel on the prospects of strategic partnership for regional peace through mutual geopolitical interests and sustainability through people-to-people interaction. He discussed the strategic importance of Afghanistan and Pakistan’s bilateral ties in terms of socioeconomic, political, commerce, and people-to-people interaction. The framework for understanding the structural intricacies of the connections with emphasis on convergent security patterns and reconciliation through effective diplomatic contacts was shared by the second speaker, Major General Inam Ul Haq (Retd).

metadata.title: Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations | NUST

content: He discussed different variables affecting Pak- Afghan ties and the structural difficulties of Pakistan and the now Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan (IEA). Mr Imtiaz Gul shared his insightful remarks on, “Emphasis on objectively identifying mutual inclusiveness and convergent security patterns and reconciliation through effective administration, diplomatic relations, media projections and shared public opinion”. Dr. Azmat Hayat, former Vice Chancellor of Peshawar University, finished the panel discussion by commenting on the nexus of policy, research, and practice of peace education in addressing conventional and non-traditional issues. He comprehensively explained the historical roots of the issues facing Pak-Afghan relations and also underlined the importance of understanding the complexities of not only Afghan society but also Pakistan’s western border regions.

metadata.title: Policy, Academic Experts Discuss Future Prospects of Pak-Afghan Relations | NUST

content: Following the expert panelists’ session, the seminar was opened for a panel discussion and a Q&A session which was expertly moderated by Dr. Aqab Malik. The closing remarks were delivered by Maj Gen Muhammad Salim Raza HI (M) (Retd), Principal NIPCONS. At the end of the ceremony, Principal NIPCONS offered mementos to the honourable speakers on behalf of CIPS. content: === Chairman HEC shares vision on higher education development in Pakistan === Top Stories Chairman HEC shares vision on higher education development in Pakistan Top Stories Chairman HEC shares vision on higher education development in Pakistan Top Stories Chairman HEC shares vision on higher education development in Pakistan Top Stories Chairman HEC shares vision on higher education development in Pakistan NUST School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (SEECS) organized a seminar on “Higher Education Commission’s (HEC) Policies for Enhancing Higher Education in Pakistan” having Dr. Tariq Banuri, Chairman HEC as an invited speaker. The event was held on 11 May 2022 at Jinnah Auditorium, NUST Islamabad Campus and Rector NUST, Lt. Gen. (R) Engr. Javed Mahmood Bukhari, HI (M), graced the event as chief host.

metadata.title: Chairman HEC shares vision on higher education development in Pakistan | NUST

content: The event was a collaboration of IEEE Microwave Theory & Technology Society, Antenna and Propagation Society, Electromagnetic Compatibility & Interference society and Circuits & Systems (CAS) society joint chapter at SEECS and IEEE Educational Activities, Islamabad Section. Dr. Nosherwan Shoaib, the faculty member of SEECS, welcomed the guests and participants and highlighted the importance of core policies to stimulate & strengthen the academia & research culture in Pakistan. The invited speaker, Dr. Tariq Banuri, delivered a detailed talk on HEC vision for enhancing higher education in Pakistan. He stressed that the quality-based education and research system are vital in transforming the current higher education culture in Pakistan. He shared the initiatives that HEC has taken to improve the higher education structure in Pakistan. In addition to the invited talk, there was an interactive session in which students and faculty asked policy-related questions to the Chairman.

metadata.title: Chairman HEC shares vision on higher education development in Pakistan | NUST

content: The event was concluded with the concluding remarks by Principal SEECS, Air Vice Marshal Dr. Muhammad Ajmal Khan, SI (M). He has thanked the Chairman HEC and affirmed the support of NUST to improve the quality of the academia-research system for universities. content: === STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities === Top Stories STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities Top Stories STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities Top Stories STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities Top Stories STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities A seminar on “STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities” was held at NUST today to mark International Women’s Day (annually observed on March 8). Jointly organised by the Sustainability Office of NUST and CHIP Training & Consulting – Pvt Ltd., the seminar is part of the larger campaign titled: STEM4WE, launched by the Asian Development Bank (ADB).

metadata.title: STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities | NUST

content: The aim was to bring together stakeholders from across academia, energy networks, energy distribution companies, and policymaking bodies, and discuss challenges and opportunities for women in STEM-related fields in Pakistan. In his opening remarks, Dr Mohammad Ali Mohammad, Director Research briefed the audience about NUST, particularly highlighting its innovative initiatives to bring more young women into technical fields by providing them with a conducive working environment. Mr Ehtesham Khattak, Head of ADB Pakistan, said that ADB encourages women to pursue and advance in STEM careers. The chief guest at the occasion was Ms Sobia Kamal Khan, Member National Assembly’s Standing Committee on Science & Technology. In her talk, she laid emphasis on the critical importance of women representation in Engineering and Computing occupations.

metadata.title: STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities | NUST

content: She asserted that diversity in the workforce contributes to creativity, productivity and innovation, adding women’s experiences in tandem with men’s experiences should inform and guide the direction of Engineering and Technical Innovation. Ensuing was a panel discussion on “How to challenge the challenges to improve women’s participation in STEM related fields?” Panelists included Ms Nameera Hamid, Chairperson, Women in Energy, Ms Samina Mustajab Zaidi, Additional Chief Engineer, IESCO, and Dr Mariam Mahmood, Associate Professor, USPCAS-E NUST. Engr Barira Hanif, Head of NUST Sustainability Office, moderated the discussion. The second panel discussion on “Incentivising STEM: Influencing policies and systems in academia and industry” included Ms Ermeena Malik, Renewable Energy Expert, Ms Hina Aslam, Energy Lead at SDPI, Mr Asad Aleem, Principal Energy Specialist, ADB, and Mr Muhammad Zubair Khan, DG HR, IESCO.

metadata.title: STEM for Women’s Empowerment in Pakistan: Providing Equal Opportunities | NUST

content: The seminar contributed to the discourse on structural, as well as cultural impediments to women excelling in STEM related fields in Pakistan. The challenges and opportunities faced by women while accessing education and careers in STEM fields in Pakistan – with a particular focus on the energy sector were thoroughly discussed. The seminar also shed light on the way forward for increasing women’s participation in STEM. content: === SEECS Inaugurates Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab === Top Stories SEECS Inaugurates Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab Top Stories SEECS Inaugurates Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab Top Stories SEECS Inaugurates Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab Top Stories SEECS Inaugurates Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab SEECS, the flagship institute of #NUST, conducts cutting-edge research on cyber-physical systems. To enhance international collaboration, NUST established the Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab (PTDIL) with Chiang Mai University (CMU), Thailand, inaugurated on July 24, 2024, by Prof Dr Pradorn and Prof Dr Ajmal. This initiative aims to develop innovative solutions for contemporary societal challenges.The institutions signed an MoA to establish joint labs at each university for collaborative research, sharing facilities, and supporting student/faculty exchange. Prof Dr Pradorn Sureephong and Prof Dr Rafia Mumtaz will lead the labs at CMU and NUST, respectively.

metadata.title: SEECS Inaugurates Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab | NUST

content: This twin lab concept fosters multilevel linkages to develop cutting-edge technologies for the digital world. To enhance international collaboration, NUST established the Pak-Thai Digital Innovation Lab (PTDIL) with Chiang Mai University (CMU), Thailand, inaugurated on July 24, 2024, by Prof Dr Pradorn and Prof Dr Ajmal. This initiative aims to develop innovative solutions for contemporary societal challenges.The institutions signed an MoA to establish joint labs at each university for collaborative research, sharing facilities, and supporting student/faculty exchange. Prof Dr Pradorn Sureephong and Prof Dr Rafia Mumtaz will lead the labs at CMU and NUST, respectively. This twin lab concept fosters multilevel linkages to develop cutting-edge technologies for the digital world.
