content: === NUST holds National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) 2024 === Top Stories NUST holds National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) 2024 Top Stories NUST holds National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) 2024 Top Stories NUST holds National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) 2024 Top Stories NUST holds National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) 2024 As part of its efforts to promote Robotics in Pakistan, NUST College of EME has been holding the National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) since 2003. This year, the College’s Mechatronics Engineering Department organised NERC’s 20th edition from July 9 to 13, 2024. As many as 250 teams from school and universities across the country participated in the competition. The five-day event comprised 12 categories, including Indigenous Robots, Modular Robots, Ready-to-Race, Robowars, Sumowars and Aero Line-of-Sight and Aero FPV.

metadata.title: NUST holds National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) 2024 | NUST

content: The event was jointly organised with STEM Careers Programme, HEC, and sponsored by NCRA, MRS Technologies, Graana, Headstart School, Quest, Technology Links, Robotics World Pvt. Ltd., National Centre for Physics, Artificial Intelligence Technology Centre, Red Bull, Ranchers, Zaroon Media & PR Events and Society of Mechatronics Engineering. Dr Nasir Rashid, Dean NUST College of E&ME, welcomed the esteemed guests and participants to the pioneering and biggest Robotics contest in the country. He made special mention of how the number of participants had grown and standard of the competition risen over the years. Mr Ather Imran Nawaz, CEO Sybrid Private Limited, graced the event as chief guest. He appreciated the efforts of NUST and College of E&ME towards promotion of Robotics among the youth. He termed NERC a platform that provides students with an excellent opportunity to hone their Engineering skills, and showcase their creative prowess and problem-solving abilities.

metadata.title: NUST holds National Engineering Robotics Contest (NERC) 2024 | NUST

content: Dr Hamid Jabbar, Head of Mechatronics Engineering Department, thanked the participants whose enthusiasm and energy made the event a big success. He also expressed his gratitude to the organisers and sponsors whose support was instrumental in the conduct of such a mega event. Towards the end, the chief guest gave away prizes to the winning and runner-up teams. content: === NUST USPCAS-E Hosts Ceremony Celebrating Distribution of FYDPs === Top Stories NUST USPCAS-E Hosts Ceremony Celebrating Distribution of FYDPs Top Stories NUST USPCAS-E Hosts Ceremony Celebrating Distribution of FYDPs Top Stories NUST USPCAS-E Hosts Ceremony Celebrating Distribution of FYDPs Top Stories NUST USPCAS-E Hosts Ceremony Celebrating Distribution of FYDPs PEC in collaboration with universities and industry partners, identifies current market and industry-relevant topics for Engineering students’ Final Year Design Projects (FYDPs). Projects undergo a rigorous shortlisting process at the Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC), and only selected projects are funded by PEC. On July 9th, 2024, Rector NUST and Pro-Rector (Acad) warmly welcomed the Honorable Chairman of PEC, Engr. Muhammad Najeeb Haroon along with Advisor PEC, Engr Mir Masood Rashid, at the cheque distribution ceremony held at USPCASE Seminar Hall.

metadata.title: NUST USPCAS-E Hosts Ceremony Celebrating Distribution of FYDPs | NUST

content: The event was graced by the presence of the principal, deans of the selected projects, along with the project supervisors, and students. During the ceremony, Engr. Haroon commended the students for their innovative projects and emphasized the importance of aligning academic endeavors with industry demands to ensure that graduates are well-prepared for their professional careers. For the year 2023-2024, PEC has selected 62 projects from NUST overall, including 32 projects from MCS, College of E&ME, and H-12 Campus. Engr. Muhammad Najeeb Haroon also expressed his appreciation for NUST’s commitment to fostering a culture of innovation and excellence. He acknowledged the crucial role of industry partners in identifying relevant project topics and providing support.

content: === NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) === • Broad Spectrum of Internship Opportunities: NUST offers internships in fields such as engineering, technology, natural sciences, social sciences, business and humanities. This wide range of opportunities caters to students’ diverse interests and academic backgrounds. • Expert Supervision and Mentoring: Each intern will be assigned a dedicated supervisor who will provide guidance, support, and feedback throughout the internship period. Mentors will leverage their industry experience and academic expertise to ensure a fruitful learning experience. • State-of-the-Art Facilities and Resources: Interns will have access to NUST’s state-of-the-art laboratories, research facilities, libraries and other resources essential for their professional development.

metadata.title: NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) | NUST

content: • Cultural Exchange and Networking: NIPIS’24 fosters an environment of cultural exchange, allowing international interns to interact and collaborate with students from different backgrounds. This interaction will broaden their perspectives and enhance their global network. Top Stories NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) Top Stories NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) Top Stories NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) Top Stories NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) NUST is pleased to announce the launch of its flagship program “NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24)”. This program aims to provide an exceptional opportunity for talented students from around the world to gain valuable professional experience and enhance their skills within the vibrant academic community of NUST.

metadata.title: NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) | NUST

content: The NIPIS’24 program opens its doors to undergraduate and graduate students from various disciplines, offering them a platform to immerse themselves in a diverse range of internship opportunities. Through collaborations with leading organizations, industries, and research centers, NUST strives to provide students with practical exposure, enabling them to apply their academic knowledge to real-world challenges. This year, as many as 24 student interns from 7 countries, including Türkiye, Srilanka, Ireland, Morocco, Nepal, Egypt and United Kingdom (UK) have joined the program. Key features of the NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) include: NUST extends a warm welcome to our international students and introduces them to an array of activities they will have a chance to benefit from during the internship. We are enthusiastic about the program and believe that NIPIS 2024 embodies our commitment to nurturing global talent and fostering international collaboration.

metadata.title: NUST Launches NUST Internship Program for International Students (NIPIS’24) | NUST

content: We are confident that this initiative will not only benefit the participating students but also contribute to the academic and cultural diversity of our institution.

content: === Ayesha Liaqat Leads Dynamic Sessions on 21st-Century Leadership at Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy in Bangkok === Top Stories Ayesha Liaqat Leads Dynamic Sessions on 21st-Century Leadership at Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy in Bangkok Top Stories Ayesha Liaqat Leads Dynamic Sessions on 21st-Century Leadership at Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy in Bangkok Top Stories Ayesha Liaqat Leads Dynamic Sessions on 21st-Century Leadership at Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy in Bangkok Top Stories Ayesha Liaqat Leads Dynamic Sessions on 21st-Century Leadership at Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy in Bangkok Ayesha Liaqat, from the Department of Behavioral Sciences, participated as a facilitator in the Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy Convocation arranged by international research and exchange board (IREX) held in Bangkok, Thailand.

metadata.title: Ayesha Liaqat Leads Dynamic Sessions on 21st-Century Leadership at Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy in Bangkok | NUST

content: She co-facilitated a session titled “Interpersonal Leadership and Personal Leadership Approaches: Exploring 21st-Century Leadership Styles and Qualities” alongside Liz Hague (she/her). On the second day, Ayesha led a session on “Complementary Leadership Styles and Ethical Leadership,” where she developed case studies to encourage the practical application of ethical leadership principles. This session aimed to help participants combine different leadership styles to tackle real-world challenges, promoting collaboration and innovation. Engaging with over 150 exceptional young leaders and change-makers from across Pakistan was inspiring. Together, they explored pressing issues facing the nation and discussed how community leadership can drive positive transformation.

metadata.title: Ayesha Liaqat Leads Dynamic Sessions on 21st-Century Leadership at Global UGRAD-Pakistan Alumni Academy in Bangkok | NUST

She co-facilitated a session titled “Interpersonal Leadership and Personal Leadership Approaches: Exploring 21st-Century Leadership Styles and Qualities” alongside Liz Hague (she/her). Engaging with over 150 exceptional young leaders and change-makers from across Pakistan was inspiring.

=== British MP Rayner and Lord Khan visit NUST === Top Stories British MP Rayner and Lord Khan visit NUST Top Stories British MP Rayner and Lord Khan visit NUST Top Stories British MP Rayner and Lord Khan visit NUST Top Stories British MP Rayner and Lord Khan visit NUST NUST welcomed Ms Angela Rayner, the Deputy Leader of the Opposition in the British Parliament, and Lord Wajid Khan of the UK House of Lords, the Shadow Minister for Communities, Local Government and Housing, at NUST Islamabad Campus, on October 3, 2022. Ms Rayner is also the Deputy Leader of the Labour Party, Shadow Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster, Shadow Minister for the Cabinet Office and Shadow Secretary of State for the Future of Work. They were received by Dr Rizwan Riaz, Pro-Rector Research, Innovation & Commercialisation.

metadata.title: British MP Rayner and Lord Khan visit NUST | NUST

content: The ensuing meeting, also including Pro-Rector Academics Dr Osman Hasan, entailed a brief on NUST’s higher education landscape, its R&D structure, national and international partnerships, as well as its flagship project, the National Science & Technology Park (NSTP) that has been actively stimulating and nurturing innovation-led germination and growth of hi-tech entities in the country since its inception in 2019. The guests later visited NSTP and met with the team members of its most successful tech start-ups. A bus tour of the campus was also arranged for Ms Rayner and Mr Khan to showcase NUST’s impressive infrastructure purposely built to facilitate its students, faculty, and staff in their respective functions as well as allow for recreational activities through multiple community centres, a highly elaborate sports complex, and the one-of-its-kind-in-Pakistan university-based riding club.

metadata.title: British MP Rayner and Lord Khan visit NUST | NUST

content: At the end of the visit, Ms Rayner and Mr Khan interacted with a large number of students and faculty. The guests received an array of interesting questions from the students on British politics, international issues and Pak-British relations. The guests expressed their appreciation for NUST’s academic and R&D ecosystem and expressed high hopes for higher education collaborations between the UK and Pakistan in the future. The ensuing meeting, also including Pro-Rector Academics Dr Osman Hasan, entailed a brief on NUST’s higher education landscape, its R&D structure, national and international partnerships, as well as its flagship project, the National Science & Technology Park (NSTP) that has been actively stimulating and nurturing innovation-led germination and growth of hi-tech entities in the country since its inception in 2019. The guests later visited NSTP and met with the team members of its most successful tech start-ups. A bus tour of the campus was also arranged for Ms Rayner and Mr Khan to showcase NUST’s impressive infrastructure purposely built to facilitate its students, faculty, and staff in their respective functions as well as allow for recreational activities through multiple community centres, a highly elaborate sports complex, and the one-of-its-kind-in-Pakistan university-based riding club.

At the end of the visit, Ms Rayner and Mr Khan interacted with a large number of students and faculty. content: === NUST hosts delegation of Plus W Inc. from Japan === Top Stories NUST hosts delegation of Plus W Inc. from Japan Top Stories NUST hosts delegation of Plus W Inc. from Japan Top Stories NUST hosts delegation of Plus W Inc. from Japan Top Stories NUST hosts delegation of Plus W Inc. from Japan NUST welcomed a delegation of Plus W株式会社, headed by Ms Wakako Sakurai, to explore the possibility of enhancing cooperation & collaboration between NUST and Japanese companies through the Pak Japan Center. Ms Sakurai who is also the founder and CEO of Plus W was accompanied by Executive Vice President & COO – Mr Takashi Horiuchi, Head of Pakistan Business – Mr Taro Kanzawa and Head of Offshore Development – Mr Yuji Tsuchiya. The delegation was welcomed by the Head of the Pak Japan Center – Mr Kango Hayashi, the Vice Head of Pak Japan Center – Ms Arooba Gillani, and Chief Consultant Pak Japan Center – Mr Umair Munir.

metadata.title: NUST hosts delegation of Plus W Inc. from Japan | NUST

content: The dignitaries visited Pak Japan Center in National Science & Technology Park followed by a courtesy call on to Pro-Rector RIC – Dr Rizwan Riaz. Director National Center of Artificial Intelligence – NCAI, Pakistan – Dr Yasar Ayaz attended the meeting as well. The subsequent discussions were focused on the potential for cooperation between the Pak Japan Center and NUST, the launching of a Japanese language programme at NUST and other avenues for mutual interest that could potentially lead to the expansion of collaborative efforts. Officials from Plus W Pakistan praised the quality of the infrastructure and the state-of-the-art facilities that were being offered to the Pak Japan Center by NUST. Pro-Rector RIC Dr Rizwan Riaz presented souvenirs to the members of the delegation.

content: === NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University === Top Stories NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University Top Stories NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University Top Stories NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University Top Stories NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University As NUST enters the fourth decade of excellence, its focus on the quality of knowledge, skill set, and education being passed on to the students remains the foremost priority and the faculty and administration are on a constant mission to equip themselves with the latest global trends. With the same goal, and to further explore avenues of partnerships, NUST distinguished alumnus, Profesor Raheel Nawaz, Pro Vice-Chancellor – Digital Transformation at Staffordshire University, meticulously designed the university visit for the NUST delegation led by Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, on Friday, September 23, 2022.

metadata.title: NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University | NUST

content: Upon reaching the campus, the delegation was warmly welcomed by the organising team, and as a gesture of welcome, a meeting note was held with Professor Raheel Nawaz, Pro Vice-Chancellor – Digital Transformation; Gemma Smith, Director of International Recruitment and Development and Ravinder Kaur, Head of Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion. As a greeting note, meeting with Professor Martin Jones, Vice Chancellor and Professor Kevin Hetherington, Deputy Vice-Chancellor, for the presentation which was then followed by a lunch with the organising team. Furthermore, to showcase the University and its endeavours to incorporate technological advancement in education, the NUST delegation was given a visit to the facility.

metadata.title: NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University | NUST

content: A glimpse of Simmersive Technology was showcased by Matthew Rutter, Assistant Dean of School of Health, Science and Wellbeing, and Games, Computing, and Virtual Production Studio were shown by Alastair Dawes, Director of Business, Development & Enterprise, School of Digital, Technologies & Arts, and Innovation and Enterprise Zone visit was carried by Dr Laura Walton-Williams, Director of Business & Enterprise, School of Justice, Security & Sustainability and Marek Hornak, Associate Dean, Employer Partnerships & Enterprise. Later, a brief about NUST and its achievements were shared by the delegation to the host team and a DOU was signed between the universities to build academic linkages. The event concluded with a networking lunch, where both parties collaborated and discussed mutual connecting notes to further enhance the academic linkages. Staffordshire University is an award-winning institution that places students at the heart of everything they do.

metadata.title: NUST delegation visits Staffordshire University | NUST

content: The campus located in Stoke on Trent is a vibrant and friendly community, welcoming a diverse set of talented students across the globe. content: === Secretary MoST visits NUST === Top Stories Secretary MoST visits NUST Top Stories Secretary MoST visits NUST Top Stories Secretary MoST visits NUST Top Stories Secretary MoST visits NUST Mr Ghulam Muhammad Memon, Federal Secretary Ministry of Science and Technology (MoST), visited the main campus of NUST on Wednesday. He was received by Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST. In a one-on-one meeting, the Rector apprised the honourable visitor of some of NUST’s national and global achievements, R&D initiatives and its efforts towards building the knowledge economy through a robust ecosystem based on innovation, entrepreneurship and commercialisation of indigenously developed products and technologies. Later, the Federal Secretary visited N-ovative Health Technologies Pvt Ltd (NHT) which is the first-of-its-kind facility in Pakistan for the production of medical devices and implants, set up as a consequence of strong R&D at NUST.

CEO NHT Dr Murtaza Najabat Ali gave a detailed presentation on the facility, followed by a visit to various sections of NHT, including the Stent and Catheter production zones. Mr Ghulam Muhammad Memon greatly appreciated the efforts of the highly dedicated team of NHT. Mr Ghulam Muhammad Memon, Federal Secretary Ministry of Science and Technology (MoST), visited the main campus of NUST on Wednesday. He was received by Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST. In a one-on-one meeting, the Rector apprised the honourable visitor of some of NUST’s national and global achievements, R&D initiatives and its efforts towards building the knowledge economy through a robust ecosystem based on innovation, entrepreneurship and commercialisation of indigenously developed products and technologies.

Later, the Federal Secretary visited N-ovative Health Technologies Pvt Ltd (NHT) which is the first-of-its-kind facility in Pakistan for the production of medical devices and implants, set up as a consequence of strong R&D at NUST. CEO NHT Dr Murtaza Najabat Ali gave a detailed presentation on the facility, followed by a visit to various sections of NHT, including the Stent and Catheter production zones. Mr Ghulam Muhammad Memon greatly appreciated the efforts of the highly dedicated team of NHT.

=== NUST hosts Danish Ambassador Rosenhold === Top Stories NUST hosts Danish Ambassador Rosenhold Top Stories NUST hosts Danish Ambassador Rosenhold Top Stories NUST hosts Danish Ambassador Rosenhold Top Stories NUST hosts Danish Ambassador Rosenhold The Ambassador of Denmark to Pakistan, Her Excellency Ms Lis Rosenholm visited NUST, Pakistan on July 28, 2022. The dignitary had a detailed meeting with Rector NUST Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari and senior management of the university. Matters of mutual interest, particularly forging meaningful partnerships between NUST and Danish institutions, came under discussion. The Rector apprised the honourable guest of NUST’s accomplishments in academic and research domains, pursuance of Sustainable Development Goals, etc. Later, the Ambassador had an interactive session with faculty and students of NUST.

metadata.title: NUST hosts Danish Ambassador Rosenhold | NUST

content: Her talk predominantly focused on climate diplomacy and how Denmark is playing its role in combating the global challenge of climate change, which, she termed, is a big risk to the world particularly developing nations like Pakistan. She said that there is a dire need to convert climate change challenges into business opportunities through innovation and technological intervention. She emphasised that public-private partnerships and the role of academia are key to effectively dealing with the issue and beyond. The Ambassador of Denmark to Pakistan, Her Excellency Ms Lis Rosenholm visited NUST, Pakistan on July 28, 2022. content: === NUST hosts Turkish Aerospace Industries Delegation === Top Stories NUST hosts Turkish Aerospace Industries Delegation Top Stories NUST hosts Turkish Aerospace Industries Delegation Top Stories NUST hosts Turkish Aerospace Industries Delegation Top Stories NUST hosts Turkish Aerospace Industries Delegation The Executive Vice President of Turkish Aerospace Industries (TAI) Mr Ugur Zengin and Mr Atilla Dogan, along with a high-level delegation visited NUST on May 17, 2022. The delegation held a meeting with Lieutenant General (R) Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST to discuss possible avenues of collaboration. TAI is among the global players in the defense and aerospace industries. The delegation was apprised of the latest advancements in technology and research areas in which NUST excels.

metadata.title: NUST hosts Turkish Aerospace Industries Delegation | NUST

content: The delegation also visited the National Science & Technology Park at NUST followed by a visit to the School of Interdisciplinary Engineering and Sciences and various lab facilities at NUST for future research projects collaboration. TAI also explored the possibility of establishing more research Labs at NUST on the same model as the already established TAI Design Lab. In the end, the delegation had a detailed discussion with Pro-Rector Research, Innovation & Commercialisation (RIC), Dr Rizwan Riaz and Director Research, Dr Hamood Ur Rehman, on multiple areas of research and development aimed at exploring the opportunity for mutual collaboration between NUST and TAI in future on conducting joint research. This highly appreciated visit will ensure future collaborations and sustainable cooperation at both ends. The Executive Vice President of Turkish Aerospace Industries (TAI) Mr Ugur Zengin and Mr Atilla Dogan, along with a high-level delegation visited NUST on May 17, 2022.

content: === Federal Minister PD&SI tours National Centre of Artificial Intelligence Sectt at NUST === Top Stories Federal Minister PD&SI tours National Centre of Artificial Intelligence Sectt at NUST Top Stories Federal Minister PD&SI tours National Centre of Artificial Intelligence Sectt at NUST Top Stories Federal Minister PD&SI tours National Centre of Artificial Intelligence Sectt at NUST Top Stories Federal Minister PD&SI tours National Centre of Artificial Intelligence Sectt at NUST NUST welcomed Federal Minister Planning, Development & Special Initiatives Mr Ahsan Iqbal on his visit to the National Centre of Artificial Intelligence at NUST Islamabad Campus. Lt Gen (Retd) Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, received the honourable minister. He expressed strong resolve to expedite all projects in the science, technology, and engineering sectors.

metadata.title: Federal Minister PD&SI tours National Centre of Artificial Intelligence Sectt at NUST | NUST

content: The federal minister further said that the government plans to focus on providing access to young scientists and engineers to the international state-of-the-art education and skills in order for them to become a production house for the international IT and science industry. He emphasised the importance of Artificial Intelligence for modern Knowledge-based Economies and encouraged youth to take up research and education in the fields of Artificial Intelligence and Robotics. NCAI was inaugurated in the year 2018 by Mr Iqbal as then Minister for Interior and Planning, Development & Reforms. content: === Students visit Pakistan Military Academy === Top Stories Students visit Pakistan Military Academy Top Stories Students visit Pakistan Military Academy Top Stories Students visit Pakistan Military Academy Top Stories Students visit Pakistan Military Academy NUST students from different student clubs and societies, accompanied by Mr Ali Hasnain Sayed, Director of Student Affairs & Counselling and Mr Iftikhar, Faculty Sponsor of NUST Fitness Club, visited Pakistan Military Academy on March 23, 2022, on a formal invitation to witness the Exhibition of PMA Clubs and Societies. The invitation was in lieu of collaboration between the PMA Cadets & NUST students to interact in activities of Clubs and Societies. === Startup Aawaz AI Tech Wins Innovator Seed Fund === Top Stories Startup Aawaz AI Tech Wins Innovator Seed Fund Top Stories Startup Aawaz AI Tech Wins Innovator Seed Fund Top Stories Startup Aawaz AI Tech Wins Innovator Seed Fund Top Stories Startup Aawaz AI Tech Wins Innovator Seed Fund NUST-based startup, Aawaz AI Tech, a dynamic and innovative startup at the forefront of cutting-edge AI technology, is thrilled to announce a major milestone in its journey. The contribution by Aawaz AI towards a secure and inclusive financial ecosystem in Pakistan was recognised during the Innovator Seed Fund (ISF) Challenge. The startup was awarded a $35,000 Innovator Seed Fund led by a consortium of esteemed organizations, including the Higher Education Commission (HEC), the Higher Education Development Program (HEDP), and the World Bank. NUST-based startup, Aawaz AI Tech, a dynamic and innovative startup at the forefront of cutting-edge AI technology, is thrilled to announce a major milestone in its journey. The contribution by Aawaz AI towards a secure and inclusive financial ecosystem in Pakistan was recognised during the Innovator Seed Fund (ISF) Challenge. The startup was awarded a $35,000 Innovator Seed Fund led by a consortium of esteemed organizations, including the Higher Education Commission (HEC), the Higher Education Development Program (HEDP), and the World Bank.

content: === NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 === Top Stories NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 Top Stories NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 Top Stories NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 Top Stories NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 NUST paid glowing tributes to its distinguished faculty and staff upon conferment of the prestigious Civil Awards 2023 by the President Islamic Republic of Pakistan, H.E Dr Arif Alvi. The Investiture Ceremony will take place on Pakistan Day, 23rd March, 2024. Meanwhile, Registrar NUST Engr Brig Muhammad Ashfaq Maitla has been conferred Sitara-e-Imtiaz (M), in recognition of his meritorious services during his illustrious career.

metadata.title: NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 | NUST

content: Dr Faisal Shafait from NUST School of Electrical Engineering & Computer Science (SEECS) and Dr Umar Shahbaz from NUST College of Electrical & Mechanical Engineering (CoEME) have been conferred the coveted Pride of Performance, while Dr M Usman Akram from CoEME, Dr Salman Raza Naqvi from NUST School of Chemical & Materials Engineering (SCME), Dr Haider Abbas from NUST Military College of Signals (MCS) and Ms Arooba Gillani from NUST Placement Office (NPO) have been conferred Tamgha-e-Imtiaz. The awards have been bestowed in recognition of their exceptional contributions to higher education, research and public service. On behalf of NUST, Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, extended heartiest felicitations to the excelling faculty and staff members, and expressed deep gratitude for their outstanding services to NUST and the nation at large.

metadata.title: NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 | NUST

content: Describing the award recipients as role models for present and future generations of scholars, scientists and change makers, he underscored that NUST’s esteemed reputation is largely built upon the continuous efforts of its committed human resources, whom he termed the university’s greatest asset. He affirmed that NUST is abundantly endowed with intellectually proficient and inventive minds, and hoped that they would continue living by their own legacy of excellence. Sharing their thoughts, the awardees thanked Rector and the NUST community for recognising their accomplishments, and attributed their success to the varsity for providing them with a supportive and facilitating environment. Dr Umar Shahbaz (Pride of Performance) is currently serving as a Professor at NUST CoEME. He is also the Director of National Centre of Robotics & Automation.

metadata.title: NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 | NUST

content: His major achievements include accreditation of Mechatronics Engineering as one of the first programmes under the Washington Accord (WA), which helped Pakistan Engineering Council become a signatory of WA; uplift of Robotics and Automation in the country; project fundraising of around PKR 585 million; development of Myo Prosthetic Upper Limb, which has been commercialised and is being widely used by patients; co-founder of two NUST approved spinoffs; author of 78 publications and so on. Dr Faisal Shafait (Pride of Performance) is working as a Professor & Associate Dean of Faculty of Computing at NUST SEECS. He is a world-renowned scientist in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. He has acquired more than 20 research grants worth over PKR 240 million. His research findings have been published in 58 journal papers, with a cumulative Impact Factor of 236, and more than 140 conference papers in reputed peer-reviewed international conferences.

metadata.title: NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 | NUST

content: He has an H-index of 54, and over 12,500 citations. Dr Salman Raza Naqvi (Tamgha-e-Imtiaz) is on the faculty of NUST School of Chemical & Materials Engineering (SCME). He is a truly accomplished academician and leading scientist with 178 (SCI) impact factor papers with total citation of 4307 and H-index of 37 as per Scopus database and WoS-JCR in the country. He has the highest number of research publications and research grants in the field of Chemical Engineering in Pakistan. He has also served as the Director of National Science & Technology Park, Pakistan’s first S&T park. Dr Usman Akram (Tamgha-e-Imtiaz) is currently serving at CEME. He is the Founder and Director of BIOMedical Image and Signal Analysis. He has over 300 international publications with an accumulated impact factor of 250+. To date, he has completed over PKR 100 million industrial and research projects and has secured 2 international and 5 national IPs.

metadata.title: NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 | NUST

content: He is also the recipient of Better World Project Award 2022 from Association of University Technology Managers, DC, Washington USA, and Salim-uz-Zaman Siddiqui Prize in Applied Science-Technology (2021) in Engineering Sciences for Scientists under 40 by Pakistan Academy of Sciences. Dr Haider Abbas (Tamgha-e-Imtiaz) is a leading Cyber Security expert at NUST MCS and is one of the leading academic figures in Pakistan. He has secured research grants of over PKR 300M, authored over 200 scientific research articles and book chapters (with cumulative Impact Factor 500+). He is also serving as a Technical Editor for many top journals published by the IEEE, Springer and Elsevier. The Prime Minster of Pakistan has recently appointed him to lead the very significant initiative of Cyber Security for Digital Pakistan. Ms Arooba Gilani (Tamgha-e-Imtiaz) is currently serving as GM Placements at NUST. She has made great efforts towards galvanising the youth into achieving their full potential.

metadata.title: NUST honours its recipients of Pakistan Civil Awards 2023 | NUST

content: The highlight of her contributions is the establishment of Japan Centre at NUST, which is aimed at employing young professionals from Pakistan to work in Japan. content: === NUST Formula Student Team clinched an overall 5th position in the Concept Class category in Formula Student UK 2023 === Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team clinched an overall 5th position in the Concept Class category in Formula Student UK 2023 Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team clinched an overall 5th position in the Concept Class category in Formula Student UK 2023 Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team clinched an overall 5th position in the Concept Class category in Formula Student UK 2023 Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team clinched an overall 5th position in the Concept Class category in Formula Student UK 2023 NUST Formula Student Team has once again demonstrated its engineering prowess and global competitiveness by participating in the prestigious Formula Student UK 2023, Concept Class. This renowned competition attracted top-notch teams from around the world and is considered the largest engineering competition on the global stage.

metadata.title: NUST Formula Student Team clinched an overall 5th position in the Concept Class category in Formula Student UK 2023 | NUST

content: Remarkably, NFST achieved a historic feat for Pakistan by becoming the first and only team from the country to secure a category victory in the LTS (Lap Time Simulation) Event. The team showcased their innovative and well-designed vehicle, earning them a commendable 6th position in the Design Event, while also excelling in the Cost and Manufacturing Event, securing another 6th position. With their exceptional performance in all aspects of the competition, NUST Formula Student Team clinched an outstanding overall 5th position in the Concept Class category, a remarkable achievement that solidifies their standing as one of the top teams in the international Formula Student circuit. This accomplishment reflects the team’s dedication, expertise, and determination in the field of automotive engineering. content: === Formula Electric Racing – NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 === Top Stories Formula Electric Racing – NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 Top Stories Formula Electric Racing – NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 Top Stories Formula Electric Racing – NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 Top Stories Formula Electric Racing – NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 The Formula Electric Racing – NUST Team from Pakistan Navy Engineering College, an esteemed constituent of NUST, left an indelible mark at the renowned Formula Student UK 2023 competition at Silverstone Circuit.

metadata.title: Formula Electric Racing - NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 | NUST

content: Amidst the fierce competition, this team emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class which is the main event, where teams compete with the cars they have designed and built. With participation from over 100+ teams worldwide, Formula Electric Racing-NUST demonstrated exceptional dedication and skill, achieving commendable rankings across various events in the competition. One of the standout achievements for the team was securing the 5th position in the Cost Event out of 100+ teams. Formula Electric Racing NUST was the only team from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region to become the finalist of the Cost Event. Their focus on cost-effective solutions and meticulous financial planning propelled them to the forefront. The team’s unwavering commitment to technical proficiency and adherence to safety regulations led to a commendable 10th position in the LTS (Lap Time Simulations) Event, 41st in the design event.

metadata.title: Formula Electric Racing - NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 | NUST

content: Formula Electric Racing NUST’s talent wasn’t limited to technical skills alone. In the BPP (Business Plan Presentation) Event, they displayed their business acumen and strategic thinking, securing an impressive 9th position. The culmination of their remarkable performance across various events resulted in securing an impressive 22nd position overall in the FSUK competition. This achievement epitomizes their commitment and determination to shine on a global platform. The success of Formula Electric Racing NUST would not have been possible without the support and guidance of its esteemed faculty members, the tireless efforts of the students, and the backing of their institution & sponsors. As the proud flag bearers of Pakistan Formula Electric Racing NUST has set a high standard for future motorsport engineering teams in the country and beyond.

metadata.title: Formula Electric Racing - NUST emerged as the sole representative from Pakistan and the entire South Asian region in FS Class in Formula Student UK 2023 | NUST

content: === Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan’s National Cybersecurity === Top Stories Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan’s National Cybersecurity Top Stories Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan’s National Cybersecurity Top Stories Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan’s National Cybersecurity Top Stories Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan’s National Cybersecurity NUST is delighted to share with you all the news of our very own Prof Dr Haider Abbas, who has been appointed by the Prime Minister of Pakistan as the Project Director (PPS-12) for Cybersecurity for Digital Pakistan. Dr Abbas will lead this newly established initiative, which will oversee the cybersecurity landscape in Pakistan. Dr Abbas, renowned for his extensive experience collaborating with academia and industry, is widely regarded as an esteemed authority in the field of Cyber Security. He obtained his MS and Ph.D.

metadata.title: Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan's National Cybersecurity | NUST

content: degrees from KTH-Sweden and pursued professional trainings and certifications from renowned institutions such as Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), United States, Stockholm University, and Stockholm School of Entrepreneurship, Sweden, and IBM, USA. He is duly recognized as a Certified Ethical Hacker by the EC Council. Additionally, Dr Abbas holds the distinction of being the founder and director of the National Cyber Security Auditing and Evaluation Lab (NCSAEL) at NUST. His remarkable contributions have earned him numerous accolades at the national and international level, including the NUST University Best Researcher Award, Research Productivity Award from Pakistan Council for Science and Technology, MCS-NUST Best Researcher Award, Asia-Pacific ICT Alliance Awards, P@SHA ICT Awards, as well as multiple best paper awards from prestigious entities like Elsevier and IEEE.

metadata.title: Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan's National Cybersecurity | NUST

content: Furthermore, Dr Abbas’ international professional excellence has led to his recognition as one of the youngest Fellows of The Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET), UK, a Fellow of The British Computer Society (BCS), UK, and a Fellow of The Institute of Science and Technology, UK. He has also been designated as an ACM Distinguished Speaker by the ACM, USA. The entire NUST Family extends their heartfelt congratulations to Drder Abbas on his appointment. We take great pride in his achievements. We firmly believe that your expertise in your new role will greatly benefit Pakistan. Additionally, Dr Abbas holds the distinction of being the founder and director of the National Cyber Security Auditing and Evaluation Lab (NCSAEL) at NUST.

metadata.title: Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan's National Cybersecurity | NUST

content: His remarkable contributions have earned him numerous accolades at the national and international level, including the NUST University Best Researcher Award, Research Productivity Award from Pakistan Council for Science and Technology, MCS-NUST Best Researcher Award, Asia-Pacific ICT Alliance Awards, P@SHA ICT Awards, as well as multiple best paper awards from prestigious entities like Elsevier and IEEE. Furthermore, Dr Abbas’ international professional excellence has led to his recognition as one of the youngest Fellows of The Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET), UK, a Fellow of The British Computer Society (BCS), UK, and a Fellow of The Institute of Science and Technology, UK. He has also been designated as an ACM Distinguished Speaker by the ACM, USA. The entire NUST Family extends their heartfelt congratulations to Drder Abbas on his appointment. We take great pride in his achievements.

metadata.title: Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan's National Cybersecurity | NUST

content: We firmly believe that your expertise in your new role will greatly benefit Pakistan.

metadata.title: Prof Dr Haider Abbas to lead Pakistan's National Cybersecurity | NUST

content: === Students of NICE obtain funding from Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives === Top Stories Students of NICE obtain funding from Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives Top Stories Students of NICE obtain funding from Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives Top Stories Students of NICE obtain funding from Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives Top Stories Students of NICE obtain funding from Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives We are elated to announce the remarkable achievement of the talented students of NUST Institute of Civil Engineering (NICE) in the prestigious ‘Pakistan Innovation Funding‘ competition.

metadata.title: Students of NICE obtain funding from Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives | NUST

content: Led by Raja Dilawar Riaz as the Group Leader and supported by Ammar Ali Arain, Usama Majid, and Muhammad Faizan, the team emerged victorious by obtaining funding from Ministry of Planning, Development and Special Initiatives, for their groundbreaking project, “Development of Large-Scale Concrete Printer” in Pakistan. Under the expert guidance of their project advisor Dr Muhammad Usman, HOD Structures & Survey Department and co-advisor Dr Jawad Aslam (SMME), the team’s innovative project aims to revolutionise Pakistan’s construction industry by introducing large-scale concrete printing technology. The team’s exceptional vision and the capabilities of their large-scale concrete printer garnered significant recognition during their final pitch before the Federal Minister of the Ministry of Planning Development & Special Initiatives and a distinguished panel of judges at Pakistan Television Network on June 22, 2023.

metadata.title: Students of NICE obtain funding from Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives | NUST

content: As a result, they have been selected for the final award of Pakistan Innovation Funding amongst over 1000 applications from all over the country. NUST takes immense pride in the achievements of its students and the exceptional education and research opportunities provided. This success highlights the institution’s commitment to fostering innovation and excellence in the field of research. content: === Students from NUST Airworks team based at PNEC, Karachi represent Pakistan in Teknofest 2023 === Top Stories Students from NUST Airworks team based at PNEC, Karachi represent Pakistan in Teknofest 2023 Top Stories Students from NUST Airworks team based at PNEC, Karachi represent Pakistan in Teknofest 2023 Top Stories Students from NUST Airworks team based at PNEC, Karachi represent Pakistan in Teknofest 2023 Top Stories Students from NUST Airworks team based at PNEC, Karachi represent Pakistan in Teknofest 2023 The team of students belonging to NUST Airworks based at Pakistan Navy Engineering College (PNEC) was the sole representative of Pakistan at Teknofest 2023 and once again distinguished themselves with their outstanding project. They won the Performance Award and a cash prize from TÜBITAK for their hybrid VTOL configuration tasked with an autonomous mission that can be deployed for search and rescue missions, as well as rescue aid deliveries to disaster-struck areas.

metadata.title: Students from NUST Airworks team based at PNEC, Karachi represent Pakistan in Teknofest 2023 | NUST

content: The mission was designed to solve practical issues, keeping in mind the recent earthquakes in Türkiye. The team demonstrated its commitment to innovation and addressing real-world challenges by focusing on building drones that can land on any platform without a runway. The team is able to implement such complicated and intricate missions in their UAV through the use of the latest technology and flight controllers provided by their Avionics Sponsor, CUAV. The Teknofest competition, held this year in Bursa by the Turkish government, provided the team with an opportunity to showcase their project and overcome three challenges related to team awareness, flight checks, and a real flight on the runway. The team’s success in the competition led to a meeting with Selçuk Bayraktar, the CTO of Baykar Drones, and the Minister of Turkish Science and Technology, TÜBITAK, Hassan Mandal, as well as other influential personalities.

metadata.title: Students from NUST Airworks team based at PNEC, Karachi represent Pakistan in Teknofest 2023 | NUST

content: The exposure allowed the team to learn from some of the best minds in the industry and expand their knowledge and skills. The entire #NUSTFamily is proud of team Air Works, and we wish them the best of luck for their future endeavours. content: === Dr. Aneela Javed wins the Knowledge2Action small grant for 2023 === Top Stories Dr. Aneela Javed wins the Knowledge2Action small grant for 2023 Top Stories Dr. Aneela Javed wins the Knowledge2Action small grant for 2023 Top Stories Dr. Aneela Javed wins the Knowledge2Action small grant for 2023 Top Stories Dr. Aneela Javed wins the Knowledge2Action small grant for 2023 Dr. Aneela Javed, an esteemed faculty member at the Atta-ur-Rahman School of Applied Biosciences (ASAB) at NUST has been awarded the Knowledge2Action (K2A) small grant for the year 2023. The grant, titled “My Health My Decision: Advancing Women Empowerment in Pakistan,” will concentrate on raising awareness among women in specific rural regions of the country regarding sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) and effective strategies for their control, with the objective of mitigating the social stigma associated with such diseases.

metadata.title: Dr. Aneela Javed wins the Knowledge2Action small grant for 2023 | NUST

content: The Knowledge2Action program is financially supported by Swiss Universities and jointly led by Haute école de travail social Fribourg (HETS-FR) and the Université de Lausanne (UNIL). The selection of projects for this program was based on their academic research content, transformed into tools/processes that facilitate the promotion, advocacy, and implementation of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), with a focus on translating research into tangible actions. content: === Professor at S3H wins Research Grant 2023 through Global Challenges Research Fund === Top Stories Professor at S3H wins Research Grant 2023 through Global Challenges Research Fund Top Stories Professor at S3H wins Research Grant 2023 through Global Challenges Research Fund Top Stories Professor at S3H wins Research Grant 2023 through Global Challenges Research Fund Top Stories Professor at S3H wins Research Grant 2023 through Global Challenges Research Fund Dr Umer Khayyam (Associate Professor S3H) has won Research Grant 2023 from UK’s Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (through the Global Challenges Research Fund-GCRF). This is the continuation of an earlier won grant and the achievements ( in the year 2020/21) on which this grant is awarded. This grant project focuses on the professional writing program to support Global South-Pakistani early careers in publishing research on climate change vulnerability.

metadata.title: Professor at S3H wins Research Grant 2023 through Global Challenges Research Fund | NUST

content: Pakistani scholars will get strategic support and resources to amplify the impact of both their academic writing (journals and OpEDs) and knowledge exchange activities with the global North. === NUST Ascends 14 Spots to Rank #353 in QS World University Rankings 2025 === Top Stories NUST Ascends 14 Spots to Rank #353 in QS World University Rankings 2025 Top Stories NUST Ascends 14 Spots to Rank #353 in QS World University Rankings 2025 Top Stories NUST Ascends 14 Spots to Rank #353 in QS World University Rankings 2025 Top Stories NUST Ascends 14 Spots to Rank #353 in QS World University Rankings 2025 Demonstrating phenomenal progress in the global rankings, the National University of Sciences & Technology (NUST-Pakistan) has ascended 14 places to stand at #353, as per QS World University Rankings 2025. NUST has made significant headway in key performance metrics, improving 100 positions in Sustainability, 86 positions in International Research Network, 54 positions in Citations per Faculty, and 42 positions in Academic Reputation.

metadata.title: NUST Ascends 14 Spots to Rank #353 in QS World University Rankings 2025 | NUST

content: Lt Gen (Retd) Engr Javed Mahmood Bukhari, Rector NUST, has attributed the improvement in the varsity’s global ranking to the dedicated efforts of its faculty and staff along with the hard work of students. He further said, “As NUST celebrates this impressive milestone, it reaffirms its commitment to excellence and innovation in education and research.” With a diverse community of scholars and learners, NUST is committed to excellence in transformative learning, disruptive research and innovation, and collaborative partnerships. content: === NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams === Top Stories NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams Top Stories NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams Top Stories NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams Top Stories NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams With immense pleasure it is announced that The Team from NUST Law Department Participated in the Sports Arbitration Moot Court Competition, held at the Madrid International Arbitration Centre, Spain and clinched the top award of “The Best Appellant Team” ranking 1st among 66 participating teams to represent the Appellant (The World Anti-Doping Agency) from all accross the globe mainly from USA, China, Spain, Australia, France, Switzerland, Singapore, India, Netherlands, Sweden, Georgia, Morocco, Mexico, Brazil, Norway, Portugal, Serbia, South Africa etc.

metadata.title: NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams | NUST

content: The team also qualified to the Semi Finals of the moot court while being the first-ever and the only team from Pakistan to represent in Sports Law and be present at the Elimination Rounds of the competition. This team was comprised of Areej Anwar, M. Ayaan Shehryar, Waleed Shehzad, Ayesha Akber, along with Faculty Coach Haziq Ali Khan and International Coach Emiliano Olivetti from Argentina. The Round of Sixteen and Quarterfinals took place at two different locations, which are the prestigious leading law firms Cuatrecasas and Uría Menéndez in Madrid, Spain. The Semi-Final and Final took place at the Palacio de Santoña (Madrid International Arbitration Centre). This is the very first time that a team from Pakistan has made it this achievement at international level, specifically in the field of Arbitration.

metadata.title: NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams | NUST

content: With immense pleasure it is announced that The Team from NUST Law Department Participated in the Sports Arbitration Moot Court Competition, held at the Madrid International Arbitration Centre, Spain and clinched the top award of “The Best Appellant Team” ranking 1st among 66 participating teams to represent the Appellant (The World Anti-Doping Agency) from all accross the globe mainly from USA, China, Spain, Australia, France, Switzerland, Singapore, India, Netherlands, Sweden, Georgia, Morocco, Mexico, Brazil, Norway, Portugal, Serbia, South Africa etc. The team also qualified to the Semi Finals of the moot court while being the first-ever and the only team from Pakistan to represent in Sports Law and be present at the Elimination Rounds of the competition. This team was comprised of Areej Anwar, M. Ayaan Shehryar, Waleed Shehzad, Ayesha Akber, along with Faculty Coach Haziq Ali Khan and International Coach Emiliano Olivetti from Argentina.

metadata.title: NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams | NUST

content: The Round of Sixteen and Quarterfinals took place at two different locations, which are the prestigious leading law firms Cuatrecasas and Uría Menéndez in Madrid, Spain. The Semi-Final and Final took place at the Palacio de Santoña (Madrid International Arbitration Centre). This is the very first time that a team from Pakistan has made it this achievement at international level, specifically in the field of Arbitration. With immense pleasure it is announced that The Team from NUST Law Department Participated in the Sports Arbitration Moot Court Competition, held at the Madrid International Arbitration Centre, Spain and clinched the top award of “The Best Appellant Team” ranking 1st among 66 participating teams to represent the Appellant (The World Anti-Doping Agency) from all accross the globe mainly from USA, China, Spain, Australia, France, Switzerland, Singapore, India, Netherlands, Sweden, Georgia, Morocco, Mexico, Brazil, Norway, Portugal, Serbia, South Africa etc.

metadata.title: NUST Law Team Triumphs at Madrid Sports Arbitration Moot, Secures First Place Among 66 Global Teams | NUST

content: The team also qualified to the Semi Finals of the moot court while being the first-ever and the only team from Pakistan to represent in Sports Law and be present at the Elimination Rounds of the competition. This team was comprised of Areej Anwar, M. Ayaan Shehryar, Waleed Shehzad, Ayesha Akber, along with Faculty Coach Haziq Ali Khan and International Coach Emiliano Olivetti from Argentina. The Round of Sixteen and Quarterfinals took place at two different locations, which are the prestigious leading law firms Cuatrecasas and Uría Menéndez in Madrid, Spain. The Semi-Final and Final took place at the Palacio de Santoña (Madrid International Arbitration Centre). This is the very first time that a team from Pakistan has made it this achievement at international level, specifically in the field of Arbitration.

content: === NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 === Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 Top Stories NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 The NUST Formula Student Team proudly unveiled their latest innovation, the “NAS HV 2024,” a cutting-edge hybrid vehicle set to compete in the prestigious Formula Student UK 2024 Event at Silverstone. The unveiling took place at the Beach Luxury Hotel, marking a significant milestone for Pakistani engineering and automotive excellence.

metadata.title: NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 | NUST

content: Fabricated by the talented undergraduate students of PNEC NUST, the NAS HV 2024 represents the culmination of months of dedication, ingenuity, and teamwork. With a top speed of approximately 220 KM/hr. this marvel of engineering features a hybrid system powered by a CBR 600 F4i Engine and a dual motor setup on the front wheel, all within a sleek and lightweight frame weighing just 280 kg. The unveiling event was graced by esteemed guests including Governor Sindh Kamran Tessori , and PNEC Commandant Commodore Tauqeer Ahmed Khwaja SI(M), who commended the remarkable achievements of the NUST students. Governor Sindh expressed delight at the progress and success of the students, announcing a special dinner in honor of the entire team along with the prestigious Governor’s Gold Medal.

metadata.title: NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 | NUST

content: Commandant PNEC echoed Governor Sindh’s sentiments, emphasizing Pakistan Navy Engineering College’s commitment to excellence, and recognizing the NUST Formula Student Team as a source of pride and inspiration for engineering students nationwide. Attended by representatives from various industries, academia, and government offices, the unveiling event showcased Pakistan’s potential to innovate and compete on a global scale in the field of automotive engineering. The NAS HV 2024 stands as a testament to the skill, determination, and vision of the NUST Formula Student Team, solidifying their position as leaders in the realm of motorsport innovation. As they gear up to represent Pakistan on the international stage, the team’s journey embodies the spirit of progress and excellence driving the nation forward.

metadata.title: NUST Formula Student Team Unveils State-of-the-Art Hybrid Vehicle for Formula Student UK 2024 | NUST

content: === NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework === Top Stories NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework Top Stories NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework Top Stories NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework Top Stories NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework NUST School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science faculty members Professor Dr Rafia Mumtaz (Principal Investigator), Professor Dr. Ali Hassan (Co-PI) & Dr. Muhamad Daud Abdullah Asif (Co-PI) is teaming up with partners under the ERASMUS+ framework aimed at transforming cardiac healthcare in Pakistan through TeleCardio. This innovative initiative addresses the pressing need for swift and effective diagnostic and treatment approaches for cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), which account for a significant portion of mortality in the country.

metadata.title: NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework | NUST

content: Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) are a major concern in Pakistan, but traditional ECG methods often fall short due to slow analysis and limited accessibility. TeleCardio: a game-changer that combines cutting-edge tech and AI for real-time monitoring and analysis of heart rhythms! With TeleCardio, swift and accurate diagnoses are on the horizon, promising to save lives and reduce the burden of CVDs across the nation! Let’s applaud this innovative collaboration for paving the way to a healthier Pakistan! NUST School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science faculty members Professor Dr Rafia Mumtaz (Principal Investigator), Professor Dr. Ali Hassan (Co-PI) & Dr. Muhamad Daud Abdullah Asif (Co-PI) is teaming up with partners under the ERASMUS+ framework aimed at transforming cardiac healthcare in Pakistan through TeleCardio.

metadata.title: NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework | NUST

content: This innovative initiative addresses the pressing need for swift and effective diagnostic and treatment approaches for cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), which account for a significant portion of mortality in the country. Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) are a major concern in Pakistan, but traditional ECG methods often fall short due to slow analysis and limited accessibility. TeleCardio: a game-changer that combines cutting-edge tech and AI for real-time monitoring and analysis of heart rhythms! With TeleCardio, swift and accurate diagnoses are on the horizon, promising to save lives and reduce the burden of CVDs across the nation! Let’s applaud this innovative collaboration for paving the way to a healthier Pakistan!

metadata.title: NUST Collaborates on TeleCardio Initiative Under ERASMUS+ Framework | NUST

=== NUST Leadership and Sultan Family Strengthen Ties to Advance Educational Development and Collaboration === Top Stories NUST Leadership and Sultan Family Strengthen Ties to Advance Educational Development and Collaboration Top Stories NUST Leadership and Sultan Family Strengthen Ties to Advance Educational Development and Collaboration Top Stories NUST Leadership and Sultan Family Strengthen Ties to Advance Educational Development and Collaboration Top Stories NUST Leadership and Sultan Family Strengthen Ties to Advance Educational Development and Collaboration In a bid to advance education and foster impactful connections, Rector NUST Engr Javed Mehmood Bukhari, Pro Rector for Research, Innovation, and Commercialization Dr Rizwan Riaz, and Ms Arooba Gillani, Director of Advancement and Head of Global Engagements, recently held a productive and interactive meeting with the Sultan Family.

metadata.title: NUST Leadership and Sultan Family Strengthen Ties to Advance Educational Development and Collaboration | NUST

content: This meeting was an important step in nurturing the long-term support and contributions of the Sultan Family to the NUST Endowment for Educational Development (NEED) Initiative. The Sultan Family, including Mr Zafar Sultan, Resource Mobilization Officer, and Mr Sohail Sultan, CEO of iiB—a leading Bank Holding Company with investments in commercial and retail banking across Africa, the Middle East, and South Asia—attended the meeting. During the session, both parties engaged in meaningful discussions about potential avenues for collaboration. The focus was on exploring mutually beneficial opportunities to enhance knowledge exchange and maximize the impact of their combined efforts in educational development. The meeting underscored the commitment of both NUST and the Sultan Family to advancing educational initiatives and solidifying their partnership for future growth and success.
